description: Company DescriptionGiacom is the only provider of Comms, Cloud, Hardware and Billing through one platform.Our platform connects technology resellers and service providers to the best IT, Comms and Cloud products and services so they can create brilliant technology solutions for UK businesses.We have a comprehensive portfolio of technology products and services that gives our partners the competitive advantage to build bigger and more successful businesses by providing their customers with the best solutions and customer experience possible.We value diversity and inclusivity above all else, creating an environment where our team members can be their whole selves, every day. We believe that by embracing different perspectives and backgrounds, we can truly make a difference and shape a better future.Are you ready to join us in our mission to supercharge UK business growth through technology enablement?Job DescriptionDepartment: Central Data TeamSalary: Competitive salary + Comprehensive benefits packageLocation: Hybrid - Nelson or Hessle (minimum 3 days a week in office)Role OverviewThe Central Data team has been developed to be the single point of truth about the partner across the total business. Using data lead findings, we can harness the vital power of our data to deliver strong, profitable, and meaningful recommendations and actions that will continue to drive greater revenue for the business and improved experiences for our partners.In essence the data team is a centralised place where KPIs can evaluate the variations across the three brands, highlighting the strengths of each and the areas for suggested improvements.As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for scoping, designing, and implementing data engineering and data architecture elements of use cases, reviewing, and assuring the technical feasibility of solutions and identifying technical skills required to deliver and support them. As a technical leader, you will write, deploy, and maintain code, help monitor cloud resource spend, peer review code enforcing standards and best practice, help design delivery roadmaps and plans, build, and maintain effective stakeholder relationships, driving improvements and business value.In this role, you will develop knowledge of best-in-class AWS cloud data and analytics solutions, staying well-informed of industry best-practice and new technologies.You will support the team by leading, coaching, developing and mentoring squad members, creating positive engagement and driving an inclusive work environment.Responsibilities & AccountabilitiesParticipate in efforts to design, build, and develop rapid Proof-of-Concept (POC) solutions and services. Build data pipelines to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using different AWS products such as Lambda, Glue, Lake Formation, Athena, EMR. Maintain and enhance existing data pipelines. Interface with cross functional teams, gathering requirements and delivering data solutions. Proactively identify and implement opportunities to automate tasks and develop reusable frameworks. Contribute to the exploration and understanding of new tools and techniques and propose improvements to the data pipeline. Implement standardized, automated operational and quality control processes to deliver accurate and timely data and reporting to meet or exceed SLAs. Collaborate with the other engineering team members to ensure all services are reliable, maintainable, and well-integrated into existing platforms. Review functional and technical designs to identify areas of risk and/or missing requirements. Support the team by leading, coaching, developing and mentoring squad. Provide technical write-ups and drawings to promote the proposed solutions. Working understanding of Agile, Scrum, Design Thinking, and Lean Startup principles. QualificationsStrong experience with data engineering using AWS data stack. Strong experience with Python. Strong Experience with SQL or PL/SQLExperience with Databricks, Spark. Experience building data products incrementally and integrating and managing data sets from multiple sources. Proficiency in the DevOps style of software deployment (infrastructure-as-code) using Terraform/Terragrunt. Deep hands-on experience designing, planning, productionizing, maintaining, and documenting reliable and scalable data infrastructure and data products in complex environments. Familiar with software DevOps CI/CD tools, such Git, Jenkins, Linux, and Shell ScripExperience with concepts such as Data Marts, Data Warehouses, Data Lakes. Additional InformationFirstly, we believe in giving you the freedom to be yourself. Say goodbye to rigid dress codes and embrace your individuality. We encourage you to be yourself at work, allowing you to thrive in an environment that celebrates your uniqueness.We believe in equality and diversity. As an equal opportunities and disability confident employer, we encourage applications from all eligible candidates, regardless of their background. We embrace diversity and believe that a rich variety of perspectives strengthens our team and leads to greater innovation.If you've read our advert and it has sparked your interest in joining the Giacom team, but you're still unsure if it's the ideal fit for you, don't hesitate to apply expressing your interest. We would be delighted to hear from you and have a conversation about all the exciting opportunities we have to offer. Your exploration of possibilities starts with reaching out to us, and we can't wait to connect with you.And the Giacom benefits…?From 25 days of holidays, to a pension plan, we've got you covered. And here's a special treat – you'll enjoy an additional day off around your birthday.We care about your well-being and engagement. That's why we have a dedicated team focused on ensuring your well-being and satisfaction at work. We want you to feel supported and empowered every step of the way.Recognition is important to us. We believe in acknowledging your hard work and achievements. That's why we organise team and industry events to celebrate your successes and foster a sense of camaraderie among our team members.We also provide an Employee Assistance Programme, helping you maintain your well-being and providing support when you need it. Professional development opportunities are available to help you achieve your personal goals, and we even offer eye care vouchers and discounted Medicash membership.So, if you're looking for a rewarding career with a market leader that values you and provides a range of incredible benefits, look no further. Join us at Giacom and embark on a journey of personal and professional growth. Take the first step by applying today and discover the exciting opportunities that await you.For more information on our Recruitment privacy notice, please follow this link and select option 8 to view - https://giacom.com/help/privacy-and-cookies-policy

Based in Cambridge the Data Scientist / Engineer will be joining an exciting organisation to work in the field of Medical Sequencing The Data Scientist will be joining a cloud engineering group working to unlock the value of the data generated within the business. Responsibilities will include the design, build and operation of their data lake and data pipeline architecture to support scientist and engineers to make data driven decisions.This opportunity would suit a candidate from a variety of backgrounds, including Data Science, Machine Learning, Bioinformatic or Computational Biology.The successful candidate will have a good relevant Degree, ideally a PhD in a STEM field, ideally with some commercial experience or PhD level research in Data Science or Engineering.Other areas of interest include:• Advanced SQL, with some R, or Python• AWS / Cloud experience• BioinformaticsThe company offer a very exciting opportunity to work on ground breaking technology, career development, a good salary, benefits and also share options. Please get in touch for more information or apply.

Company DescriptionLGC is a leading, global life science tools company, providing mission-critical components and solutions into high-growth application areas across the human healthcare and applied market segments. Its high-quality product portfolio is comprised of mission-critical tools for genomic analysis and for quality assurance applications, which are typically embedded and recurring within our customers’ products and workflows and are valued for their performance, quality, and range.Job DescriptionWe are actively looking for individuals that are passionate about making a difference and have an opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer to join our central Group Data & Analytics team.Design and develop processes for acquiring data from disparate data sources using innovative methods (e.g. API, streaming). Design, development, and optimisation of the Group Data Platform (GDF) to meet business requirements. Design data models and metadata systems to enable analysts to work more effectively with the data products we produce. Data & Process discovery on source systems to build best possible data acquisition processes. Ensure that new and existing and technical implementations continue to perform against agreed performance metrics. Contribute to selection and recommendation of new analytical tools matching requirements and/or analytics strategy. Researching and understanding impact of emerging technologies on the organisation and how they might best be introduced for wider usage. Maintain CI/CD pipelines and champion DataOps as a discipline. QualificationsDegree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar Analytical discipline or equivalent experience. Extensive, demonstrable experience of Structure Query Language (SQL). Extensive, demonstrable experience of dbt. Extensive, demonstrable experience of Snowflake and its concepts. Advanced experience in delivering Python applications and data pipelines. Experience working in a hybrid cloud enabled end-to-end data architecture. Comprehensive knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques used in end-to-end analytical model design and development. Ability to have pragmatic conversations with non-technical end users to discover how existing business processes influence the flow of data and thus the design of the Group Data Foundation (GDF). Ability to multi-task and follow through on assignments to completion. Ability to work in a pressurised, changing environment with strong focus on high quality and timely delivery of outputs. Ability to work effectively in virtual, interdisciplinary teams as well as to work autonomously, take initiative and make things happen. Passion for handling, analysing and transforming large, complex data sets into workable information sets. Desirable:Demonstrable experience of implementing Data Vault 2.0 on Snowflake. AWS platform enablement for Data & Analytics. Additional InformationOUR VALUESPASSIONCURIOSITY INTEGRITYBRILLIANCERESPECTEQUAL OPPORTUNITIES LGC strongly believes that every job applicant and employee should be valued for their individual talents regardless of age, disability, race, color, ethnic or national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marital or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Short listing, interviewing and selection will always be carried out without regard to gender, sexual orientation, marital status, color, race, nationality, ethnic or national origins, religion or belief, age, or trade union membership.For more information about LGC, please visit our website www.lgcgroup.com#scienceforasaferworld

Excited to be working with a Fintech Lender which is at the forefront of the Fintech revolution, offering innovative lending solutions that empower individuals and businesses to achieve their financial goals. Their recent substantial round of investment has catapulted them into a new phase of growth, following what was already some great consistent growth, averaging 12% YoY. As they expand, they're committed to building a world-class data function and are looking for talented Data Engineers to join the dynamic team.As a Data Engineer, you'll be instrumental in building and maintaining the infrastructure necessary to unlock the full potential of data. Working with cutting-edge technologies and a highly motivated team, your efforts will directly impact the company’s ability to make data-informed decisions, enhance customer experiences, and drive the fast-growing business's future success.Key Responsibilities:Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines for gathering, transforming, and storing data from various sources.Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to ensure data availability for analytical purposes.Optimise data quality and reliability by troubleshooting data-related issues.Implement best practices for data security and compliance.Contribute to the development of data warehousing and storage solutions.Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritise data requirements.Stay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies to propose and implement improvements in our data infrastructure.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.Proven experience in data engineering, ETL processes, and data modelling.Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).Familiarity with big data technologies, including Hadoop, Spark, or similar.Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.Strong attention to detail and commitment to data quality.Prior experience in the fintech industry is a plus.Why Join:Fast-Growing Business: They are in the midst of an exciting phase of growth, offering you the opportunity to make a significant impact as we expand the data function.Cutting-Edge Technology: You will work with state-of-the-art technologies and tools, enabling you to continuously enhance your skills and knowledge.Data-Driven Culture: The business is deeply committed to leveraging data to drive our decision-making, which means your role will be central to our success.Professional Development: They support and encourage your professional growth through ongoing training and development opportunities.Competitive Compensation: They offer a competitive salary and benefits package.Dynamic Team: Join a highly motivated and collaborative team of professionals who are passionate about what they do.Office Perks: Breakfast options, spacious desk spaces and… FREE FRUIT!! (the true essentials, am I right?)If you possess relevant experience and are ready to take the next step in your career as a Data Engineer, we invite you to apply now and be part of an exciting journey.If this would be an interesting opportunity for you my email is lily.stoner@interquestgroup.com

Make your mark on a huge migration project from Markit EDM to Aladdin Data Cloud.This is a 12-month piece of work where you’ll be providing your services for the integration part of Aladdin into current existing systems. All data for the new system will be integrated using Snowflake, so you’ll use your Snowflake expertise to deliver the project within the timelines set out in the SOW.This is an asset management firm where there’s a mixture of in-house built and off the shelf solutions, so having a flexible approach to development and a high level of problem-solving ability will be key during this migration project. You’ll be part of the Snowflake section of the project delivering various aspects of Snowflake in Azure, working closely with the CTO and wider project teams.You’ll be part of a large migration project and you’ll gain fantastic experience of delivering this brand-new platform within the business.You must have strong Snowflake experience and ideally experience of working within asset management. Finance experience is a must have. Strong knowledge in Azure fundamentals is also required.You must be able to start on 1st November in line with project go-live and it will be for 12-months, OUTSIDE IR35. Rate will be up to £700 per day.Get in touch for more information. No up-to-date CV required.

Graduate/Junior Machine Learning Software Engineer - London (flexible 100% remote work or hybrid)Machine Learning Software Engineer, Data Science, Data Scientist, Computer Vision, Text Mining, Deep Learning, Python, C++, Big Data.An innovative and highly successful technology company is seeking exceptionally strong graduates from leading universities (Imperial, Cambridge University and Oxford University etc.) to join their talented and rapidly growing Machine Learning Software Engineering team.This is an opportunity to develop your skills and start your career within a company that offers huge potential for growth. You will be learning innovative technology whilst developing cutting-edge machine learning algorithms. The company is developing one of the leading software products within cybersecurity which have already won many awards and global competitions.IDEAL CANDIDATE Degree from a leading university (I.e. Imperial, Cambridge, Oxford) and standout academics Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, AI etc. preferred Some knowledge of Machine Learning will be beneficial but there is full training Strong programming skills Good software development practices.Please apply straight away if interested as this role will be very popular! Machine Learning Software Engineer, Data Science, Data Scientist, Computer Vision, Text Mining, Deep Learning, Python, C++, Big Data.Graduate/Junior Machine Learning Software Engineer - London (flexible 100% remote work or hybrid)

Data Engineer - Azure - Hybrid WorkingLocation: W1D 2DH 🌎Working Arrangements: Hybrid (2-3 days a week on-site)Salary: £50,000 - £60,000Industry: MediaTech Stack: Azure, SQL, T-SQL, PowerBI 👩🏻‍💻 Great opportunity for a talented Data Engineer (SQL, Azure) to join a media company helping their clients reach specific target audiences.The Company 🚀Innovative media/adtech business who have built their own bespoke platform that is used by the likes of McDonald's, Volkswagen, Starbucks, Puma and more.The Role ✨They are seeking a Data Engineer (SQL, Azure) to help maintain their existing platform and build out new ETL pipelines in collaboration with Data Analysts.You will be expected to contribute to data quality (SQL, Azure) as well as working on new pipelines, automation tooling, infrastructure and documenting lineage.Desired Skills ⚙️AzureSQL, T-SQLPowerBIBigQueryPython (bonus but not a necessity)Benefits 🏖Flexible workingPension, Life Assurance, Health InsuranceEnhanced parental leaveIf you are a skilled Data Engineer (SQL, Azure) who is interested in this role then please apply below and I will be in touch with more details.

Data EngineerLocation: London, Bristol, Manchester or HarwellSalary: Up to £45,000.Hybrid: 2/3 days in any of the above officesBenefits: Extensive benebenefitskage including flexible working arrangements, generous pension scheme, 28 days annual leave and learning and development courses.As a Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in delivering top-notch management and support for the products and services offered by the Digital Resources Directorate. This team is responsible for establishing the necessary technical infrastructure to underpin our operations, leveraging their domain-specific data expertise within our sectors, and embracing innovative technologies and professional standards.This newly established role is crucial for advancing our client's data capabilities. It encompasses tasks such as designing and implementing databases, overseeing cloud-based infrastructure management, integrating data from diverse sources, crafting schemas to bring data models to life, and actively participating in the continuous enhancement of our data services.Responsibilities will include:• Design, build and maintain databases, schemas, and query indexes• Select and utilise appropriate cloud solutions for data storage and processing• Develop new ETL (extract, transform, load) pipelines and write documented and optimised ETL scripts• Work with enterprise platforms (e.g. Mulesoft) to specify, develop and document APIs to meet business needs. Ensure appropriate security and access controls align with data governance strategy• Support non-technical stakeholders with data collation tasks by integrating data from a wide range of sources to produce meaningful spreadsheets, reports, visualisations or databasesKey Skills and Experience as a Data Engineer:• Demonstrable experience of designing, implementing and administrating relational databases• Scripting languages such as python and working with APIs; configuration languages such as RAML or YAML• Strong knowledge of good security and data governance practices• Ability to work with project teams across multiple parts of an organisation to deliver requirements in a collaborative and timely mannerIf you have a passionate Data Engineer with a willing to learn and develop your skills, and match the description above then please apply with a copy of your CV to nathan.ward@networkitr.co.uk

Data Engineer ( Azure / Kafka / Databricks )Remote / WFH3-6 Months initial contract£500-550 / Day (Outside IR35)November Start DateWe are seeking a Data Engineer with expertise in Azure, Kafka, and Databricks to join our Financial Services Company to play a critical role in integrating modern cloud technologies with our existing legacy systems.As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines, enabling the company to leverage data for critical business decisions. If you are a passionate, results-oriented individual with expertise in Azure, Kafka, Databricks, SQL, PySpark, and have a strong background in consulting and integrations, we encourage you to apply.This initial contract offers remote work and the possibility of extension based on performance and project requirements.Required skills and experience for the Data Engineer includes: Proven experience as a Data Engineer in a similar role, preferably in the financial services industry.Strong expertise in Azure cloud technologies and services.Proficiency with Kafka for data streaming and real-time processing.Experience with Databricks for data analytics and machine learning.Excellent SQL skills for data manipulation and querying.Proficiency in PySpark for data processing and transformation.Prior consulting experience, especially in data engineering or integration projects.Demonstrated ability to design and implement data integrations.Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.Knowledge of data warehousing and data modeling concepts.Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks in a dynamic environment.Desired skills and experience for the Data Engineer includes:Azure Data Engineer CertifiedDatabricks Certified

We are Metavoice- an AI research and product company!What we do:We are building an open-source, foundational model that can listen, understand and speak in any language and voice. Our model will be able to transcribe audio, synthesise speech via text, dub content, enhance speech quality and more.Why we do it:We believe the future is personalised — every piece of digital content we create and consume will be personalised to our preferences and needs. We are starting with speech - the most primal, personal and expressive form of communication.About the opportunity:As a Founding Data Engineer, you’ll pay a critical role in:Building towards our mission to create a transformational impact in societyOur future company cultureThe direction and focus of our productsOur engineering & research practicesThe hiring decisions as you grow a team around youAbout the role:The role entails leading the design and execution of an end-to-end data strategy for petabyte-scale audio and text data. You'll build scalable infrastructure for data storage and batch processing while developing high-throughput pipelines for data transformation and filtering. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with the research team to support machine learning initiatives.You should have proven experience with scalable data infrastructure, especially involving batch processing of terabyte/petabyte-scale data.We offer:Competitive salary & equity: we offer market compensation at the 90th percentile.Visa sponsorship: we want to ensure there’s no limits to get the best talent and we recognise the importance of diverse backgrounds and therefore ideasFlexible and enabling in-person culture: we are not a cult nor clock watchers, you know best what you need to do to deliver resultsFull medical, dental and vision insurance: just as our product, our health is multimodal and every component should be taken care ofCatered lunches: did we mention we are foodies?Support for your personal and professional growth: in form of flexible hours, access to our mentors, team activitiesWho we are:We are a small, in-person product-focused team that likes to ship fast, learn and iterate. We’re not afraid to experiment and challenge the status quo. The team previously built the 1st generative voice for Amazon Alexa, self-driving cars & noise-cancellation at Bose. We believe nothing is impossible and we are now looking to personalise the world of speech - the most primal, personal and expressive form of communication.We’re backed by top tier US and European VCs and angels like ex-CTO of CoinBase, ex-VP of Twitter, and others.If you’d like to learn more, please feel free to reach out to careers@themetavoice.xyz.

Senior Azure Databricks Engineer - Energy Trading - Up to £800/day (Inside IR35) - Hybrid (2-3 days) 6 Months Initially - London Key Skills: - Experience in Data Warehousing and Data Engineering using Microsoft StackExperience in Azure Cloud Data Engineering using Azure DatabricksExperience with Energy Markets especially within Trading, Credit and Market Risk functions.Experience with Azure Databricks and knowledge of PySpark clusters is a must.Experience with Databricks Workflows and Unity Catalog setups in a multi-domain environment for unified governance for data, analytics and PowerBI accesses.Exposure of Data Points, Data Points History, DeltaLake, Databricks SQL, Dataflow, Datamart solutionsExperience with data model management for reporting (Power BI) using Delta Live Tables and implementing a Star Schema in Databricks with Delta Lake

Company DescriptionGiacom is the only provider of Comms, Cloud, Hardware and Billing through one platform.Our platform connects technology resellers and service providers to the best IT, Comms and Cloud products and services so they can create brilliant technology solutions for UK businesses.We have a comprehensive portfolio of technology products and services that gives our partners the competitive advantage to build bigger and more successful businesses by providing their customers with the best solutions and customer experience possible.We value diversity and inclusivity above all else, creating an environment where our team members can be their whole selves, every day. We believe that by embracing different perspectives and backgrounds, we can truly make a difference and shape a better future.Are you ready to join us in our mission to supercharge UK business growth through technology enablement?Job DescriptionDepartment: Data and AnalyticsSalary: up to £50,000 dependent on experience + Comprehensive benefits packageLocation: Hybrid - Southampton, Nelson or Hessle (minimum 3 days a week in office)Role OverviewThe Data and Analytics Team is a new team at the heart of supporting Giacom’s ambition to become a truly data driven business. Data needs to be treated as a valuable business asset and to do this we need to ensure we have a strong understanding of, and derive value from, our data to help achieve our business growth. Be that through reporting, insights and analytics or influencing our daily engagement with customers in the many ways that data can make possible.As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in achieving this vision. You will be responsible for making sure we have a strong understanding of our data and will become a trusted partner with other parts of the business through your proactive engagement and accurate interpretation of their challenges. You will provide valuable and actionable insight in support of those challenges and decision making in whatever form is most suitable. You will work to break down data silos and promote data sharing across the organization.Responsibilities & AccountabilitiesIdentifying and Gathering data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, and external APIs. Performing and supporting data cleansing activity, ideally at source to ensure data accuracy and consistency and thus trust in our data. Either in response to a request or proactively identifying opportunities, applying statistical and analytical methods to examine data and uncover trends or patterns and conducting experiments and tests to validate hypotheses and draw conclusions. Building statistical or machine learning models to make predictions or forecasts. Communicating insights and recommendations to stakeholders presenting the Data and Information in whichever form is most appropriate in a clear and understandable manner. Whenever processing data, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations and maintaining the ethical use of that data. QualificationsBachelor's degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or data science or proven experience in data analytics. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and data analysis and visualisation tools including Power BI and Excel. Experience with data cleaning, transformation, and visualization. Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with large, complex datasets. Knowledge of statistical analysis methods and techniques and the curiosity to use them. Problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically. Attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reportingStrong communication skills to present findings and insights effectively to diverse audiences. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment. Experience with machine learning algorithms and techniques (preferred, not mandatory). Additional InformationFirstly, we believe in giving you the freedom to be yourself. Say goodbye to rigid dress codes and embrace your individuality. We encourage you to be yourself at work, allowing you to thrive in an environment that celebrates your uniqueness.We believe in equality and diversity. As an equal opportunities and disability confident employer, we encourage applications from all eligible candidates, regardless of their background. We embrace diversity and believe that a rich variety of perspectives strengthens our team and leads to greater innovation.If you've read our advert and it has sparked your interest in joining the Giacom team, but you're still unsure if it's the ideal fit for you, don't hesitate to apply expressing your interest. We would be delighted to hear from you and have a conversation about all the exciting opportunities we have to offer. Your exploration of possibilities starts with reaching out to us, and we can't wait to connect with you.And the Giacom benefits…?From 25 days of holidays, to a pension plan, we've got you covered. And here's a special treat – you'll enjoy an additional day off around your birthday.We care about your well-being and engagement. That's why we have a dedicated team focused on ensuring your well-being and satisfaction at work. We want you to feel supported and empowered every step of the way.Recognition is important to us. We believe in acknowledging your hard work and achievements. That's why we organise team and industry events to celebrate your successes and foster a sense of camaraderie among our team members.We also provide an Employee Assistance Programme, helping you maintain your well-being and providing support when you need it. Professional development opportunities are available to help you achieve your personal goals, and we even offer eye care vouchers and discounted Medicash membership.So, if you're looking for a rewarding career with a market leader that values you and provides a range of incredible benefits, look no further. Join us at Giacom and embark on a journey of personal and professional growth. Take the first step by applying today and discover the exciting opportunities that await you.For more information on our Recruitment privacy notice, please follow this link and select option 8 to view - https://giacom.com/help/privacy-and-cookies-policy

Fenics Direct is a market leading multi dealer platform providing aggregated liquidity in OTC FX options. It is a key part of the powerful Fenics brand of FinTech businesses within BGC Group, the world’s leading global brokerage company. The product is high-profile, client-facing, and technical.Overview of the role:Fenics Direct is seeking a graduate with previous experience in a data analysis, production support or product role and are now looking to become more directly exposed to the functioning of a fully electronic marketplace whilst interacting with electronic liquidity providers and clients located throughout EMEA and APAC.The trajectory is to develop over time into a quantitative or product-oriented role once the underlying foundation and functionality of the electronic marketplace is mastered. Key responsibilities:Ensure clients have a seamless on-boarding and trading experience.Maintain and distribute daily and monthly performance reports alongside actionable insights to participants.Make an impact by enhancing existing reporting and creating new sets of data for participants.Develop and maintain open dialogue with platform participants to gather continuous feedback on ways to improve the platform.Monitor liquidity provider electronic responses to client inquiries and investigate any disruptions.Create and maintain accurate and accessible documentation, enabling a rapid response to any client inquiries. Skills / experience required:Undergraduate degree.Ability to analyse data, automate reports and create actionable insights using Excel/VBA, Python, R or similar.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.Good people skills and ability to build relationships with various stakeholders.Ability to multi-task and to work independently in a fast-paced environment.Entrepreneur mind-set and desire to join a FinTech environment.Goal orientated with a mindset to improve and automate tasks. Preferred Experience: · Knowledge of e-trading platforms, FX or other financial markets Personal attributes:Motivated and results orientated.Ability to work well within a team as well as independently.Strong attention to detailQuick learnerTo all recruitment agencies – BGC Group & affiliates do not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job alias, employees or any other company location. BGC Group & affiliates are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please contact the Recruitment function for additional details.

Data Engineer required for this well established medical research company whose work has already resulted in four licensed medicines.Why this role?The chance to work with within a highly ambitious and talented team to change lives.Work with new technologies that have the greatest potential for future impactThrive in an environment encourages you to be creative and take measured risksYour role will involve:Employing modern data engineering tools such as cloud computing (Azure), heavy use of SQL, Python, Scientific Software, and more.We are seeking:Degree in a relevant discipline e.g. Bioinformatics, Cheminformatics, Computer Science, or similarFluency in SQLExpertise working with Linux or Windows based systemsScripting / programming skills in Python, Bash, or RCloud computing skills are desirableYour impact:Your expertise will help to advance scientific discoveries beyond the lab which will shape the next generation of diagnostics, treatments, and cures.To discuss the role further and discuss your next move in confidence, please contact Tori Amarnani at Remit Resources

The successful candidate will focus, in part, on the following key responsibilities: · Manage and create design of datacenter white space which includes: rack layout, hot/cold containment, network infrastructure, branch circuit distribution, power requirements, cable pathway, and projected build phases. · Collaborate with colo providers and internal stakeholders to deliver project design criteria and develop Basis of Design· Coordinate with key internal teams to establish requirements and work with colo providers to ensure requirement are met · Participate in development of OCI data center facilities requirements documentation· Research new designs, materials, and construction methods for data center electrical and mechanical equipment and related components· Create, develop, and maintain datacenter infrastructure site documentation, including floor plans, rack elevations, and cable matrices· Review and evaluate RFI, RFP, and RFQ submittals · Assist in creating global data center infrastructure standards · Travel to new and existing datacenters for engineering analyses · Meet critical deadlines for project schedules · Participate in project coordination meetings, and clearly communicate any necessary or recommended updates to project scheduling Desired Skills · Minimum 5 years professional experience working in critical data center environment · Experience creating drawings using AutoCad and Visio· Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and ability to work in a team· Knowledge of Data Center/Critical environment Electrical Infrastructure· Knowledge of Data Center/Critical environment Mechanical Infrastructure· Experience in Vendor management · Experience with cabling infrastructure best practices and methodologies· Understanding of Industrial/commercial electrical one lines· Experience in BMS/EPMS control systems and data collection/trending · Experience in development of MOPs/SOPs/EOPs for carrying out systems operations · Knowledge of Data Center PUE and how its derived · Reading and comprehending blueprints and building documentation· Must possess proven problem solving skills· Completes work independently and has ability to handle most unique situations independently

Copper is a digital asset technology company dedicated to helping institutional investors safely acquire, trade, and store crypto assets.Built and led by Dmitry Tokarev, a software and financial engineering specialist, the firm provides a comprehensive suite of custody, trading and settlement solutions that reduce counterparty risk and bring greater capital and operational efficiency to digital asset markets. At the heart of Copper's offering is Multi-Party Computation (MPC) technology – the gold standard in secure custody. Copper’s multi-award winning custody system is unique in that it can be connected to centralised exchanges, DeFi applications and even staking pools without the assets leaving the custody.Built on top of this state-of-the-art custody, ClearLoop™ is the first solution in the market that overcomes a growing industry challenge; counterparty risk with exchanges. This solution underpins a full prime services offering, connecting global exchanges and enabling customers to trade and settle directly from the safety of their MPC-secured wallets. By reducing settlement time for transfers to a few milliseconds (without blockchain network dependency) and offering enhanced security measures, ClearLoop™ is rapidly reshaping the way asset managers trade and manage capital.In addition to industry-leading security certifications, Copper has one of the strongest insurance coverages in the industry from an A+ rated insurer, positioning the firm as the partner of choice for institutions seeking to safeguard their assets.Department PurposeOur engineering team has remained at the forefront of blockchain technology, setting standards for the cryptocurrency infrastructure globally since the firm’s inception in 2018. We're now looking to expand the team with exceptional individuals who will help us further accelerate the crypto ecosystem’s coming of age.We have ambitious plans to build data infrastructure to allow every function at Copper to self-serve the data needed to make smart business decisions.Role PurposeCopper is hiring for an ambitious individual to join the new BI Data function. Having established market-leading products with a large client base since our launch in 2018, we are now focused on developing state-of-the-art Data and Analytics capabilities.We are looking for a candidate who is equally at ease with the operational aspects of the role as they are championing best practices to deliver the insights required to make data driven decisions. You will play an instrumental role in the implementation of a data warehouse and BI visualisation tool and help refine our data strategy.This is a key hire for Copper, with the potential to make a significant impact. You will have wide-ranging responsibilities to help us execute on our data strategy.Key Responsibilities Of The RoleDevelop data models and strategic data services:ELT PipelinesDashboardsEngage key stakeholders to explain our capabilities, understand their requirements and manage key relationships through effective communicationWork in collaboration with the data product lead to promote tools adoption and a strong data culture across the company, through relevant frameworks, processes, and training Your experience, skills and knowledge EssentialSQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases as well as familiarity with a variety of databasesExperience ingesting and manipulating a variety of data sources (Real time/batch data) and data formats (json/binary/csv)Data warehousing experience (knowledge of and experience with Kimball Dimensional, Data Vault and other related DW methodologies)Experience building and optimising pipelines and ETL/ELT workflowsStrong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasetsEngineering best practices and standards DesirableExperience with data warehouse software (e.g. Snowflake, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift)Experience with data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.Code versioning (Github integration and automation)Experience with scripting languages such as Python or RWorking knowledge of message A fast growing retail firm is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analytics Engineer to join as part of a period of continued growth. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in selecting, preparing and shaping the data for use in business analysis and reporting.Responsibilities:Create and manage ETL and ELT pipelines, ensuring high performance and scalabilityCollaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to implement data solutions that drive business outcomesLeverage Databricks, dbt, and other cloud-based tools for data analytics and transformationThe role is suitable for someone who is enthused by building projects from scratchRequirements:5+ years experience in data engineeringStrong experience in ETL/ELT processesStrong Databricks knowledgeExtensive knowledge of dbtA background in AWSKnowledge of Terraform is a nice to haveAirflow or other scheduling tool knowledgeMasters degree or above is preferableThe salary bracket for this role is £90,000 - £100,000 depending on experience with initial interviews occurring from next week so please APPLY NOW to learn more about the role.

Starling is the UK's first and leading digital bank on a mission to fix banking! Our vision is fast technology, fair service, and honest values. All at the tap of a phone, all the time.We are about giving customers a new way to spend, save and manage their money while taking better care of the planet which has seen us become a multi-award winning bank that now employs over 2800 across five offices in London, Cardiff, Dublin, Southampton, and Manchester. Our journey started in 2014, and since then we have surpassed 3.5 million accounts (and four account types!) with 350,000 business customers. We are a fully licensed UK bank but at the heart, we are a tech first company, enabling our platform to deliver brilliant products.Our technologists are at the very heart of Starling and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment that is all about building things, creating new stuff, and disruptive technology that keeps us on the cutting edge of fintech. We operate a flat structure to empower you to make decisions regardless of what your primary responsibilities may be, innovation and collaboration will be at the core of everything you do. Help is never far away in our open culture, you will find support in your team and from across the business, we are in this together!The way to thrive and shine within Starling is to be a self-driven individual and be able to take full ownership of everything around you: From building things, designing, discovering, to sharing knowledge with your colleagues and making sure all processes are efficient and productive to deliver the best possible results for our customers. Our purpose is underpinned by five Starling values: Listen, Keep It Simple, Do The Right Thing, Own It, and Aim For Greatness.Hybrid WorkingWe have a Hybrid approach to working here at Starling - our preference is that you're located within a commutable distance of one of our offices so that we're able to interact and collaborate in person. We don't like to mandate how much you visit the office and work from home, that's to be agreed upon between you and your manager.Responsibilities:• Translate data requirements from across the organisation in to robust and reusable data models•  Apply data transformation to datasets via dbt• Follow established SDLC standards / processes for rapid and reliable releasing of changes to production• Maintain consistent and clear documentation and definitions across the data warehouse and Looker• Collaborate with the wider data team to help meet the business goalsRequirementsRequirements• Strong experience with SQL• Strong experience with Looker or a similar visualisation tool• Strong experience with dbt or a desire to learn• Strong communication skills• Experience with data architecture and dimensional modelling • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environmentInterview ProcessInterviewing is a two way process and we want you to have the time and opportunity to get to know us, as much as we are getting to know you! Our interviews are conversational and we want to get the best from you, so come with questions and be curious. In general you can expect the below, following a chat with one of our Talent Team:• Stage 1 - 30 mins with one of the team• Stage 2 - 60 mins technical interview with two team members• Stage 3 - 45 min final with an executive and a member of the people teamBenefits25 days holiday (plus take your public holiday allowance whenever works best for you)An extra day's holiday for your birthdayAnnual leave is increased with length of service, and you can choose to buy or sell up to five extra days off16 hours paid volunteering time a yearSalary sacrifice, company enhanced pension schemeLife insurance at 4x your salary & group income protectionPrivate Medical Insurance with VitalityHealth including mental health support and cancer care. We’re Anthony Nolan and we save the lives of people with blood cancer and blood disorders who need a stem cell transplant or novel cell therapy. Every day, we match incredible individuals willing to donate their blood stem cells or bone marrow to people who desperately need lifesaving transplant. We help three people each day find that lifesaving match.But we won’t stop there. We are working tirelessly to unite people and science in order to unlock the cures, treatments and transplants that will transform the future for more patients. And together, we can reach the remarkable day where every patient who needs us can not only survive but thrive.If you're inspired by this vision, and feel you have the skills and experience we need to help achieve it, we'd love for you to join our lifesaving team.We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team as part of the Operations & Patient Services division.Title: Data AnalystSalary: £34,000-40,000 per annumContract: Permanent, full timeHours: 35 per week (standard Anthony Nolan working hours)Location: Hybrid*, with head office in Hampstead, LondonThe role is responsible for delivering meaningful reports, insights, and other data products enabling the organisation to be data-driven through analytical and business intelligence solutions.Day-to-day activities include close collaboration with key business functions within the Operations Division and wider organisation to understand reporting needs and provide engaging data outputs by using Azure cloud platform and Power BI.Key ResponsibilitiesThese include but are not limited to:Proactively understand business processes and collaborate with business users to identify analytic opportunities.Deliver actionable business insights through data analysis, visualization and storytelling, and deploy business intelligence solutions that enable stakeholders to take data driven business decisions.Produce, document and maintain the data flows that enable best in class analyses using data from various sources.Assist with training and developing colleagues in the use of business reporting and interpreting the data provided.Uphold the highest standard of data quality across our data pipelines and where possible, automate the process.Contribute to the evolution of data science implementation at Anthony Nolan.Essential AttributesExperience in building models for MS Power BI (or similar visualization tools) and creating meaningful stories with visualizationsSignificant experience in the principles of ETL and confidence in design data models that blend data from various sources. We currently use Azure Data Factory, Data Studio and Power BI, having recently shifted from Alteryx and Tableau.Understanding of the principles and use of coding languages: we currently use TSQL, DAX, Python and Data Mapping Flows Expression language, with the desire to learn coding languages on the jobRelevant experience in managing self and working with teams to derive actionable insight from concept to delivery, through data analysis, reporting and visualization.The ability to train and support business colleagues with data literacy, and the skills to clearly and concisely communicate both verbally and in writing.Excellent attention to detail and the user experience of data productsAbility in applying critical thinking for problem framing and some experience of business process mapping.What’s in it for you?A competitive salary27 days annual leave, pension scheme, childcare vouchers, access to counselling via a 24-hour Employee Assistance ProgrammeA stimulating work environment full of opportunities to learn and developLife Assurance of four times annual salaryTravel season ticket loan, Cycle to work SchemeAnd more! (full list of benefits available on our website)Please check out the job description here, as well as our FAQs & Additional Info page to read about our benefits, values and recruitment policy.Release your remarkable, join our team and give someone a chance of life.Anthony Nolan is committed to equal opportunities & a living wage accredited employerAll applicants must be able to demonstrate the right to work in the UK.It is important to note that we are an organisation where our culture matters and with patients, supporters and donors at the heart. Therefore, it is important that we make very clear that we expect some work to take place in the workplace. The specific expectation of remote vs on site working varies depending on the team/role, and we endeavour to make this clear on each individual vacancy. If you have any queries around our hybrid working policy and the expectation for a role you're interested in, please get in touch.

Company Description100% REMOTE (Must be UK based)When you join Turnitin, you'll be welcomed into a company that is a recognized innovator in the global education space. For more than 20 years, Turnitin has partnered with educational institutions to promote honesty, consistency, and fairness across all subject areas and assessment types. Over 16,000 academic institutions, publishers, and corporations use our services: Gradescope by Turnitin, iThenticate, Turnitin Feedback Studio, Turnitin Originality, Turnitin Similarity, ExamSoft, and ProctorExam.Turnitin has offices in Australia, India, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Mexico, the Netherlands, the Philippines, Ukraine, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Our diverse community of colleagues are all unified by a shared desire to make a difference in education. Come join us, and let's make change together.Job DescriptionAs a Software Engineer you'll be responsible for developing and supporting plugins, services, integrations, and APIs that facilitate Turnitin's internal teams and external partners. We are looking for engineers eager to solve difficult problems in a way that is scalable, observable, and performant. On this team, you'll be working on many different pieces of our codebase and will have support from top-notch colleagues. Our work often requires a good knowledge of algorithms, experience with API design, understanding microservice frameworks, and working with multiple languages and technology stacks, mostly Java.Our team is distributed across multiple time zones (US to UK), work heavily with our DevOps org, and take pride in the services we release. Unit and integration tests are a must, and code-ownership means we are the team on call if things break. You'll be working with people who love their jobs, love the challenges, and most of all we enjoy working with each other. You will also gain experience working at a top EdTech company using the latest AWS serverless technologies and have a direct impact on educators and learners around the globe.ResponsibilitiesAdd new features to existing services.Design and build new services that add customer valueImprove stability and monitoring of existing workflowsWork with services running in concert at large scaleWork closely with Support and Alliances to ensure customer delightQualificationsRequired2 years of experience with programming in Java Desire to solve complicated problems in elegant/graceful waysStrong work ethic, "self-starter", endless improvement, eager learnerPreferredDegree in Computer Science or related fieldExperience with Cloud Native solutions preferably AWS (Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS, S3, etc) or Spring BootExperience with different architecture types including event-driven architecture and microservicesExperience with relational databasesExperience working with simple front end code such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, or even ReactAdditional InformationTotal Rewards @ TurnitinTurnitin maintains a

Department Insights It’s an exciting time to join us! RWE Supply & Trading has recently introduced a new cloud based data analytics platform and as part of a new and expanding team we are looking for an experienced AWS Cloud focused Data Engineer to join us.Using the latest tech, the Lead in Data (LiD) platform has revolutionised the searching, sharing, transforming and on-boarding of Data within our organisation. Data is the fundamental backbone to the company’s trading and analysis communities as well as support functions and will become an ever increasing asset across the group in the future.We are looking for a keen, motivated tech enthusiast to join us. Someone who wants to contribute in shaping the future data needs of our organisation in close collaboration with our business stakeholders, and support the team in maintaining and improving our AWS based technical platform.If this sounds appealing, then apply now or contact me for an informal chat!Your Future Responsibilities Take ownership of the technical design new use cases and ETL jobs taking into consideration robustness, performance availability and maintainability of our strategic cloud focused data platform.  Want to work in a supportive collaborative environment focused on delivering value to our users  Be a specialist for AWS cloud native solutions, define, integrate and improve tools, designs, and work with several vendors in the market  Work within a multi-disciplinary team of DevOps and Data Engineers, promoting knowledge sharing and upskilling  Be a real technical problem solver, able to create awesome solutions for complex requirements with a hands-on attitude  Specialise in continuous delivery and automation techniques for managing cloud-native Services using a wide range of technologies  Keep up to date with new trends in cloud always looking to new solutions to solve complex problems  Have a detailed understanding of our cloud infrastructure (and how it fits in to the wider organisation), codebases (including Infrastructure as Code), and support / availability requirements Your Powerful Skills Proven experience in the mentioned technical skills within a professional capacity  Fluent in English (verbal and written)  A degree in, or related to Computer Science or Mathematics or equivalent experience  Experience as a Data Engineer with versatile technical experience of cloud platforms, automation and continuous software delivery  Hands on experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation etc.)  Fundamental experience in CI / CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, GitLab or similar)  Version Control: Git  Deployment tools: Azure DevOps, AWS CodeDeploy or similar  Hands on experience with IaaS and PaaS in Amazon Web Services, including S3, Lambda, EC2, KMS, IAM, CloudWatch  Experience in development and scripting (e.g. Python, SPARK, Ruby, Bash)  Good working experience with Linux and Windows server management and Active Directory integration  Experience with logging and monitoring platforms (ELK, CloudWatch etc) What we value most is passion, willingness to learn and a determined and resilient work ethic. So, if you can’t display all of the skills above then we would still love to hear from you! Advantageous, but not a must  AWS Certifications to professional level  Experience building and supporting robust and scalable big data platforms (Dremio, Databricks)  Knowledge of skills in Cloud security Benefits You Can Rely On Working in one of the most interesting business contexts; a mixture of energy supply, trading and of course IT!  Working in an large agile team on things which matter  Evolve your skills together with us – we offer comprehensive on the job learning as well as support from internal experts to develop your existing skills even further  Competitive salary plus annual discretionary bonus  Open and diverse company culture

JOB TITLE: JUNIOR DATA ENGINEER AWSWORK PLACE: HYBRIDOFFICE LOCATION: LONDONSALARY: £30,000*IMMEDIATE START*THE COMPANY A multi-national consultancy who are looking for a Junior level Data Engineer to join the team in London, working in a collaborative environment to bring together cutting-edge analytical techniques, creative thinking and diverse perspectives to drive growth.THE ROLE In this role the Data Engineer will be working in a Data team of 5 people, who are responsible for the development and maintenance of a number of the business' own data products. Data Engineer II - Insurance DataManchesterAt Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core and innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than just datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journey you take. The sights you see and the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.About The TeamsThe Data team's responsibilities include data platforms, management, warehousing, enrichment and machine learning functionality, enabling teams across the organisation to understand and manage our business performance and improve the experience of our customers. You will be responsible for delivering products that advance data excellence and innovation within your product team, and across the business, helping us shape Booking.com’s data journey.Insurance DataInsurance Data is a newly formed Data Enablement team focussed on insurance data from across Booking. We will be building new systems for creating, maintaining, and presenting insurance data using a Data Vault. We will enable our analysts and product teams to make data-driven decisions about product improvements, streamline their processes, and build a deeper understanding of their systems.Role OverviewAs a Data Engineer, you’ll join to work alongside curious, energetic, and focused people. You are responsible for delivering our vision to create a fully integrated, scalable, high performance and compliant data platform and pipelines. You’ll help roadmap and deliver replacements for the current ad-hoc data solutions with strong foundations built on modern technologies and practices that will make it easy to produce large quantities of high quality data for consumption and analysis. We expect you to actively contribute to team discussion with questions, have and share opinions and align behind decisions when made as if they were your own.Key Job Responsibilities And DutiesIteratively develop next-generation scalable, reliable, flexible, high-performance data pipeline capabilities and data platforms.Use standardised tooling and procedures to work with business users to model and implement data pipelines which are performant, scalable, reliable, secure, well governed with required observability.End-to-end ownership of data quality in our core datasets and data pipelines. Deliver products in an agile environment, including a CI/CD pipeline with a high degree of automation for quality assurance, monitoring, and ongoing optimisation.Contribute towards your team's ways of working, through regular review of practices and results.Engage with other teams to help them identify and resolve data quality issues.Be responsible for maintaining data quality, security, integrity and governance by effectively following regulatory requirements, company standards, and best practices.Adhere to the defined principles for architecture, quality and non-functional requirements.Ensure that products / services are always kept up to date with the latest technology standards and department guidelines.Ensuring that service level agreements are met by implementing tests and processes.Be able to connect business and product goals to complex technical tasks.Solve issues prioritising based on customer impact and perform root cause analysis to find ways to prevent recurrence.Be expected to provide out of hours support on a rota.Role Qualifications And RequirementsWe expect our Data Engineers to have a strong foundation in Big Data Engineering to help them deliver resilient, scalable data pipelines and solutions that support our customers analysis and machine learning needs.We are looking for driven Data Engineers who enjoy solving problems, are proactive, collaborative and goal orientated. Who are communicative and believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset, collaboration and tools.RequirementsAppropriate degree or suitable background and experience in technology.Proven experience in Data Modelling using frameworks like Data Vault.Proven experience of designing, building, and optimising Data Warehouses using tools such as Snowflake.Proven experience in Python or a similar scripting language.Experience building data engineering pipelines using tools such as Apache Airflow and DBT.Familiarity with a cloud platform, ideally AWS.Self motivated to explore new technologies.Excellent degree of communication skills - being able to effectively communicate to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Excellent attention to detail.Self Starter, highly motivated, team player.Have a ‘root cause analysis’ mindset to problem and issue resolution. Is able to break down complex problems and find solutions by using logical and analytical thinking.Fully comfortable working in English, both written and spoken.You have an intrinsic curiosity in technological innovations and you are always on top of the latest trends.Benefits & Perks: Global Impact, Personal Relevance: BenefitsBooking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. Our Total Rewards are aimed to make it easier for you to experience all that life has to offer—all the messy, beautiful, and joyful bits—on your terms. So you can focus on what really matters. We offer competitive compensation as well as thoughtful, valuable, and even fun benefits which include:A great brand new office to in the heart of ManchesterFlexible hybrid ways of workingFree breakfast and lunch 25 days paid holiday plus bank holidays (rising to 28 days after 3 years of service)Employer contribution pension Industry leading parental leave and adoption leave Great discounts on accommodation, car rentals and other group benefits An exciting and dynamic place to work Health & well-being benefits such as mental health support, cycle to work schemes, access to health insurance, etcWe want our colleagues to have a work life balance that works both for them and the business. Flexibility around a 37.5 hour week.We are also open to considering other flexible working arrangements. Our Talent Specialists will discuss this with you if your application is progressed.#ThinkInclusion: Wellbeing & Inclusion at Booking.comInclusion, Diversity, Belonging, Wellbeing and Volunteering (IDBWV) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations. Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.” We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustments to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to discuss any requirements.Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.Application ProcessYour application will be reviewed by our Recruitment colleagues. They will contact suitable candidates for an initial screening call.The formal interview process includes three interviews, a phone interview, competency interview and a technical interview, your Recruiter will discuss in more detail and ensure that you are fully prepared for each stage of the interview process.Pre- Employment ScreeningIf your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join a leading organisation Data Analyst. Data is integral to this organisation and therefore they are expanding their team!We're looking for an experienced Data Analyst within the claims area to join a leading organisation in an exciting role. Our client is one of the fastest growing fintech companies in the UK. Their technology is powering a revolution directly impacting people's lives by enabling the fairest, quickest and most customer-centric products available to car buyers in the UK.Day to day your work will be supporting the Credit risk team, you will also sit in the Data Analytics function. Data Analysts are central to the team and they support the development of all the decision processes that sit behind our loan process. You will be working hands on as an analyst utilising Python/R and SQL, creating dashboards on the likes of Tableau or Power BI.Core Responsibilities:* Designing and deploying new credit decision strategies and processes using statistical analysis methodologies to improve customer & commercial outcomes.* Deriving insights from credit bureau and customer data, turning them into actionable plans and carrying out those plans out to the end.* Communicating such insights and processes to different business partners, developers, operations teams, and management.* Contributing to how the data analysis platform and technology stack is structured to suit the data science team in the future.* Willing to go deep and try things out, be it potential new analytics; an opportunity with new datasets; new analysis techniques or new analysis-related tools.If you are experienced in working projects end to end from design phase to production and love working with data to solve complex problems this role could be for you.Based in Manchester, you need to be a commutable distance from their offices for a flexible hybrid approach,

We are looking for a Data Analyst.As a Collinson Grant Data Analyst you will:provide support in all areas of data management and analysisassist in preparing requests for data from clientsmanage the consolidation and cleansing of large and often disparate data sets, using tools such as Microsoft Accessdevelop sophisticated models to analyse the data and to test business hypothesesgenerate data-driven reports and dashboards – from high-level executive summaries to 'deep-drilled' analyses.We are interested in meeting people who:care about the standard of their output more than the people they are doing it for doare extremely hard-working and sensitive to time pressureshave meticulous and near-obsessive attention to detailare numerateare practical with the application of their knowledgehave experience in the presentation of complex analysis and the visualisation of outputs.Detailed experience of the following may be advantageous, but is not essential providing you have the above characteristics:Microsoft Access.Microsoft Excel.Structured Query Language (SQL).Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).Business Intelligence tools (particularly Power BI).Collinson Grant is a management consultancy with an exceptional record in:helping large organisations all over the United Kingdom, Europe, and in the United States to restructure, merge acquisitions, cut costs, increase performance and profit, and manage people building long-term relationships based on trust. We have worked for some of our clients for more than 50 yearsemphasising results and value for money. We expect to give an exceptional return on our clients' investment in us. We do not recommend action unless we are sure that the outcome will be worth it.If you can use your initiative and are committed to producing work of the highest standard, to demanding deadlines, with a near-obsessive attention to detail and the ability to effectively plan and prioritise work schedules, we'd like to hear from you.

DescriptionRole locations: Leatherhead, Bristol, Burton and Manchester.Who we are:Frazer-Nash are an engineering, systems and technology consultancy. Through our meaningful innovations, our experts help organisations make lives safe, secure, sustainable and affordable.In a nutshell, engineering consultancy is all about providing advice to positively impact our clients’ projects and businesses and the wider world around us.Why Frazer-Nash?The world and our clients have lots of problems and we get a kick out of finding digital and data solutions to these problems. As a graduate, you will typically be working on multiple projects simultaneously, managing your time and accruing a wealth of experience and skills. Hence, no two days in Frazer-Nash will be the same.As a Data Science and Software Graduate Engineer you’ll be surrounded by experts in our teams and from our customers, covering software, data, modelling and simulation and in a range of other fields – whether it’s product design, control systems design or human sciences, we’re an interesting bunch.The role:This is a Data Science and Software Graduate Engineer role within our Digital stream at Frazer-Nash. As a graduate you could be joining one of our software, data science, cloud, modelling, analytics or information systems teams.The role is looking for passionate, open and curious minded people, who love to problem solve. We are looking to create digital professionals who, like us, are committed to finding real-world solutions and delivering success for our clients.The successful individuals will receive training, mentoring and coaching to support their development into becoming well-rounded consultants and will be supported to achieve professional accreditations including chartership.RequirementsWe’re looking for people who can become:A creator: Our projects solve problems that customers have today, some of these turn into solutions that we can re-use as products. You will have the vision for how to re-use your work to solve bigger problems in the future. Given a blank sheet of paper we are looking for individuals who are able to create the new and the different. A team player: You will work in multi-disciplinary teams with other Frazer-Nash colleagues and our customers. You will be able to get along with others from different technical and social backgrounds and be part of a team which is more capable than the sum of its parts.An adapter: Ability to adapt to different and challenging situations and manage your time to meet competing demands.A multi-tasker: You will work on multiple projects concurrently and quickly take responsibility for delivery of different elements. Your responsibilities will grow year-on-year, as you grow in capability. You will have the ability to manage your own time to juggle competing demands to meet challenging deadlines.A problem solver: You will solve many different technical problems, seeing them from different perspectives and finding solutions which put the customer at the heart of our work. Often our clients aren’t aware of what outcomes best suit their requirements. You will have the ability to explore different options for our clients to ensure we deliver the best outcomes.You will need to have obtained a 2:1 Degree or higher (or equivalent/experience) with a related Engineering, Computer Science or relevant scientific bias.Due to the nature of the work that Frazer-Nash Consultancy undertake, candidates will be required to undergo pre-employment screening and must be able to satisfy clearance criteria for UK National Security Vetting.Our recruitment process:Step 1: Application - CV submissionStep 2: Measure Potential - Arctic Shores’ task-based assessment. You will be asked to complete some exciting, engaging tasks which will help us get to know you better! In return, you’ll receive a personalised feedback report.Step 3: Video Interview - Situation based & technical questions that are related to the important criteria needed to be successful on the role.Step 4: Explore day - This includes the opportunity to learn about what we do, network with current Graduates and find out about what a career at Frazer-Nash has to offer. You will be asked to complete an interview and presentation/task as part of the day.Step 5: Decision/Feedback - You will receive feedback even if we do not make the decision to offer you the job or progress you to the next stage.Here's what we offer:The opportunity to join and learn with a team that’s as driven as they are supportive.A competitive salary: [£33,000 + £2,000 joining bonus]25 days holiday + the opportunity to buy 5 days.A company that has its heart in the right place and a welcoming work culture.Hybrid working with flexibility around life outside of work.Company pension scheme.Private healthcare membership + wellbeing support.Bonus scheme linked into company performance.Support and mentoring on route to achieving professional accreditation.Paid membership fees to a professional institution.Early career teams and office socials.And a whole host more...Equal OpportunitiesIndividuals from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply, as we believe that diversity and inclusion are fundamental to creating a dynamic and thriving workplace culture.
