Company DescriptionLGC is a leading, global life science tools company, providing mission-critical components and solutions into high-growth application areas across the human healthcare and applied market segments. Its high-quality product portfolio is comprised of mission-critical tools for genomic analysis and for quality assurance applications, which are typically embedded and recurring within our customers’ products and workflows and are valued for their performance, quality, and range.Job DescriptionWe are actively looking for individuals that are passionate about making a difference and have an opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer to join our central Group Data & Analytics team.Design and develop processes for acquiring data from disparate data sources using innovative methods (e.g. API, streaming). Design, development, and optimisation of the Group Data Platform (GDF) to meet business requirements. Design data models and metadata systems to enable analysts to work more effectively with the data products we produce. Data & Process discovery on source systems to build best possible data acquisition processes. Ensure that new and existing and technical implementations continue to perform against agreed performance metrics. Contribute to selection and recommendation of new analytical tools matching requirements and/or analytics strategy. Researching and understanding impact of emerging technologies on the organisation and how they might best be introduced for wider usage. Maintain CI/CD pipelines and champion DataOps as a discipline. QualificationsDegree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar Analytical discipline or equivalent experience. Extensive, demonstrable experience of Structure Query Language (SQL). Extensive, demonstrable experience of dbt. Extensive, demonstrable experience of Snowflake and its concepts. Advanced experience in delivering Python applications and data pipelines. Experience working in a hybrid cloud enabled end-to-end data architecture. Comprehensive knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques used in end-to-end analytical model design and development. Ability to have pragmatic conversations with non-technical end users to discover how existing business processes influence the flow of data and thus the design of the Group Data Foundation (GDF). Ability to multi-task and follow through on assignments to completion. Ability to work in a pressurised, changing environment with strong focus on high quality and timely delivery of outputs. Ability to work effectively in virtual, interdisciplinary teams as well as to work autonomously, take initiative and make things happen. Passion for handling, analysing and transforming large, complex data sets into workable information sets. Desirable:Demonstrable experience of implementing Data Vault 2.0 on Snowflake. AWS platform enablement for Data & Analytics. We are seeking a detail-oriented Royalties & Accounting Analyst to join our market-leading music administration team in London. As part of Kobalt's Royalties & Business Intelligence team, reporting to the Director of Corporate & Client Analysis, you will play a crucial role in providing transparent and accurate reporting in the music industry. This position offers a fantastic opportunity for individuals passionate about working with data, problem-solving, and delivering exceptional service to clients.WHAT DOES A ROYALTIES & ACCOUNTING ANALYST AT KOBALT DO?You will utilise SQL to query the Kobalt database and generate accurate, clean data.You will execute the delivery of quarterly accounting to clients from our music royalties investment fund (created to give copyright owners a better way to sell their copyright and receive capital) as well as coordinating investigations into any administrative or operational issues shown in those account statements.You use Excel to produce ad-hoc analyses and key trends for internal and external contacts, including reporting for Kobalt’s senior executives and top clients.You translate underlying data into BI platforms to surface usable business intelligence tools.You provide support to the overall team with audits and as well as manage high-priority client requests timely and efficiently.WHAT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE ARE WE LOOKING FOR?You have experience in music publishing or with a performing rights society, ideally in a Royalty/Finance Accounting capacity with a track-record of providing excellent customer service and can demonstrate an understanding of collection societies and music publishing on a global scale.You are highly numerate with expert Microsoft Excel skills including intermediate or higher ability with SQL.You are analytical, with an ability to manipulate and scrutinise large sets of data and provide meaningful analysis.You are a collaborative team player with strong written and verbal communication skills showing an ability to work accurately and effectively under pressure as well as prioritise strict deadlines.Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships throughout the organisation and with external 3rd parties.If this sounds like you, then please share your story by filling out the application below. To get you in the right mood, have a listen here to songs by our talented creators, especially curated to get you in the right mood when looking for the next challenge! WHY CHOOSE US?At Kobalt we’ve prioritized creators since we first started in 2000. Our music services and the technology we’ve built helps make the industry more fair and rewarding for artists. We’re trusted by some of the world’s biggest names like Doja Cat, Kali Uchis, Phoebe Bridgers, Nick Cave, Wolf Alice and Sam Fender and songwriters such as Simon Aldred (Rag N Bone Man, Liam Gallagher, Celeste) and Clarence Coffee Jr. (Dua Lipa, Lizzo, The Snuts). We thrive on creativity and are committed to championing diversity. We’re dedicated to inclusiveness and provide all the resources and benefits you need to grow your career and reach your potential. We offer competitive compensation packages, professional development opportunities, and an entrepreneurial culture that makes working here not just fun, but also rewarding.

The Hatcher Group is seeking an accomplished Junior Data Analyst to support our growing digital analytics operations. You will be a pivotal player in navigating and aiding both our internal and external digital measurement needs in alignment with both strategic and client objectives. With a keen understanding of digital analytics best practices, you will be instrumental in realizing our clients' strategic objectives while setting unparalleled standards for operational excellence.In this position, you will report directly to the Associate Director, Data and Analytics. Your role will be central to offering data-driven insights, formulating analytics strategy, and supporting campaign reporting for our clients, which include nonprofit organizations, foundations, and government agencies.We anticipate our Junior Data Analyst will be a proactive, innovative, and data-driven expert in digital analytics. Your role will entail measuring the success of digital tactics and campaigns, utilizing data analysis, alongside active participation in supporting the development of digital dashboards. Having 4+ years of data and analytics experience, preferably in a digital environment, is essential. Knowledge of pixel placement and tracking is highly preferred.In joining our expanding digital team, you will offer support in tracking digital campaigns down to the tactic level, social listening, sentiment analysis, and related tasks. We are seeking a candidate who is intrinsically curious, digitally proficient, and embraces learning and experimentation with new technology, strategies, and tactics.At Hatcher, we are proud to maintain a 'flexible first' work culture. Candidates must live within a reasonable commuting distance to our Bethesda office for regular in-person collaboration. The target salary range for this position is $65,000 - $75,000 annually, commensurate with experience and internal equity.Key Responsibilities:Analyzing and interpreting digital data for actionable insights.Strategizing, planning, and executing SEO and social listening campaigns.Using pixel placement and tracking to assess digital performance.Assisting in the design, execution, and maintenance of digital dashboards.Collaboratively managing the data review processes for client projects.Demonstrating a profound understanding of our client's digital presence.Contributing positively to our team’s ethos rooted in the firm’s core values.Desired Skills and Qualifications:Bachelor's degree with a minimum of 4-5 years of relevant data and analytics experience, preferably in a digital setting.Profound knowledge of digital analytics best practices.Knowledge of pixel placement and tracking (preferred).Proficiency in program management software, notably Monday.com.Strong work ethic, accompanied by the capability to manage numerous deadlines.Experience with SEO and SEMRUSH.Knowledge and/or experience with social listening tools, such as TalkWalker, etc.Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools and Google Suite (particularly Excel or Sheets).Familiarity with digital analytics tools and platforms, including Google Analytics, Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc. Join us in shaping the digital future at The Hatcher Group. Together, we'll explore new frontiers and redefine possibilities.About The Hatcher GroupThe Hatcher Group is a full-service communications and marketing firm, powered by purpose. We are hard-working, visionary strategists with big hearts who delight in the power of communications and good ideas. Our award-winning team includes persuasive storytellers, smart digital media strategists, savvy public relations professionals, accomplished multimedia designers, inventive visual artists, inspired event planners, and compassionate policy advocates.Our proud commitment to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace drives our organizational culture and allows us to deliver exceptional work.The Hatcher Group is a Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB) headquartered in Bethesda, Maryland, with offices in Baltimore and Annapolis.Hatcher is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.Powered by JazzHRPV0o6HDvT7

Keller Postman LLC is a national law firm that represents a broad array of clients as plaintiffs in complex litigation at the trial and appellate levels. We act for plaintiffs in federal and state court across a variety of claims and practice areas. We take on complicated cases—frequently class and mass actions, arbitrations or matters in multiple jurisdictions—where our legal and strategic counsel can add significant value.Keller Postman's increasing scale creates an exciting opportunity to be data-driven at multiple levels. To take advantage of that opportunity, we are building an independent Analytics & Insights Team that will work closely with senior leaders to measure and improve Keller Postman's approach to every interaction with clients and potential clients. The data analyst will be one of the Analytics & Insights Team's first dedicated hires. The position will therefore be dynamic; it will evolve as needs change and as the candidate shapes the role.Essential FunctionsEvaluate large datasets for quality, accuracy, and perform advanced data analysis using applications or querying datasets to assess initial data quality. Assist with extracting, transforming, and loading data to enable data analyses. Build automations of routine and repeated tasks. Perform analyses to drive insights and improve client experience across the client journey. Use Python to develop tools for data cleaning, mining, analysis, and visualization. Collaborate with attorney teams to optimize reporting systems and tools and ensure that analytics and insights are embedded in decision-making. Assist with developing dashboards for internal and external stakeholders. Maintaining, updating and building databases, dashboards, and other data visualization tools to ensure accurate and up-to-date data is available to stakeholders. Identifying and implementing process improvements to enhance data collection and analysis methods. Required Skills And AbilitiesIdeal candidates will have experience with Microsoft Power Bi and SalesforceProficiency in SQL, DAX, and Microsoft Power QueryMastery of Microsoft ExcelExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAnalytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skillsExcellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlinesAbility to multi-task and to work independently or as part of a teamEducation/Experience:1-2 years of experience in Power Bi, data analysis, or business intelligence roles. College Degree from an accredited universityKeller Postman is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Position SummaryWe are seeking a dynamic Clinical Data Analyst to join our team and play a crucial role in advancing our clinical research efforts. This position offers an exciting opportunity to blend data expertise with healthcare knowledge to drive positive changes in patient care and medical research.As a Clinical Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in the healthcare field by collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and de-identifying clinical data to support evidence-based decision-making and improve patient outcomes. You will work closely with healthcare professionals, researchers, and data management teams to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and accessibility of clinical data. Your insights and reports will contribute to advancements in medical research, treatment strategies, and healthcare quality improvement.Primary ResponsibilitiesData Collection and Validation:Gather and verify clinical and assay execution data from various structured and unstructured sources, such as LIMS systems, csv files, external SAS datasets, JSON and PDF files etc. Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with relevant standards and regulations (e.g., HIPAA). Data Analysis And InterpretationEmploy statistical and data analysis tools to extract meaningful insights from clinical and pipeline analysis data. Assist in identifying trends, patterns, and anomalies that may impact patient care or research outcomes. Collaborate with researchers and bioinformaticians to define requirements for sample and data selection for research and study designs. Reporting And VisualizationCreate clear and concise reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Provide data-driven insights for improving clinical processes, patient care, and research protocols and to support decision-making. Data ManagementMaintain data repositories, databases, and data dictionaries for efficient data storage and retrieval. Monitor data quality and implement data cleaning procedures as needed. Quality AssuranceImplement quality control procedures to ensure the accuracy, reliability, and secure delivery of clinical data. Monitor data analysis processes and identify areas for improvement. Regulatory ComplianceStay current with relevant regulations and standards in clinical research and data analysis. Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR). Collaborative TeamworkCollaborate with multiple teams, including researchers, medical directors, bioinformaticians, biostatisticians & data scientists and IT professionals, to address data-related challenges and deliver clean and accurate data. Act as a liaison between data management and healthcare teams to bridge communication gaps. Continuous Learning And InnovationStay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in clinical data analysis and healthcare. Identify opportunities for process improvements and innovation in data analysis methodologies. QualificationsBachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Healthcare Informatics etc). Minimum of 2 years of experience in clinical data analysis or a related role preferably in a healthcare or pharmaceutical setting. Basic knowledge of clinical research methodologies and regulatory requirements, such as HIPAA and FDA guidelines. Experience with healthcare data, electronic health records (EHR), and clinical terminology is a plus. Basic understanding of next-gen sequencing workflows. Certification in data analysis or healthcare informatics is a plus. Knowledge, Skills, And AbilitiesProficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R). Experience with healthcare data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Quick Sight). Basic understanding of machine learning and predictive modeling for healthcare applications. Strong SQL skills for querying and retrieving data from complex data sources in a structured format. Proficient in aggregating data, preparing, cleaning data and data mining using SQL and Python. Knowledge of healthcare terminologies and standards (e.g., ICD-10, CPT, HL7). Previous experience working in a clinical or healthcare research environment. Good problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities. Effective communication and presentation skills. Attention to detail and a commitment to data integrity and privacy. Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment. Our aim is to make personalized genetic testing and diagnostics part of the standard of care to protect health and enable earlier and more targeted interventions that lead to longer, healthier lives.The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. description: Data Analyst, Bureau of Mental HealthApplyData Analyst, Bureau of Mental HealthAgency: DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENEPosted on: 09/23/2023Job type: Full-timeDepartmentMH - Assisted out TreatmentSalary range: $82,506.00 – $94,882.00Job DescriptionEstablished in 1805, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (the NYC Health Department) is the oldest and largest health department in the country. Our mission is to protect and improve the health of all New Yorkers, in service of a vision of a city in which all New Yorkers can realize their full health potential, regardless of who they are, how old they are, where they are from, or where they live.As a world-renowned public health agency with a history of building transformative public health programming and infrastructure, innovating in science and scholarship to advance public health knowledge, and responding to urgent public health crises from New York City’s yellow fever outbreak in 1822, to the COVID-19 pandemic we are a hub for public health innovation, expertise, and programs, and services. We serve as the population health strategist, and policy, and planning authority for the City of New York, while also having a vast impact on national and international public policy, including programs and services focused on food and nutrition, anti-tobacco support, chronic disease prevention, HIV/AIDS treatment, family and child health, environmental health, mental health, and racial and social justice work, among others.Our Agency’s five strategic priorities, building off a recently-completed strategic planning process emerging from the COVID-19 emergency, are:1) To re-envision how the Health Department prepares for and responds to health emergencies, with a focus on building a “response-ready” organization, with faster decision-making, transparent public communications, and stronger surveillance and bridges to healthcare systems 2) Address and prevent chronic and diet-related disease, including addressing rising rates of childhood obesity and the impact of diabetes, and transforming our food systems to improve nutrition and enhance access to healthy foods3) Address the second pandemic of mental illness including: reducing overdose deaths, strengthening our youth mental health systems, and supporting people with serious mental illness4) Reduce black maternal mortality and make New York a model city for women’s health5) Mobilize against and combat the health impacts of climate changeOur 7,000-plus team members bring extraordinary diversity to the work of public health. True to our value of equity as a foundational element of all of our work, and a critical foundation to achieving population health impact in New York City, the NYC Health Department has been a leader in recognizing and dismantling racism’s impacts on the health of New Yorkers and beyond. In 2021, the NYC Board of Health declared racism as a public health crisis. With commitment to advance anti-racist public health practices that dismantle systems that perpetuate inequitable power, opportunity and access, the NYC Health Department continues to work in and with communities and community organizations to increase their access to health services and decrease avoidable health outcomes.DUTIES WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO:Collaborate with program staff and IT to develop and refine data collection instruments and improve data systems and processes.Work with program stakeholders to develop specific and measurable program metrics for operational and performance management.Process, clean, and prepare data for analysis and reporting; data check; document data management procedures (e.g., data dictionaries, business rules); monitor data quality, identify issues, and work with program staff to resolve.Prepare routine reports and presentations of program performance with data graphs/service trends; Clearly communicate (oral and written) results of analyses to program staff/leadership and other non-technical audiences.Maintain and update existing dashboards as needed using software such as Tableau; Assist in developing new dashboards as needed.Respond quickly and accurately to ad hoc data requests for internal (e.g., Directors, Assistant Commissioners) and external audiences (e.g., public hearings, City Hall).Work with leadership and program stakeholders on interpretation and limitations of data analysis results and provide actionable recommendations.Develop training materials and conduct trainings on updates to the data collection system as needed. Create guidance documents for internal staff and external users detailing updates to the system.Manage multiple projects and collaborate with other research and program staff.Incorporate an equity lens in all aspects of work.Conduct special projects and perform other duties as assigned.Minimum Qualifications1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.NOTE:Probationary PeriodAppointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year.Preferred Skills- Experience processing, cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing large program or administrative datasets using statistical software such as SAS, SQL, and/or R is required. - Ability to work independently and problem solve. - Experience in querying, cleaning, and maintaining large relational databases. - Willingness to be flexible and work as part of a team. - Experience working with an electronic health, social service, or case management record system such as Maven. - Experience with data visualization software such as Tableau. - Excellent interpersonal, analytical, research, presentation, written and oral communication skills. - Experience in quantitative analytical methods. - Experience with public mental health systems and recovery-oriented practices - Strong organizational skills.Residency RequirementNew York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.Additional InformationThe City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.Minimum Qualifications1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to \"1\" or \"2\" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in \"2\" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in \"1\" and \"2\" above.

Full time – Ongoing (permanent) employment  35-hour working week, in a hybrid working environment  Join a passionate team supporting the people of NSW to be healthy and well.  Conveniently located in St Leonards, close to public transportAbout This RoleJoin an energetic team working on a major public health issue - obesity and chronic disease prevention through healthy eating and active living strategies.This is an opportunity for an experienced research analyst to lead the best-practice reporting, monitoring and evaluation approaches underpinning our NSW Healthy Eating and Active Living Strategy. Working closely with policy and operational staff, the role manages a team of data and evaluation professionals. You will have strong project management, data analysis, research and evaluation skills, and demonstrate great skills in people management, influencing and negotiating, all combined with an ability to take a system-view of information and undertake complex analysis to improve health outcomes.Crown Clerk 11/12, salary from $139,787 - $161,663 plus Super and annual leave loadingFor more information, read the full Role Description .Where you'll be workingThe Centre for Population Health aims to promote health and to prevent morbidity and mortality caused by modifiable risk factors. Prevention is an essential and effective foundation in the delivery of high value health care.Programs and services funded by the CPH are delivered in government, non-government, community and clinical settings. The CPH approach is characterised by a focus on evidence-informed programmatic and system-level interventions that improve health, reduce health inequity, create healthy environments, promote community action, enable personal health-seeking and recognise the social determinants of good health.What You'll Be DoingThe Principal Analyst leads the delivery of high-level epidemiological and analytical support for the Centre for Population Health activities, programs and projects for the obesity portfolio. The role supports informed decision making and the development of prevention and intervention strategies to reduce prevalence in NSW through: Leading approaches to policy and program development, review and evaluation; including evaluating new policy approaches.  Providing expert advice on data analyses, issues, trends and policy matters to support informed decision making and program and strategy development to senior executives and staff across NSW Health.  Leading strategic research priority setting and overseeing priority research projects which support the delivery of the Centre for Population Health strategic plan.  Managing relationships with key internal and external research partners, including the development of strategic work plans to support business priorities.  Leading a team in preparing high quality written advice in the form of reports, briefs, policy, discussion papers, or circulars to inform, respond to requests, or initiate consideration of new policy initiatives. How To ApplyAll applicants must review the role description and apply by submitting an up-to-date resume (up to 5 pages), cover letter (1-2 pages) and attaching a response to the two target questions below. Target Questions (1-2 pages)  Describe a situation where you have had to analyse and interpret complex information, quickly evaluate impacts, and determine potential actions.  Give an example of a highly complex project that you have successfully managed. What issues did you face? What strategies did you implement to overcome them? What would you do differently next time?Closing Date: Tuesday 31 October 2023 For role related queries or questions contact Liz Munn Director Population health Policy & Engagement on elizabeth.munn@health.nsw.gov.au and quote REQ440762.If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process, contact Frankie De Luca on frankie.deluca@health.nsw.gov.auWhat We OfferThe Ministry of Health offers its employees a range of benefits and opportunities to help you succeed in your role, with opportunities for career progression, learning, development and work-life balance. You will have access to support networks, employee assistance programs, and flexible work arrangements. To learn more about the Ministry and what benefits we offer, access our Employee Benefits Handbook .Working at The Ministry of HealthThe position is located in St Leonards, in a modern, purpose-built building within an activity-based working environment. Close to public transport, cafés and local amenities.Our commitment to Diversity and InclusionAt the Ministry of Health we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible environment which reflects the community and customers we serve. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, LGBTIQ+ community and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application or to obtain more information on how to apply please visit The Stepping Up Initiative .To be eligible for employment in these roles you must be an Australian citizen, or a permanent resident, or a New Zealand citizen, or hold a valid visa with permission to work in Australia.Additional information  This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months.  For more information on applying visit the Ministry of Health Career portal  Please note the selection process will include a range of comparative assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role Considering the significant risks posed by COVID-19, the Ministry of Health expects all workers to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, and you will be required to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status prior to securing this role.Applications Close: 11:59pm, Tuesday 31 October 2023 Agency: Health

Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar match your donations to registered charities. Our purposeHere at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.About The RoleWe are seeking a Systems Engineer to join our technical support team. You’ll interact directly with clients and other members of the Datacom teams to support technology-based solutions. You’ll be responsible for the support of server infrastructure, within contracted time frames and service level agreements. This support will involve remote assistance over the phone and ad-hoc onsite visits when required and participate in an on-call roster for after-hours support.This role requires Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency preferably with baseline/NV1 Clearance. Candidates without citizenship or permanent residency need not apply.What You’ll DoAs the Systems Engineer this is an excellent technical opportunity, joining a fantastic team of peers with opportunity to take your career to new heights! You will be part of our extensive Operations business who support each other working collaboratively across locations. You’ll be providing technical maintenance, support services within agreed service levels along with maintaining technical documentation. You will also be using tools and processes to deliver services to customers to ensure their service level agreements are met, proactively managing their infrastructure and driving service process improvement.What You’ll BringTo be successful in this role you’ll bring at least 3-5 years' experience as a System Administrator with Windows Server, infrastructure applications, and cloud technologies.Your technical experience should include:Administration of Windows ServerMS server operating functions, Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, ADFS, DHCP, DFS,Managing virtual environments utilising infrastructure such as VMware vSphere and Microsoft Hyper-VManagement of physical server environments such as Cisco Unified Computing (UCS)Sound knowledge of backup and disaster recovery methodologies using tools such as Veeam, NetBackup and CommVaultAWS and Azure certificationExposure to Linux technologiesCitrix XenApp and Citrix NetScaler management and supportYour customer focus and communication skills will be a strength, along with an ability to develop and maintain productive internal and external relationships, partnerships and networks. We are keen to hear of your troubleshooting, problem-solving experience, your understanding of public cloud platforms and agile operations.Culture And BenefitsDatacom is ones of ANZs largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. As an ANZ company, we have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.At Datacom you'll be recognised and valued for your contributions. We're growing year on year and can provide stability, career opportunity and a collegial, agile, flat-structured environment that empowers people and promotes autonomy. We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, a gaming zone, remote working, flexi-hours, professional development courses and health insurance to name a few. We operate at the leading edge of technology to help ANZ’s largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.If you would like to know more and this sounds like you. Please apply online today!

We have an opportunity for a Business & Systems Analyst – Data Governance to join the team at our Sydney head office.  The Opportunity - About the Role The intent for this role is a Data Subject Matter Expert who will be responsible for the day-to-day operational management of data, training, business, and systems management along with the data quality across the Commercial Property Portfolio.  This is an exciting and newly created strategic role, focussing on Stockland Compliance to create a fit-for-purpose and tacit Data Governance Operating Model and Framework across the enterprise. Your daily responsibilities will include:Communicate and be involved in design, training and distribution of QRG’s, documenting processes, UAT testing.Define reporting and alerting requirements, facilitate spot check audits and help design, document and maintain system processes.Creating a detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for the businessRequirement gathering for new initiatives such as power bi report, process improvement and dataProvide project management support for the end to end delivery of data related projects.Supporting the delivery of Stockland’s strategic and business outcomes and reporting particularly as we move to future JV opportunities.Supporting the growth of the business through consistent and accurate data;Sustaining a competitive advantage and identify new business using accurate and quality data, andClarifying roles, responsibilities, and accountabilities to ensure our staff , processes, and systems support data governance in an efficient, secure, and compliant manner.Continuous training provided to the teams and business in ensuring teams are following correct processes/procedures.Support the preparation of reports to monitor key performance drivers.Support the building of strong working relationships with key stakeholders to solve issues, leverageopportunities and influence business performance.Prepare accurate and effective communication materials and reports as required. About You  To be successful in this role, you will have:Appropriate tertiary qualification/s is requiredExperience in analytical & reporting focussed rolesStrong communication and stakeholder engagement skillsDemonstrated time management & project management skillsAnalysis & Reporting experienceProcess Excellence experienceInformation Strategy & Management experienceIdeally you will also have experience with Financial & Commercial Analysis The Stockland PropositionAt Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career.  We recognise the importance of flexibility and work life-quality and over 80% of our employees have informal or formal flexible work arrangements. Additionally, Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds and we want our teams to reflect this.  We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. Benefits include free to access or subsidised lifestyle, health, well-being and financial services products.  Due to the permanent nature of this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or Open Work Visa holders with more than 12 months validity from their role start date.  Apply today – Stockland – it's your place. Agencies should note that unsolicited resumes will not be accepted for this position and Stockland will not pay any fees related to resumes that are submitted directly to hiring managers and not through our approved process. Where appropriate, the Careers @ Stockland Team will work with our preferred panel of agencies to source candidates for roles. Please submit any queries relating to the approved process of submitting candidate resumes or Stockland’s preferred agency panel to careers@stockland.com.au

Job DescriptionData Engineer - TeradataWestpac Group has a rich heritage and offers employees a multitude of opportunities. Experience in Job Orchestration using Control-M or ESP.Previous experience in the Banking industry is highly desirable.Good knowledge in Azure Teradata cloud data technologies and Synapse, Experience not mandatoryProvides technical database consultation on application development, and other database administration efforts related to specific DBMS.What’s in it for me?You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.What’s it like to work there?As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market.We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work.As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.How do I Apply?Start here. We're an iconic Aussie brand with a global footprint. Our purpose is to build a connected future so everyone can thrive. We're all about providing the best experience and delivering the best tech on the best network.This includes making Telstra the place you want to work.For you, that means a having career that grows with you, and working with a team powered by human connection that prioritises wellbeing and choice.Make a differenceAs part of Product and Technology, your mission will be to capture market value at scale by building products that offers our customers a great experience, is seamless to deliver, and are profitable to the core.Our teams use technology, automation, and innovation to try and decode the world's biggest technological challenges in areas such as the Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.The Data Engineering chapter type houses the capabilities to build and manage Telstra's data environment as well the design, development and delivery of data products throughout its lifecycle. This includes data governance, quality assurance, metadata management, and data lineage tracking. We design and implement efficient data pipelines for ingestion, curation, cataloguing exposing data and maintaining data quality standards.  Our skills extend to feature engineering, Big Data, ETL operations, deploying ML models at scale, developing and supporting data-driven applications, and designing end-to-end solutions aligned with business requirements including scalability and security considerations.  The Chapter also build & maintain data platforms, including optimising efficiency, reducing complexity, and enhancing scalability of data & ML platforms. We operate platforms to ensure their smooth operation through infrastructure setup, configuration management, and deployment. With knowledge of data processing workflows, validation, monitoring, and error handling, ensuring seamless data ingestion, transformation and delivery processes.   Key Responsibilities There are a range of roles being considered for placement, specifically: Senior Data Engineer(s) working on innovative technology in a multi-cloud setup, engaging closely with the feature team lead, business analysts, cloud engineering, security, data architects, business analysts and other technical groups to understand business needs, move data from source to target, and design optimal data modes that enable access to data for different types of users. The vision is to unleash data driven experiences and decisions by acquiring B2C digitization data, enabling trusted reporting, measurement, mastering our analytical records, and promote innovation and actionable insights.  More generally, as a Senior Data Engineer, you will have opportunities to work with the technology required to build and manage Telstra's data environment as well the design, development and delivery of data products throughout its lifecycle. You would work closely with other data engineers, business analysts, cloud engineering, security, data architects, business analysts and other technical groups to understand business needs. The D&AI Data Engineering Chapter support all data engineering missions across Telstra, whilst having the following Group Owner relationship who maintain accountability in the following four areas:  Data & AI Solutions - accountable for scaled adoption of AI across Telstra, pulling the capabilities of the function through to the organisation with integrated, reusable AI products that optimise cost and reduce time value. Data Services - accountable for driving the delivery of Data as a Service capability, making data more consumable and enabling our analytics community. Data & AI Management - accountable for the standardisation, management, protection and use of reliable data, including the controlled adoption of AI. Platform Engineering - accountable for delivering and operating scalable, resilient and cost-effective data platforms, tools and environments, with goals to simplify and modernise the data ecosystem.  This is how you bring the purpose of your role to life: Apply your technical expertise and breadth of knowledge to contribute to the delivery of data infrastructure at scaleDrive simplification of complex datasets including creation of scalable, tested and repeatable data pipelines and infrastructuresDrive data quality across pipelines and implement system controls to support and uplift platforms - including automation when appropriate, operate as DevOpsDevelop Design/architecture to build reliable data flow, combining analytical batch processing, real-time data flows and low-latency APIs and evaluate and identify new features and architecture that solve challenging problems at scaleConsult and provide input for data solutioning at stages or throughout the stages of data lifecycle - calling out potential risks and opportunitiesImplement information security controls into the data solutionEstablish and deliver best practice and security considerations across stages of solution design, delivery and operationCollaborate with various stakeholders, including business and technical teams, to enable reusable and accessible solutionsCoach and guide others to build capability and foster collaborative and learning cultureAbout YouWe're looking for someone who has experience inEssential Understanding of data lifecycle as well as data quality, security, and optimisation of data pipelines following best practice guidelinesExperience in building and delivering data solutionsExpertise in Spark, Python, Scala, and SQLExperience in working with high volume and multiple data typesUnderstanding of latest cloud platforms of data products including Azure and Amazon RedShiftHigh desirable Experience in design and delivery of pipeline automation in a cloud environmentExperience in designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines using Hadoop stack i.e. Hive, Oozie, Yarn / MapReduce, Spark (must) with SCALA (Pref)Experience and understanding of Agile way of working _________________________________ If you are looking to take the next step in your career, we want to hear from you!-------------------------------------We encourage applications from people of all abilities and backgrounds - including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBQTI+ community, linguistically diverse, and people living with disability. When you apply, you can choose to note the pronouns you use and /or any reasonable adjustments needed to take part equitably during the interview process.  www.telstra.com.au/careers/diversity-and-inclusion or email us at noting your preferred method of contact.

Job Description:The Service Engineer's primary responsibilities include delivering technical support to our customers, performing installations and servicing of equipment distributed throughout Australia and New Zealand, proficiently troubleshooting technical issues, and providing effective solutions along with detailed technical reports. Additionally, you will be expected to patriciate in training sessions provided by our international supply partners, which may require occasional travel. The Service Engineer will also play a crucial role in providing training to our customers and engaging with vendors and manufacturers to resolve product-related issues. ResponsibilitiesPerform field service activities, including commissioning, operation, testing, integration, optimization, and maintenance of equipment.Perform all mechanical, electrical, electronic, and optical tuning and setup.Collaborate with customers on-site and provide consultancy to help customers achieve the highest performance.Receive training and be equipped with the necessary knowledge and tools. About You: We are seeking an individual who thrives on hands-on work with machinery and equipment and enjoys collaborative teamwork. Being tech-savvy, from computer systems to electronics, is essential in this role, as you'll be comfortable troubleshooting and swiftly implementing resolutions. Additionally, physical capability to lift heavy boxes and equipment is required. Effective communication skills, both with internal colleagues and external stakeholders, are paramount, as you will serve as our go-to person for ensuring seamless interactions and problem-solving. Qualifications:1 - 3 years of experience in field service and customer support.Working knowledge of basic analog and digital circuits, electrical power circuits, and PLC circuits.A willingness to travel at least 50% of the time with a high degree of flexibility.Ability to read electrical schematics.Strong technical problem-solving, troubleshooting, and follow-up skills.Passion for engineering and the ability to relate to customers from diverse backgrounds and cultures. Why Work for Us:Join a small, close-knit team.Opportunity to acquire knowledge, grow professionally, and refine your skills through interactions with national and international customers.Professional training and development opportunities.Encouragement of innovation in a collaborative environment where idea sharing is valued.Opportunity to travel nationally and internationally.Potential to shape and personalize your role within a rapidly expanding company. About VocusWe’re a leading specialist fibre and network solutions provider that’s all about making things better, simpler, and easier, for both our customers and team members.Our mission is to be the challenger that our customers deserve, and our people are proud of every day. We are Australia’s fourth-largest telco and a leading specialist fibre and network solutions provider, connecting Australia and New Zealand to the world. We bring together some great retail brands, too. We’ve built, own, and manage our own networks. We work hard to be united as one team, dedicated to providing amazing experiences for our customers.The opportunityAre you ready to shape the future of technology? At Vocus, we believe in the power of diverse perspectives to drive innovation. We are seeking a talented Systems Engineer to join our dynamic team.As a Systems Engineer at Vocus, you’ll be at the forefront of designing, implementing and maintaining cutting edge systems and infrastructure. Your focus will be on ensuring availability and performance for our customers.What You’ll Be Doing Day-to-dayImplement and maintain resilient, secure and scalable infrastructure solutions.Drive the adoption of DevOps, SRE and IaC approaches.Provide technical support and troubleshooting expertise.Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.Create and maintain technical documentation, reports and records.Test, implement, monitor and tune systems software/hardware for optimum system performance.Analyse systems performance data and recommending on performance improvements.About YouThis role is perfect for you if you believe in the power of relationships and teamwork. Whether working autonomously or within a tight-knit team, you thrive in dynamic environments and can adapt to new challenges. Your integrity and empathy are the cornerstones of your work, and you are able to lead and build a successful and respected relationship with those you work with, being able to truly make a difference whilst delivering your work. You embody the Vocus Values of One Team, Our People, Disruptive Thinking and being crazy about our customers and bring with you, proactive teamwork, collaboration, and a positive attitude to every project.No matter your background, you will come with an open mindset to continuously develop and strive for a career at Vocus.If you have a passion for technology, a commitment to excellence, driven, organised and tenacious this role could be for you! Some of the key attributes we look for are:You thrive on creating resilient, secure and scalable infrastructure solutions.You have a deep understanding of enterprise-grade containerisation and orchestration systems, including Puppet, Ansible, Foreman, Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher and GitLab.You are familiar with server clustering and HA failover scenarios with knowledge in diverse infrastructure models, from hyperconvergence to virtualisation and public cloud solutions like GCP.Complex systems monitoring is your playground, utilising tools like InfluxDB, Prometheus, Grafana and SNMP.You have scripting and programming skills (Go, Python, bash/zsh/ksh) to enable you to automate tasks efficiently.Tertiary qualifications in IT, Computer Science or related discipline with experience working in large, distributed enterprise environments.Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to engage business and technology teams.5-7 years commercial experience in IT/Systems Engineering. Vocus Vibes & PerksOur business is crazy about customers. We use disruptive thinking every day to deliver incredible experiences to our customers and teams. We empower our people to Do it. Own it. Love it. and that’s why they choose to work for us. Here, it’s never just a job – we care about what we do and the impact we have, and that’s what connects us.We offer:Diverse and dynamic teams with a supportive culture.Comprehensive ongoing training, support, and development opportunities.Hybrid Working Environment – 2 days in the office, 3 days working from home.Generous discounts on Power, Gas, Mobile and Internet; plus, discounts to over 400 retailers.Leave Offerings – Anniversary leave, ability to purchase additional leave and paid superannuation contributions for parental leave.Study Assistance – Programs to excel your leading and development.Health & Wellbeing – Support and initiatives.It’s a seriously exciting time to join the Vocus Group and there’s even more to come. If you think you want to join us and be part of something great, apply now!

Alternately, our North Lakes and Kawana sites have secure free parking and access to transport. Extra leave - Enjoy additional leave days on us! You’ll receive a paid ‘ME’ day and one paid volunteer leave day annually. Team members can also purchase up to two additional weeks of leave per year. Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits. Workplace giving - If you’re passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we’ll dollar match your donations to registered charities. Development opportunities - We’re championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses. Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products. Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes. Onsite facilities – There are excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers. Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.If you are seeking a new challenge and would enjoy the opportunity to work in a growing and changing business, click on the APPLY NOW button and submit your application.Auto & General values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all. A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Who are We?At Target, we’re getting back to what we’re famous for - real quality, that’s really affordable. We’re making products that stand up to the test of everyday life, at prices that don’t cost the earth.We’re making mums happy. Kids smile. Family life, that little bit easier.We’re making sure every Australian can enjoy our products, whilst making a positive difference to our planet so families can trust and rely on us for generations to come.That’s the Target Australians needs right now. And that’s the Target we’re here to be.With our instantly recognisable logo we are one of the most iconic brands on the Australian retail market and for almost 100 years we have held a special place in the hearts and minds of Australian families.. It brings us loyal customers who love and trust us. From first baby clothes to first fashion moments, we have created special memories that families across the country hold dear. By making affordable quality and style accessible for all, we have built a reputation for helping Australian families live better.As an iconic Australian retailer we’re immensely proud of our history and need people to join us who are as excited by our future as we are!That’s Who We Are. That’s Target.What will you do?As the Planning Assistant in Children's Sleep, underwear and socks your primary accountability will be to maximise stock efficiency through size and attribute analysis and ordering and to analyse stock to sales at a regional and store level and provide recommendations to the Planner and Inventory Team to improve the balance of inventory across regions and stores.You will be also responsible for both structured and ad-hoc RBU or department level reporting. Assist in the analysis of these reports and as a result, advise actions to be taken and optimise quantification of Australia orders to deliver balanced inventory across countriesOther responsibilities will include:Size and Attribute Analysis: Ensure Size Profile Optimisation Tool (SPO) is updated and accurate Monitoring and reporting on product performance at an attribute level. Monitoring accuracy of attribute data Perform scheduled size analysis and implement adjustments to size ratios through forward ordering.a. Post seasonal reporting on size and attribute performance.nMake recommendations of size ratio for new productsCountry/Region Balance:Quantify Australia apportionment for orderingWeekly review of regional performance to ensure balance across regions. Provide recommendations to the Planner and Supply Analyst on adjustments to be made at consensus meeting.Review timing of seasonal launch and exit across regions and provide recommendations to the PlannerExecute store exclusions in the relevant systems including Seasonal Ranging Tool (SRT)Ensure on and off range dates are accurate and updated by region in SRTCommunicate with stores as required including store visits (as agreed with manager).Planning SupportRun weekly, monthly and seasonal reports and work with planners in interpreting the analysis and actions for their departments as a result.Support Planner in weekly trade analysis and actions and add new options to Newline TrackerPlanning of table fixtures by calculating min, max and capacity levels to always ensure sufficient stock across all stores.Update Line Cards weekly to ensure correct flow and adjust as required. Provide recommendations on improvements to flowWeekly review of reports and providing recommendations on adjustmentsReport on performance of key programs and provide recommendations on adjustments to forward planAccountable for Post Seasonal reporting and analysis (PSR) including Category, Style, Option performance, Attribute analysis, Regional analysis covering all key financial metricsSetup of TPR planning document in preparation for the financial planning process, including running and analysing New Product Demand Forecasting Tool (NPDF).What are we looking for?The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate at least 2+ years of planning experience in a specialty fast paced retail environment with a tertiary qualification in Finance, Operations or Business would be an advantage and with demonstrated experience working cross-functionally to achieve objectives , and ability to trade in a business that is reacting quickly to market pressures.We're looking for a commercially savvy individual who will bring a curious and data-driven mind-set as well as a passion for all things Retail! You love focusing on product, customers are always front of mind and building and managing relationships with a variety of key stakeholders is one of your strengths.We'd also love you to have: Experience working in a Planning Assistant or Allocating role is preferredExcel – intermediate to advanced Administration experience Stores experience Bachelor Degree (Undergrad)What will you get? Great career opportunities across the Wesfarmers Group. Team Member discounts across Target, Kmart, Bunnings, Officeworks and Catch Membership. A free One Pass membership offering free delivery across Kmart, Target & Catch on eligible product. Access to Employee Assistance Program. Convenient location next to freeway and train station, with free onsite parking and a café! Novated leasing options. Paid parental leave scheme. Flexible hybrid work arrangements through our Flex Where, Flex When, Flex Well policy, spending 60% of your week in our Target Store Support Office (including Work-From-Home days with a real work-life) balance. Reflection room, space for prayer, meditation, or time for yourself. A Supported Learning and Career Development program. Opportunity in Wesfarmers Share Plan access (where eligible) and to participate in a bonus program (where eligible).We believe that all team members should feel valued, respected and safe irrespective of your gender, ethnicity, indigeneity, religious beliefs, education, age, disability, family responsibilities, sexual orientation and gender identity and we encourage applications from all candidates.As part of our recruitment process, we will be conducting Pre-Employment Checks with our successful candidates – this will include a police check. Talent Acquisition will provide further updates to candidates as they progress through our recruitment process.Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.“We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant”.If you would like to explore a career with Target and this sounds like the perfect role for you – apply now!

Our client is a large Federal Government department, looking for an IT Test Analyst to join their Data and Analytics delivery team to implementing a modernised Data and Analytics Eco-system with the use of Cloud Services for data ingestion and consumption, data stores and tooling. The role is a unique contracting opportunity, initially commencing with a 6-month contract with 2x 12 month extension. The ideal candidate will be based in Adelaide, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne or Perth!As the IT Test Analyst, you will work in a fast-paced environment conducting various phases of testing from function, integration and end to end testing of the ingestion, storage and consumption patterns using Azure/AWS cloud native technologies and some third-party products, that adhere to security and policy frameworks. Services developed must integrate with multiple existing applications hosted on a range of premise and cloud technologies. We are seeking motivated and experienced professionals who have a strong background working in a similar role in State or Federal Government.Role Responsibilities:Prepare, create, maintain, execute and review test requirements and scripts, derived from design analysis and liaise with design, for AWS/Azure cloud native technologies that has the ability to integrate with with Cloud and Premise applications Raise defects, gathering information for defect entries and identifying points of failure and organising resources in the investigation of issue Contribute to and review testing artefacts, including strategies, plans, risk assessments, test specifications and/or status reports Develop, document, monitor and improve testing processes and procedures and promote testing best practice Contribute to plans, coordinate, prepare and sequence test cases based on priorities of the use-case and that meet the overall strategic direction of the DAPS program Work collaboratively to identify, validate and implement test improvement strategies and change initiatives to contribute to the delivery of program outcomes Apply project management principles in the development and delivery of testing objectives and outcomes Provide technical advice on test processes, governance standards and frameworks Develop test documentation that clearly articulates the intent, user experience, systems and business processes, issues and risks being tested Identify risks with application issues and take these into account when planning and priority setting to meet timeframes and quality requirements Contribute to shakedown of test environments and process test data to test wide range of scenarios Responsible for the breakdown of stories within the features; and identifying the tasks within the stories assigned to them Ensure Team Foundation Server (TFS) reflects correct integrated releases and tags Investigate bugs or incidents and contribute to tech bridges as required Role Requirements:Australian CitizenshipBaseline Security ClearanceKnowledge or experience in working with Azure/AWS cloud native services as well as big data/analytics platforms (preferably Teradata Data Warehouse and/or Cloudera Hadoop)Proficiency in Agile project delivery methodologyExperience in Agile and DevOps methodologiesAmazon Web Services (AWS)RedshiftAzure Cloud servicesBig data analyticsTest Automation ExperienceTeam Foundation Server (TFS)This role is available immediately, so if your skills and experience match the above and you are interested in hearing more about this opportunity, please contact Renee Irwin on the details provided below.Email: renee.i@muraconnect.com.auPhone: 0432 755 458

Primary DetailsTime Type: Full timeWorker Type: EmployeeLocation: Sydney Type: Permanent, full timeThe opportunityOpportunity to work for a leading Global Insurer.Your new roleThis role is responsible for providing input into business decisions through the data analysis of trends and business opportunities using both standard and specialized models/systems. This role provides portfolio, pricing and decisioning data, analysis, insights, and recommendations.You will also;Lead the analysis, insights, and recommendations on portfolio performance aimed at balancing the risk of underwriting compliance with policy and underwriting efficiency.Identify portfolio trends, compare to benchmarks, and provide insights, recommendations and reports to business within pre-defined timeframes.Liaise with the business to identify key metrics and develop reports or business models to monitor these on a regular basis.Own and manage reporting and analytics for relevant business units, both internally and externally. Ensure reports are delivered on-time.Lead the development of project documentation in alignment with company policies/methodologies.Provide support to customers and internal stakeholders in respect to justification of policy changes and tracking of specific risks.About YouTo be successful as a Senior Analyst, Credit Modelling you will have extensive experience in scorecard modelling and credit risk analytics within the financial services industry.You will also have;Strong written and verbal communication skills. Familiarity with advanced analytical techniques in Python or R, including regression, ONA, NLP, neural networks, or similar.Ability to influence stakeholders at different levels and manage relationships.Experience in model buildingAbility to analyze, interpret and extrapolate data from several sources and resolve complex issues.About QBEWe can never really predict what’s around the corner, but at QBE we’re asking the right questions to enable a more resilient future – helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage.We’re an international insurer that’s building momentum towards realising our vision of becoming the most consistent and innovative risk partner.And our people will be at the centre of our success. Are you passionate about data & curious to understand customer behavior and its links to commercial outcomes? This role might be just for youNewly created roles to support the delivery of a key strategic initiative in improving the shopper experienceDrive a store-specific space and range proposition that are unique to our customers needs. 12-month secondment with a view to extendingTrue hybrid & flexible work arrangements with collaborative workspaces in Bella Vista & Surry Hills About UsTailoring our product offer to every community we serve across Australia is a key strategic initiative. As we continue to differentiate our brand, our Micro Space team continues to introduce new capabilities and data-driven innovation to offer the best localised product range within in-store displays.We work closely with key Commercial Managers, Buying partners, Operations, Ranging Analytics, and Micro Space Optimisation teams and ultimately provide front-line analysis to enable great customer outcomes to suit their demographics, needs and expectations.About The RoleAs part of a highly innovative and collaborative Micro Space Optimisation team, you will play a lead role in the continued space optimisation of products within planograms.Supporting the merchandiser, you will inform a merchandise vision and multi-year strategy for categories through use of data and insights, product merchandising & leveraging of technology. You will initiate information gathering & lead proactive conversations that enable our team to unlock opportunities in regards to Merchandising, which will support the commercial teams range decisions.Working Alongside The Merchandisers, You Will Be Responsible ToPartner with Merchandisers, Category Managers and key commercial stakeholders to support, identify and offer solutions to enable efficiency and store specific range through Planogram generator capabilityProvide key analysis into performance and outputs of categories, explaining specific outcomes including articulating operational metric performanceGathering of insights and data, demonstrating strong analytical rigour that inform and influence the current merchandise opportunities within a category strategy through product merchandisingIdentifying continuous improvement opportunities that will improve our customer experiences and operational efficienciesThinking outside the box, pushing the technical capability of Planogram Generator to challenge existing methods of space optimisation, advancing our Range & Space tool capability and exploring new opportunities to deliver a store specific range and space offerAbout YouYou are currently a curious Analyst with a passion for customer insights who is looking to take on a new challenge that requires expertise in driving and delivering results.You will have proven experience in interpreting data and deriving actionable insights to make customer-focused & commercially-viable recommendations.You adapt to new situations, and know-how to maximise value, sometimes, with limited information and inputs.Experience in commercial, FMCG or retail is highly desired, but not strictly required.2-3 years experience in relevant roles (eg: insights analyst, merchandise analyst, category analyst, category executive, sales analyst, account executive) Bachelor Degree in Business, Marketing, Finance or related subject or equal professional experienceYou have clear analytical thinking, with the capability of breaking information into component parts, patterns and relationships. Capable of interpreting data and deriving actionable insights for short and long-term strategiesYou demonstrate a track record in proactive stakeholder management ability with good communication and problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to translate technical concepts into business languageYou are a confident communicator and storyteller; with strong visualisation, verbal and written skills Sound like your next opportunity? Fisher & Paykel is one of Australasia's best-known brands, a global company with a strong heritage. Our New Zealand origins, curious nature and passion to develop products designed around people are core elements that make us unique.  Driven by our brand values of being real, sustainably minded, generous and curious, as a team we take a collaborative approach, have a culture where ideas are heard, and are united in our leading goal to be the world's most human-centred, #1 premium appliance brand. Based at our Macquarie Park, Sydney HQ, this opportunity is best suited to a value-adding Commercial Analyst who has a passion for influencing in a dynamic and fast paced environment. Tasked with providing critical insights and analysis to our Australian business, you will revel in turning data into business insights to ultimately drive sales performance and cost optimisation.  This is where you come in We are looking for a goal driven analyst to step into this business partnership role, and be an integral part of the team, requiring an intrinsic understanding of the commercial environment we operate in. You'll be key in translating financial information into clear direction for our sales and marketing to work with. So who are you? You are an experienced Commercial Analyst, who naturally builds robust working relationships and helps drive commercial decision making. The purpose of the role is to support our Australian business to achieve our targets and pursue our leading goals. Contributing financial insights and solutions to support business planning, decision making and the execution to lift operational and financial performance. You will help provide the financial information and analytical insights which the business requires to operate effectively, efficiently and in a timely manner. A proven finance professional with demonstrated commercial experience preferably in a business partnering role with no less than 2-3+ years on the job experience, you'll have the ability to develop and apply the correct commercial and financial solutions for the right situations and environments. You will have demonstrated experience in a Commercial Analyst with strong Business Partnering skills in a fast-paced, commercial environment. Preferred experience in Distributor or a Consumer Goods retail focused environment of a medium to large organisation. You're comfortable taking ownership for the forecast and budgeting cycles and their interface into the strategic planning process. As well as bringing the technical knowhow, it is vital that you can communicate, influence and effectively partner with people at all levels of the organisation. Familiarity with building and running PowerBI reports or similar is advantageous. You will utilise these on a frequent basis to present data analysis to the sales team and key stakeholders. Technical Skills Strong financial understanding and analytical skills.Ability to identify opportunities to improve business performance.Strong commercial acumen and experience in translating financial results into commercial and operational performance.Strong analytical skills, especially make meaning of diverse data to highlight key components of over / under achievement vs plan, identify trends and insights.Advanced user of MS Office and analytics applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI).Systems skills and knowledge of large ERP systems (JDE, Salesforce).A high level of accuracy is required as is a keen eye and attention to detail. What we offer We can give you the rare opportunity to move into a large, complex global organisation headquartered in NZ, where you will gain wide exposure across the business. This role has diverse and exciting challenges and the chance to continually learn and develop. Along with a competitive salary, flexible working, ongoing development and excellent growth and progression opportunities, as a valued member of our team you'll enjoy generous discounts on Fisher & Paykel and Haier product. Apply now providing your CV and a cover letter.
