Company DescriptionIntellificial was founded as QualityArc in April 2016, and in April 2021, the company rebranded as Intellificial and is now a leader in Activated Intelligence. Intellificial offers solutions in diverse industries, such as retail and healthcare, and provides services in Data Analytics, AI, Automation, RPA, and iQA to make life and work easier.Role DescriptionThis is a full-time Senior Analyst role at Intellificial, located in Melbourne, VIC. As a Senior Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects across multiple industries. As a Senior Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the reliability and performance of our software products and services to the client. They will be responsible for designing, developing and executing automated test cases, as well as collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver  high-quality software solutions. Their expertise in automation testing using Selenium, OPKEY and RestAssured will be crucial in achieving our quality goals.The Senior Analyst is not just a testing expert but also a seasoned quality assurance professional with a profound knowledge of software testing processes, best practices, and concepts. In addition to their technical prowess, they possess adept stakeholder management capabilities and effective reporting skills, all underpinned by strong commercial and business acumen. Furthermore, the Senior Analyst has the ability to analyze, structure and optimize relevant knowledge and data to meet the company's specific requirements.Key Responsibilities• Develop and maintain automated test scripts using Selenium(Java), OPKEY and RestAssured to verify software functionality, performance and reliability.• Collaborate with the development and product teams to understand project requirements and translate them into comprehensive testplans and test cases.• Execute test cases to identify defects, track and report issues using defect tracking tools such as HP ALM and JIRA.• Ensure proper documentation of test procedures, results, and defects for traceability and reporting.• Work closely with the QA team to contribute to the continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies.• Participate in all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC).• Perform Black Box Testing to validate software functionality from an end-user perspective.• Collaborate with stakeholders to gather project requirements, plan testing activities and design effective test scenarios.• Utilize Test Management Tools such as HP ALM and JIRA for test execution and defect tracking.• Create and maintain test data to support automated test suites.• Generate and analyse reports from JIRA, Zephyr, JIRA Dashboards, Sumologic, Mixpanel and other tools to monitor project progress and quality metrics.• Troubleshoot and assist in resolving issues related to test environments, configurations and test data.Qualifications• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.• Around 5 years of experience as a Test Engineer with a focus on automation testing.• Experience in automation testing tools: Selenium with Java, OPKEY, RestAssured.• Experience with automation testing using Eclipse, IntelliJ, and other relevant tools.• Knowledge of test planning, test case design, and execution.• Familiarity with Test Management Tools such as HP ALM and JIRA.• Strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle(SDLC), Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC), and Bug Life Cycle.• Excellent communication and teamwork skills.• Ability to work independently and take ownership of testing responsibilities.• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

You want to play a part in making NSW a better place to work, live and travel.You have the opportunity to gain a wealth of expertise and a diverse range of skills, providing insight and knowledge without losing sight of your work-life balance or wellbeing.In This Role, You'llSupport projects in delivering assets that are safe and fit for purpose, through the application of Systems and Safety Assurance processes. These roles are technical in nature and you will act as an internal consultant, developing effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to support programs and projects in the development and delivery of solutions that are safe to operate and maintain.Due to the unprecedented scale of investment in the Transport for NSW Future Transport strategy we have a range of opportunities for Systems Assurance Engineers & Systems Safety Engineers within the Infrastructure and Place Technical Service’s team.Do you live to promote safety and assurance using evidence-based thinking? Are you interested in applying Systems Assurance, Systems Safety, or Systems Engineering to support delivery of assets in complex operating environments? If you want to be a part of building NSW transport infrastructure and make your mark on flagship multi-modal transport projects such as the Digital Systems Program, More Trains More Services, Regional Rail, Western Harbour Tunnel, Great Western Highway Upgrade and many more, we would love to meet you!Please click here to view a copy of the role description.About YouYou will have tertiary qualifications in Engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent experience.Ideally, you will have some experience in the rail or road transportation sector. You will have an interest in safety engineering, systems engineering and/or technical assurance principles and tools. Experience in applying these principles in other safety- and mission-critical sectors, such as defence, aerospace or medical devices, would also be highly regarded.Key Systems Assurance Activities You Will Support Include Supporting projects in demonstrating compliance with relevant systems and safety assurance processes, engineering standards and technical and user requirements during all phases of the project. Performing systems assurance reviews for compliance with systems and safety engineering requirements and demonstrating that the end product is safe. Reviewing safety assurance reports, risk assessments and systems engineering reports and providing recommendations for improvement. Ensuring that risk assessments, risk controls and verification of implementation of risk controls are documented and managed by the project throughout the project lifecycle to ensure any residual risks can be transitioned to the asset owner. Contributing best practice data and information in order to continuously improve the Systems Assurance function. Building strong relationships with stakeholders to achieve project goals and delivery Configuration Management outcomes.What We Offer An opportunity to work on the client side of major infrastructure projects, and experience the application of Systems Engineering, Systems Safety and Configuration Management throughout the lifecycle of an asset. Learning and development opportunities – formal training, participation in Communities of Practice and Working Groups, continuous improvement of ways of working. Highly flexible Hybrid Working environment.Who We AreTransport for NSW provides a safe, integrated, and efficient transport system. We connect people, communities and industry every day.Join usOur workforce is as diverse as the community we serve. If you’d like further information on our inclusion and diversity initiatives, visit Transport careers .We offer a wide range of employee benefits , like our award-winning flexible and hybrid work options.Regional candidates are encouraged to apply. This is a Hybrid+ role designed for people living in NSW’s regions or further away from the role’s listed home base. It combines virtual work with in-person days at your team’s home base.What are you waiting for…? Connect with us. Apply now!Applications close: 11:59 pm Sunday 29th October 2023.For more information about this role, please contact FRANK.ROCA@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU.People living with disability are supported throughout the recruitment process and at work. Visit Supporting people with disability for more info or speak to your talent team member to arrange any adjustments to how you interact with us.Need some help with your application? Take a look at our application tips video series .

Job DescriptionTechnical Business Analyst PAYING: $900-$1000 incl super per/dayLOCATION: Sydney, Australia (3 days in the office per week)LENGTH: 4-Month Contract (with a 6-month extension possible)Are you a skilled Technical Business Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to work with one of Australia's leading retail companies? We are seeking a Technical Business Analyst to join our team and support a critical project for their Online offering, which makes up their e-commerce marketplace. If you are a dynamic and detail-oriented professional with experience in scoping and requirements gathering for technical projects, we want to hear from you.Job Description:As a Technical Business Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting a scoping exercise around a significant change to our product fulfillment model for their Online Market Place. This change will impact both our customers and retailers, making your contribution vital to our success. You will work directly with one of our Lead Engineers to scope options, including effort and costs, required to implement this change. Your work will culminate in a compelling business case to be presented to our stakeholders in Q4 of this calendar year, just in time for the holiday season.Key Responsibilities:Collaborate closely with our Lead Engineer to scope options for the product fulfillment model change, with a focus on the Mirakl online marketplace software, specifically the fulfillment aspect.Familiarity with Stripe (Payment Gateway) and BigCommerce, with the ability to assess their relevance to the project.Assess and enhance the customer experience for our web-based e-commerce platform, with a specific emphasis on fulfillment, including click and collect, delivery, and vendor integration for parcel fulfillment.Utilize your business analysis skills to equip the delivery team with clear sequences, key milestones, and cost estimates.Lead the scoping and requirement gathering processes, ensuring clarity and precision in all project aspects.Contribute to the transformation of our fulfillment model through tranch-based delivery, presenting multiple options to drive informed decision-making.Qualifications And Requirements:Previous experience as a Technical Business Analyst, with a strong understanding of how to equip a delivery team for success.Proficiency in scoping and requirement gathering for technical projects, particularly in the e-commerce or online marketplace domain.Familiarity with Mirakl online marketplace software (ideally a MUST) and familiarity with Stripe (Payment Gateway) and BigCommerce (COULD).Knowledge of web-based customer experiences, with an emphasis on fulfillment processes.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent communication and presentation skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment.Self-motivated and results-driven.Availability to work in our Sydney office 3 days a week.If you are a proactive Technical Business Analyst who is passionate about e-commerce, fulfillment, and delivering exceptional customer experiences, we invite you to apply for this exciting 4-month contract position. Contact John Beynon at john@theonset.com.auNote: This is a contract position for 4 months, with the expectation of working in our Sydney office 3 days a week.

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Are you a full-stack engineer who thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team to contribute to innovative products that deeply leverage AI and that are reshaping industries and changing the way we work and learn.Our strategic product line includes:Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent, making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students quickly master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, modeling divergences and data synchronization.What we offer:The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in Angular, AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are making a real difference in people's lives.We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Apply today!What You Will Be DoingBuilding modern web apps using Angular accompanied by top-notch libraries and tools.Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.What You Won’t Be DoingSpending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.Basic RequirementsSenior Developer key responsibilitiesAt least 3 years of experience writing frontend code (any framework)At least 1 year of experience writing frontend code in Angular.At least 3 years of experience writing backend code (any framework).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.Nice-to-have RequirementsExperience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next:You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.Important! If you do not receive an email from us:First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.Crossover Job Code: LJ-4774-AU-Melbourn-SeniorDevelope.002

Define roadmap of greenfield projectsVery flexible working arrangementsCollaborative and Innovative solutions Our client  Exciting opportunity to join like -minded, forward-thinking technology professionals in a busy environment and develop solutions and have access to learn new technologies. There will be an opportunity to shape engineering practices from the ground up within a rapidly growing tech company.   The role This senior position will be a core member of a team that is currently developing a greenfield cloud native solution using Python, FastAPI and AWS. The position involves working closely with business users and analysts to understand the requirements and communicate with both technical and business stakeholders. With this role also comes the opportunity to be a core participant in systems and solution design. Key responsibilities Lead the development of a cloud native greenfield product.Build RestAPIs within a microservices architecture.Mentor and coach Junior Developers. Your Profile  Key skills required to be considered for this role: 5+ years of Python experienceAPI design and developmentExperience with web development frameworks, ideally FastAPICloud – AWSDevOps | CI/CD PipelinesAGILE deliveryAbility to be a problem solver and to work autonomously Feel free to reach out to jfitzpatrick@fourquarters.com.au for more information.

About The Business - Infrastructure SAA key function of ISA is the review of major government infrastructure proposals (building and construction) over $50 million to ensure they are being effectively and efficiently managed, planned and delivered. The projects are reviewed at various points of their lifecycle by independent review teams of experienced infrastructure professionals, which is managed by the Assurance unit within ISA. In support of this function the team also reviews and analyses project reports on infrastructure projects from SA Government agencies to provide independent advice to government on trends, risks and opportunities to SA Government projects.Role HighlightsInvestigate, analyse and interpret data and information and prepare reportsProvide logistical, policy and administrative support for project activitiesBuild relationships with key internal and external stakeholdersRole DetailsThe Infrastructure Project Analyst is responsible for using sector knowledge and analytical skills to interpret and analyse data and information from multiple sources across the public and private sectors to inform and support decision making on asset and major infrastructure projects and programs. This includes seeking to understand problems and questions, acquiring information, analysing information and drafting reports for consideration by ISA Executive, ISA Board and SA Cabinet. The role will also contribute to the Project Assurance Coordinator function and proactively support Infrastructure SA s Project Assurance activities. This includes coordinating independent reviews of major infrastructure projects and programs in accordance with the objectives of the Infrastructure SA Act 2018, the ISA Assurance Framework and Guidance Material, and internal policies and procedures to ensure that Infrastructure SA continues to promote best practice in the planning, procurement and delivery of infrastructure.Special ConditionsThe Incumbent will be required to participate in the department's Performance Management Program.The Incumbent may be assigned to another position at this remuneration level or equivalent.Some work outside of normal hours will be required.Some interstate travel involving overnight absences will be required.This role requires a National Criminal History check.ClassificationASO5 - Administrative Services OfficerSalary Range$84,522 - $94,003 p.a.DurationOngoingEnquiries toGraeme BrownDirector AssurancePhone: 0418 802 545Email: Graeme.Brown@sa.gov.auApplications Close31/10/2023 11:00 PMAttachmentsRole_Description__Infrastructure_Project_Analyst_ASO5.pdfFlexibility StatementThe South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Our client is a large Federal Government department, looking for an IT Test Analyst to join their Data and Analytics delivery team to implementing a modernised Data and Analytics Eco-system with the use of Cloud Services for data ingestion and consumption, data stores and tooling. The role is a unique contracting opportunity, initially commencing with a 6-month contract with 2x 12 month extension. The ideal candidate will be based in Adelaide, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne or Perth!As the IT Test Analyst, you will work in a fast-paced environment conducting various phases of testing from function, integration and end to end testing of the ingestion, storage and consumption patterns using Azure/AWS cloud native technologies and some third-party products, that adhere to security and policy frameworks. Services developed must integrate with multiple existing applications hosted on a range of premise and cloud technologies. We are seeking motivated and experienced professionals who have a strong background working in a similar role in State or Federal Government.Role ResponsibilitiesPrepare, create, maintain, execute and review test requirements and scripts, derived from design analysis and liaise with design, for AWS/Azure cloud native technologies that has the ability to integrate with with Cloud and Premise applicationsRaise defects, gathering information for defect entries and identifying points of failure and organising resources in the investigation of issueContribute to and review testing artefacts, including strategies, plans, risk assessments, test specifications and/or status reportsDevelop, document, monitor and improve testing processes and procedures and promote testing best practiceContribute to plans, coordinate, prepare and sequence test cases based on priorities of the use-case and that meet the overall strategic direction of the DAPS programWork collaboratively to identify, validate and implement test improvement strategies and change initiatives to contribute to the delivery of program outcomesApply project management principles in the development and delivery of testing objectives and outcomesProvide technical advice on test processes, governance standards and frameworksDevelop test documentation that clearly articulates the intent, user experience, systems and business processes, issues and risks being testedIdentify risks with application issues and take these into account when planning and priority setting to meet timeframes and quality requirementsContribute to shakedown of test environments and process test data to test wide range of scenariosResponsible for the breakdown of stories within the features; and identifying the tasks within the stories assigned to themEnsure Team Foundation Server (TFS) reflects correct integrated releases and tagsInvestigate bugs or incidents and contribute to tech bridges as requiredRole RequirementsAustralian CitizenshipBaseline Security ClearanceKnowledge or experience in working with Azure/AWS cloud native services as well as big data/analytics platforms (preferably Teradata Data Warehouse and/or Cloudera Hadoop)Proficiency in Agile project delivery methodologyExperience in Agile and DevOps methodologiesAmazon Web Services (AWS)RedshiftAzure Cloud servicesBig data analyticsTest Automation ExperienceTeam Foundation Server (TFS)This role is available immediately, so if your skills and experience match the above and you are interested in hearing more about this opportunity, please contact Renee Irwin on the details provided below.Email: renee.i@muraconnect.com.auPhone: 0432 755 458

About UsEndeavour Group was created in 2020 through the restructure and merger of the Woolworths Group drinks and hospitality businesses. With a strong track record of growth, combined these businesses form the leading customer franchise in drinks and hospitality in Australia.United behind a common purpose of ‘Creating a more sociable future together’, we are a 28,000+ strong team with more than 1600 stores and 330 hotels nationally, including leading brands such as Dan Murphy’s, BWS and ALH Hotels.Endeavour Group is expected to separate from Woolworths during calendar year 2021 and will be well-positioned as an ASX Top 50 Company. Join the team at an exciting time in their evolutionAbout The OpportunityAs our IT Senior Commercial Analyst for Transformation, you’ll be responsible for facilitating the procurement and management of IT agreements throughout the contract lifecycle from creating and driving RFx activities, contract negotiations and management of renewals.The role will work closely Program Managers, Legal, Technology Stakeholders and Business Stakeholders across Endeavour Group’s key transformation streams to ensure procurement requirements are met, contract expenditure is aligned with budgetary commitments and transformation procurement activities are mapped and aligned with program timelines.The role will have the opportunity to support multiple Transformation programs and will cover hardware,software, and services contracts.A day in a life of a IT Senior Commercial AnalystEngage with Transformation stakeholders to develop materials to support go-to-market activities.Manage and run RFx activities including facilitating workshops, vendor shortlisting and notification of award or unsuccessful bids.Review vendor proposals with a particular focus on commercial outcomes and business benefits in alignment with program and Group strategies.Act as the central point of contact for vendors during contract negotiations.Facilitate deal working groups between Legal, Transformation, Technology and Business stakeholders to support with key decision making.Review contract terms and help deal working groups with understanding the commercial value in contracts and risks introduced within negotiated terms.Maintain consistent operating processes for managing vendor partners.Facilitate benchmarking research exercises to ensure Endeavour to continue to have the best service options in the market.Experience with competitive co-design, competitive dialogue and/or dynamic sourcing processes preferred but not mandatory.Functional SkillsWhat you’ll need to succeed Proven experience in negotiating and managing technology contracts for a large enterprise. Solid understanding of technology contracts, implementation contracts and managed service agreements. Strong analytical and problem solving skills, demonstrates a logical approach to problem solving. Can demonstrate use of initiative, flexibility and innovative thinking. Previous experience working with service partners, suppliers, system integrators, etc. Experience working in a Digital environment. Ability to think customer first and relate solutions back to the customer problem and outcomes.Leadership & Behaviour Enthusiastic and positive team member with a self-directed and self-motivated attitude. Excellent collaboration and facilitation skills with an ability to see past problems to solutions. Ability to work as an effective team member within a complex and fast paced environment. Eye for detail, and ability to quickly understand requirements. Comfortable with ambiguity. Excellent verbal and written communication and influencing skills. Strong stakeholder management and relationship building skills with the ability to influence stakeholders at various levels. Ability to see the big picture and take an enterprise approach.Desired Experience in retail, manufacturing or hospitality environmentsWhat's in it for you?Excellent remuneration package and flexible working in every sense. We value our peopleEveryday Rewards plus card - access exclusive employee discounts across Woolworths, BigW and Endeavour Group brands (BWS, Dan Murphy’s etc) and 50% off food at ALH venues.Our innovative ways of working include headspace mornings once a month (no meetings company-wide) Opportunity to partner alongside bright minds and genuine investment in leading technologies Career progression to help you realise your potential. As our business grows so do the opportunities for our peopleWork with an industry-leading team and be a part of one of the most exciting retail transformations in Australia Grow with Endeavour GroupBring your spark. Tap into our spirit. That’s the power of Endeavour.If you want to experience the diverse spirit of drinks and hospitality businesses, here you can tap into Australia’s leading brands including Dan Murphy’s, BWS, ALH, Pinnacle Drinks, Endeavour X and more.If you have a passion for connecting people with products they love, here you can join an industry that’s deeply embedded in the way Australians socialise, unwind and celebrate.If you want access to a breadth of career opportunities, here you can enjoy a path that travels between diverse roles and businesses within the Group.If you’re already asking ‘what’s next for me’ and our industry, here you’ll thrive.If you want to bring your full self to doing fulfilling work, here you’ll find a culture that’s welcoming, inclusive and responsible.If you are looking for flexibility, here we encourage our team members to work in ways that meets their work / life commitments and supports their wellbeing.Come grow with Endeavour where we are passionate about our purpose of creating a more sociable future together, and leaving a positive imprint on our team members and the communities we serve.If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au/endeavour/ #EGL #EDGOur Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Endeavour Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

About Woolworths GroupWoolworths Group is a food and everyday needs retailer united by the shared purpose of creating better experiences together for a better tomorrow. With more than 1,400 stores across its Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, and fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer. A top 10 company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), Woolworths Group employs more than 180,000 team members and serves more than 20 million customers a week.About UsWoolworths Group Technology delivers technology solutions to our organisation by providing the right innovative technology that works. Within Woolworths Group Technology, we currently have programs of work running to implement leading-edge solutions to accelerate business growth as well as change the way we work and deliver services to our internal and external customers.About The RoleThe Senior Systems Analyst will assist in the delivery of business support across the Kronos application. A key focus of this role will be promoting Kronos knowledge across our key business stakeholder group, Team members in line with the organisation's people processes and governance. This role will partner with Project Delivery teams, Service Delivery teams and IT to operate and maintain our integrated Time & Attendance solution including investigating and defining business needs, facilitating the delivery of system updates and improvements while working closely with the Optimisation and Devops teams to maintain consistency in application changes.Key ResponsibilitiesParticipate in delivering Kronos configuration updates end to end in line with defined governance and processDevelopment and delivery of robust testing plans for all work delivered. This can also include reviewing test plans to ensure QA controls are in placeSupport the Business with identifying updates required, driving case managementSupport and participate in key governance engagements to monitor systems performance and trendsEngage with stakeholders, facilitate and develop communications and trainings plans for Service Delivery and the Business as they relate to key cycles and processesMaintain and update documentation associated with any system enhancements including; workbooks and testing scriptsCoach and develop end users to deliver high quality support to the businessConduct application testing (new releases, functionality, and customising) in close co-operation with the development and testing teams.Assist in identifying the process and change impacts from the selected solution designs.Assist the Project Manager/Scrum Master with scope, issue, and risk management.Provide Level 2/3 production support appropriate to application.Support transition of newly delivered solutions to operational support.Work with a DevOps squad delivering and supporting new and existing solutions/applications.About YouThe ideal candidate should have demonstrable experience in Kronos Time & Attendance Strong experience in solution design Preferably some experience with Forecasting and Scheduling, but not mandatory Ability to design and build solutions that are easily supportable and meet business needs. Ability to manage a team of permanent and contract functional resources and ensure the timely and quality delivery of solutions through that team. Successful and proven results through Kronos implementations, support and projects Knowledge of end-to-end development processes and methodologies. Knowledge and experience with Agile Analytical thinking skills. What We Can Offer YouAn attractive remuneration package - including base salary, super and annual bonusAdded benefits - Including staff discounts and flexible work environmentAn exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people.Grow with the GroupAs an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.We’d love to hear from YouIf you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can follow us on LinkedIn or see more opportunities via www.wowcareers.com.au.

About Woolworths GroupWoolworths Group is a food and everyday needs retailer united by the shared purpose of creating better experiences together for a better tomorrow. With more than 1,400 stores across its Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, and fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer. A top 10 company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), Woolworths Group employs more than 180,000 team members and serves more than 20 million customers a week.About UsTechnology is a game-changer for any retail organisation. Woolworths is step-changing the way IT supports our business to meet our customers’ changing needs. Woolworths IT has designed the vision for the future - “We provide Technology that helps the Woolworths Group create daylight” and we understand the environment we are operating in.Woolworths IT delivers technology solutions to our organisation by providing the right innovative technology that works. Within Woolworths IT, we currently have programs of work running to implement leading-edge solutions to accelerate business growth, as well as change the way we work and deliver services to our internal and external customers.The opportunity Are you looking forward to working on cutting edge tools, platforms and technologies? Are you passionate about learning new things? We are seeking a passionate and self-driven Senior Business Analyst who is looking for their next career changing opportunity and challenge.If freedom and flexibility is what you want in your role, this is for you! Lots of breadth and depth for the right person and amazing career opportunities, where you can propel your career within the group.About The RoleThis role is an exciting opportunity for a highly organised and results-driven Senior Business Analyst with a curious and creative mindset to work within a dynamic team that will give you an opportunity to shape one of the biggest Customer facing applications at the Woolworths Group.Join an entrepreneurial team within one of Australia’s leading companies and shape the future of a growing initiative. The primary objective of the bunch team is to grow successful online food sampling communities where thousands of customers and team members share their real stories and get to taste, test and talk about all things food.What You’ll DoCollaborating with our Bunch Tribe (Business & Technology) to provide concept, feasibility analysis and functional requirements for initiatives.To elicit, analyse, communicate and validate the requirements for changes to business systems, processes and policies by writing quality user stories.Working in a tribe on projects and/or continuous improvement enhancements. Maintain a healthy backlog within Group Technology team members ensuring user stories are prioritised and groomed.Refining user stories and working with Group Technology team members to shape and influence system design.Development of Business process documentation, user acceptance testing scenarios and execution of user acceptance testing. Own and drive delivery of initiatives to timelines.Strong analytical and problem solving skills, demonstrates a logical approach to problem solving. Can demonstrate use of initiative, flexibility and innovative thinking.Can demonstrate strong communication, facilitation, negotiating and influencing skills.Demonstrate ability to quickly establish strong working relationships and communicate effectively with a wide range of business and Technology stakeholders from senior management to operational team members including external vendors both on and off shore.Can see the end to end impacts of change as well as work at a detailed level.Facilitate and coach squads in agile ways of working.Plan & drive deliverables and key requirements for strategic projects across the organisation. Ability to work both independently and as an effective team member within a complex and fast paced environment. Strong knowledge of agile frameworks, such as scrum and kanban, with ability to facilitate ceremonies and coach new team members in ways of working.Strong business and commercial acumen.Ability to take on Product Owner responsibilities.Negotiation and conflict resolution.About YouMinimum 3-5 years related work experience in a similar sized environment.B2C experience required, with a strong product/customer-centric mindset.Experience in projects and Continuous Improvement (CICD) that have used Agile and Waterfall methodologies highly regarded.Curious, innovative and creative thinker who is also an excellent problem solver.Excellent verbal and written communication.Excellent time management.Experience in Retail - desirable.Experience using tools such as Jira, Confluence, Browserstack - desirable.Experience in using Miro for collecting requirements from business, generating high-level user stories and mapping user stories desirable.Experience with data analytics eg: Tableau - desirable. Experience in building and enhancing digital Products and working hand in hand with Developers and Technical team members. Mobile application project and testing experience - desirable.Salesforce experience - desirable.Active contributing member of BA related professional and specialist groups.As our successful candidate you have proven experience working as a Senior Business Analyst using agile and waterfall methodologies and tools such as JIRA & Confluence. With your strong product/customer-centric mindset, you have the ability to work cross-functionally with both the business and technical teams in meeting core objectives and you can manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment. You are also an exceptional communicator who is innovative and forward thinking utilising the ability to facilitate decision making through analysis and problem solving. Exposure to digital or SaaS applications is desirable and the retail sector would be highly regarded.Above all, we are seeking innovators and thought leaders who will help us bring a little good to everyone, every day.Grow with the GroupAs an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. You can follow us on LinkedIn or see more opportunities via www.wowcareers.com.au.

Our purposeHere at Datacom, we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.About The RoleWe are currently seeking an experienced Senior Systems Engineer to join our high-performance Professional Services team.This is a customer facing consulting position that requires exceptional collaborative skills and the ability to build strong partnerships with our customers and within Datacom.The successful candidate will ideally have previous Professional Services experience with external customers and exposure to all aspects of delivering projects, including consulting, design, configuration, testing and deployment.At Datacom our approach is based upon our 6 core values of “It’s the people”, “Everyone has a part”, “Courage to Act”, Thrive together”, “Look Beyond today” and “Exceed customer expectations”. These values not only create a culture we can be proud of, but also supports and reinforces our focus on our customers, who remain at the heart of what we do.Please note that to be successful in this role, you must be an Australian Citizen and be able to achieve a Baseline or NV1 security clearance.What You'll DoIn this key cross-disciplinary role you will work closely with our Customers, Partners, Sales and Technical teams.Ensure assigned projects are delivered on time, within budget, to agreed scope.Serve as the technical point of contact for implementation services and solutions. This may either be provided remotely or on-site.Providing pre-sales support and expertise to the sales team.What You'll Bring To be successful in this role you must have a minimum of 5 years’ experience working with external enterprise customers in delivering projects in professional services environments.Must have experience with design, implementation and optimization ofWindows Server, Active Directory, Exchange.Virtualization (VMWare, Hyper-V, AHV).Have experience in one or both of the following.Backup (Commvault, Veeam).Storage (NetApp, Lenovo & Dell)Nice to have experience withPractical experience with Automation and Scripting (PowerShell, Python)You will have a curiosity & passion for customers and a proven ability to communicate solutions in a way that resonates with all levels of our customer’s. You must be comfortable in engaging both technical and non-technical staff and stakeholders.You can work both independently on competing priorities and as part of a team.You'll have excellent written and verbal communication skills.Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability. This role offers you an exciting opportunity to join a diverse team within a highly successful organisation.Due to rapid growth within our project portfolio, we are currently only considering applications for candidates with previous experience in consulting and/or project delivery for external customers. If you are ready for a change and wish to be a part of a fast paced and dynamic team where you can make a difference, then we would love to hear from you.Why Datacom?Datacom is ones of ANZs largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. As an ANZ company, we have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.At Datacom you'll be recognised and valued for your contributions. We're growing year on year and can provide stability, career opportunity and a collegial, agile, flat-structured environment that empowers people and promotes autonomy. We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours, professional development courses to name a few. We operate at the leading edge of technology to help ANZ’s largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.

DescriptionRous County Council -About Us  Rous County Council is unlike other councils. We are a small and unique organisation with a big role to play across our region. We are deeply connected to our communities through our environmental services of bulk water supply, weed biosecurity, and flood mitigation infrastructure across various local council areas.The Role If redesigning processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness excites you, or implementing new technology solutions is your thing, then come and join the team as our Business Analyst. Don’t pass on this opportunity to work with a highly motivated and professional team to support the delivery of Council’s Digital Transformation initiative NOVUS. In this role, you will be responsible for translating our business requirements into new end to end business process designs supported by Council’s new technology solutions. We want you to bring your expert analytical and design skills, engagement, and stakeholder skills to drive this project. It's not often that you get to make a real, life changing impact on the world. That your contribution to a project is so meaningful and the tech that you work on, so important, that you can truly say I've made a difference and I've made the world a better or safer place.This is one of those opportunities.The CompanyThe company is a Med Tech start up that is developing technology that reports on brain activity in real time while a patient is under general anesthetic. As a Firmware Engineer, your role would be to own the code and development environment for the control of the hardware component of the device. You would be at the forefront of a game-changing initiative, bringing a product to market that will significantly benefit mankind.An established yet rapidly evolving publicly unlisted company based in Perth, dedicated to the development of pioneering MedTech solutions. With an exclusive partnership with industry leader Philips, the growth potential is impressive and their flagship product is close to being a MVP. They are well funded and supported by a team of Med Tech experts, including three Ph.D. professionals. Their recent partnership with the Austrian Institute of Technology has solidified their position as industry leaders in brain signal technology, with several groundbreaking algorithms already integrated into their products. They are proud to have achieved FDA and TGA approval, ensuring their commitment to quality and a verified path to market.Your role as a Firmware Engineer, will assume end-to-end ownership of the firmware of their cutting-edge product, utilizing your expertise in ARM Cortex M4 microprocessors and the TI chip ADS1299. Your contributions will be critical in ensuring the implementation of signal processing chains and communication protocols, adhering to industry standards and their own stringent software lifecycle standards for MedTech devices (IE362304). With your familiarity in C# and C languages, experience with Git and exposure to RTOS, particularly FreeRTOS, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact from the ground up. Your role will encompass problem-solving, proactive project management, and seamless collaboration within their IT team, located across Perth, Sydney, Melbourne, and Korea.Key Responsibilities:Development, debugging, review, and maintenance of firmware for an ARM Cortex-M4 processor running freeRTOS Interfacing with the Texas Instruments ADS1299 ADC for biopotential measurements, including feature implementationIntegration of TensorFlow Lite based algorithms developed by collaboratorsImplementation of serial communication protocols and revision of signal processing chainsIntegration of additional memoryUnit testing, verification and validation testingDocumentation to a level suitable for regulatory authoritiesUse of issue tracking, quality management system, and Git version controlRequirements :Must have a Firmware coding experience in C Experience with ARM Cortex-M4 processors (ATSAMD51P20A) or similar combined MCU/DSP (Desired)Exposure to FreeRTOS, Git, and Mplab - Harmony v3, with a strong grasp of RTOS environments. (Desired)Experience with TensorFlow Lite for Microcontrollers, implementing signal processing chains and issue tracking (Desired)Knowledgeable in using Texas Instruments ADS1299 Biopotential ADC and working to IEC 62304 (Desired)Self-motivated, proactive, and a strong team player with excellent problem-solving skills. Familiarity with C# .net is a bonus.Perth-based role, office in the CBD. The CultureThink start up culture. Not bean bags and beanies (although feel free if that's your thing) but it's progressive, proactive, supportive and there's no such thing as micro-management. They employ professionals that are talented and they're trusted to get the job done while getting a lot of support from the network of professionals and partners both inside and outside the company. If you're good at what you do, you'll have the flexibility to get on and do it, without bureaucracy. The CEO is forward thinking and driven and determined to get the product to market without unnecessary delays. This passion for progress permeates through the organisation.If meaningful work, making a difference and Firmware coding in C is your thing, then please apply. Every application will get a response and every person who meets the technical requirements will be personally contacted. Daniel Linden and the team @ Transparency IT

There is a lot going on, it’s intellectually stimulating and it’s delivering real change for our customers. We are now looking for a Project Manager to join us as we continue on our transformation journey.Excited? We think these roles are broader than just tech project management.Results are important, but we’re in this for the long haul and ‘how’ we get there really matters. We’ve got some big teams, many working remotely to deliver our changes. We see being able to nurture a happy motivated team where everyone feels valued as a core part of this role.As a Business Analyst at Morrisons you'll be responsible for: Working with the business to understand and analyse business goals, functions and processes alongside documenting their requirements, creating structured epics and user stories and aligning with product roadmaps.  Helping to inform tactical decisions and assisting with the definition of long term strategic plans.  Working closely with product managers and both internal stakeholders and external partners to help design and deliver improvements to the technology stack which makes the job easier for colleagues and experience better for customers.  Advising on the approach for requirement management, defining the most appropriate requirement management life cycle method and ensuring requirements are captured and agreed with the product and project teams, and reflected in plans.  Identifying opportunities to improve business performance within a project or programme, leading analysis, identification and design of business changes to improve operations and services.  Leading on communicating with stakeholders, clarifying needs, questioning and managing expectations while focussing on the user and business needs.  Collaborating with the BA community in Morrisons to share best practice. You’ll also work with the team to facilitate opportunities to share learnings, bring to life concepts and create learning opportunities for all around the business.  Helping prepare and review test cases to ensure comprehensive coverage of the end to end solution and technology stack. About You You'll ideally have the following skills and experience:  Previous experience working as a Business Analyst, preferably in a large and fast-paced organisation, retail and/or supply chain background would be an advantage.  Experience managing the full project lifecycle for both large and small projects  Passionate about retail and customer experience: aware of the latest industry trends and competitor developments and ensures Morrisons remains competitive.  A broad perspective of a business, not just a single function  Innovative and inquisitive, with a track record of challenging the status quo and a natural problem solver.  Resourceful and proactive, with creative problem solving skills  Credible influencing and stakeholder management skills across all levels. About The TeamAbout Us Description:Our naturally digital thinking is driving a change programme that will make Morrisons a digitally focused retailer. We're making improvements across our diverse business and we're revolutionising our online journeys and making our processes faster, simpler and smarter to provide the freshest of products and an even better experience to millions of customers and over 111,000 colleagues.About The CompanyOur modern Head Office on the edge of Bradford is home to our different support teams from tech, marketing and finance to HR, trading and supply chain.Alive with activity, this is where decisions are made and our corporate teams make sure everything runs smoothly. Here, you’ll find comfy breakout areas, a coffee shop, newsagents and subsidised restaurant all within commuting distance of Leeds, Manchester and the Yorkshire Dales - always with free parking.We host regular seasonal events and you’ll often find our suppliers on site sharing details of their latest product. We’re also committed to fundraising for our current charity partner.Our business is fast paced and ever changing, as such we’ve lots of opportunities for you to play your part in our success. Are you a data scientist who is excited about brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) that increase human agency? Are you a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and wants to tackle challenging engineering problems? Do you want to work with a world-class remote team while having a big impact on the machine-learning approach for an early-stage project?We are looking for a Data Scientist who is interested in working with us at AE Studio on the future of neurotechnology!About AE StudioAE Studio is a mid-sized startup from California. We have a team of highly skilled developers, designers, and data scientists building products that increase human agency. We use the most recent technologies to develop solutions for startups as well as large companies like Samsung and Berkshire Hathaway. We have an awesome work environment and a highly productive process.One of AE Studio’s core missions is to develop brain-computer interface technologies that increase human agency. We are looking for someone with experience in data engineering, strong problem-solving skills, self-management skills, and enthusiasm to learn more about the intersection of data science and neuroscience.About The RoleYou will work on building deep learning models for neural decoding (classification or regression models with neurodata input). You will first learn the details of a variety of brain recording technologies (experience with multimodal brain recordings is a plus!), and help discover what type of model architectures work consistently across data types and decoding tasks (experience with transfer learning is a plus!). You will collaborate with our international BCI team, in addition to outside academic and industry organizations, in a semi-autonomous research role as we work together to develop an operating system for BCI applications.YouHave a master’s degree (or equivalent) in a relevant field (e.g. neuroscience, electrical engineering, physics, or mathematics)Are fluent with Python and experienced with Jupyter notebooksHave experience in at least one of the following: neuroscience, BCI experimentation and neural signal processingHave experience with working with deep learning libraries such as tensorflow or pytorchPlease include a link to your public code repository (e.g. GitHub) in your applicationBonus Points ForA PhD (or equivalent) in a relevant field (e.g. neuroscience, electrical engineering, physics, or mathematics)Experience with Python software development and/or data engineeringExperience using AWS infrastructure (EC2, S3, databases, IAM, etc)Experience with real-time systemsWhat do you get out of it??Opportunity to work on world-changing technologyCollaborative & friendly remote work environment (we're all nice 🤗)Good pay 💰Reasonable & flexible work hoursYearly retreat bringing together our teams from across the worldWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.EquityWorking at AE means receiving equity in some of our client projects and in the Skunkworks projects we incubate. The equity granted is priced at a value of $0 when you receive it. If it were otherwise, you’d be forced to pay taxes. But to be clear, there are no free lunches, only the choice of who pays for your sandwich.At AE, the equity you receive is not free to AE. We invest millions annually in Skunkworks projects - paying our employees to build technology for which no client pays a bill. We receive equity from certain clients, which means we accept less in terms of our billable rate. We then pass that equity on to our employees. Sure it’s priced at $0 on day 1 - a call option on a stock trading at $100 with a strike price of $100 is priced at $0 today for tax purposes, but you’d want to receive that option. If you received that option on a dozen stocks, you’d be fairly confident that some of them would be worth a lot more than $0.Offering this equity (by investing in Skunkworks or offering clients a lower rate) comes out of AE’s margins. Theoretically, we should be lowering salaries to compensate. But we’re competitive on that front as well. Over the long-term, we believe AE employees who stick around are likely to fare extremely well monetarily (no legal promises). We think long-term. You should too when you choose your employer.We are looking to hire people who think long term. People create exponentially more value here in their 3rd or 4th year rather than their 1st or 2nd, and that only increases. The value you create leads to more equity issued every year, and you retain it while you remain at AE or at a Skunkworks co that spins out, in order to free up equity for others, which is how we afford to be generous with the equity. Disclaimer: If you leave AE on good terms, you can retain 20% of your equity if you continue to send leads our way, share our core values, etc. If you leave AE for your own AE-incubated Skunkworks project (or someone else’s), you retain 100% of your equity. Folks create exponentially more value here in their 3rd and 4th years than their 1st or 2nd - we want folks who think long-term like we do.LocationAustralia (remote)Rejoice. Help is Here.Custom Solutions for Your Specific Needs.Our Expert Team will Help You Succeed.1434 Abbot Kinney Blvd - Venice, CA 90291

About Us Rous County Council is unlike other councils. We are a small and unique organisation with a big role to play across our region. We are deeply connected to our communities through our environmental services of bulk water supply, weed biosecurity, and flood mitigation infrastructure across various local council areas. The Role If redesigning processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness excites you, or implementing new technology solutions is your thing, then come and join the team as our Business Analyst. Don’t pass on this opportunity to work with a highly motivated and professional team to support the delivery of Council’s Digital Transformation initiative NOVUS. In this role, you will be responsible for translating our business requirements into new end to end business process designs supported by Council’s new technology solutions. We want you to bring your expert analytical and design skills, engagement, and stakeholder skills to drive this project. Immediate start. About You If you enjoy running workshops with internal stakeholders across all levels of the organisation, designing business processes and can respectfully challenge the status quo to support a continuous improvement culture, then this role is for you! Your previous expertise and qualification/s in IT, process improvement and business analysis will be utilised to ensure successful delivery of new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Enterprise Asset Management Systems (EAM) and the associated process changes. Come and make a real difference to the organisation by offering innovative solutions and gain satisfaction from committing to a project and seeing it through to completion. What we offer We offer a 9-day fortnight – that’s an extra 26 days off each year! We are serious about work/life balance (we are a supporter of flexible work arrangements, including work from home and flexible work hours). Ask us what can work for you, working virtually or live where others holiday – in Byron Bay or wider surroundings.  We are proud of our supportive environment for career development, ongoing learning and training, and an Employee Assistance Program. For more information, visit our Careers page www.rous.nsw.gov.au/careers, view the attached position description or email marit.schallert@rous.nsw.gov.au  A satisfactory health assessment, including drug screening and a national police history check and entitlement to work in Australia is a pre-requisite to an offer of employment.  Note: Location subject to change as Council prepares to relocate, some work sites, by 2024, to new premises at Gallans Rd, Ballina NSW 2478. Applications will be assessed as they are received, and this advert will close when the position is filled. Rous County Council is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and diversity across our workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply

Job DescriptionUnleash your E-Commerce creativity in Australia's Leading Footwear CompanyDrive company-wide e-commerce developments working with Headless CMS ArchitectureEnjoy hybrid working and say YES to more of life's BIG, little moments.At MFG we are more than just a footwear company; we are a trendsetter; an E-commerce fashion forward innovator, and a home to the latest styles in the industry. With a passion for footwear and a dedication to providing an exceptional shopping experience for our customers, we are on the hunt for a talented E-commerce developer to help us to achieve our next digital goal.More About The RoleOur E-Commerce team is driving exciting changes across our website with headless architecture and omni-experience for both our instore and online customers. Our culture is a supportive and inclusive environment supported by talented and passionate leaders across the customer experience sector. We have a work environment that supports 3 days work from home, and two days in the office where you can get to know your team. With a great café (with free barista coffee), a popular table tennis table, light and spacious commons area, and basketball courts, there are plenty of opportunities to build great relationships across the team while working your e-comm creativity.As part of our dynamic E-commerce team you will be responsible for:The execution of hands-on Ecommerce digital development and DevOps function. Working closely with internal and external multidisciplinary teams to continuously improve and optimise best-in-class technical software and business system solutions. This includes specific and complex projects within the e-commerce team and e-commerce responsibilities in cross departmental transformation projects linking project and BAU technical delivery.More about You;Our culture is our “special sauce”, we are looking for a team player with exceptional communication skills and the ability to flex their skills as a developer to bring broad-reaching benefits across MFG.To be successful in this role you will need;A minimum of 5 years of experience working in a fast paced E-commerce role ideally within a large retail enterprise.Confident experience in building Magento 2 / Adobe Commerce extensionsPrevious experience managing and implementing DevOps functions (Cloud infra, CI/CD, Automation)Good experience in solution architecting and building integrations between systems using REST/SOAP/GraphQL - proficient in using API tools such as PostmanFamiliarity with varnish, Redis, general caching conceptsSolid understanding of version control and experience using GITGood understanding of building server environment and configuring services required for Magento 2Proven experience in Agile Management software like Jira, ConfluenceYou're not expected to have 100% of these skills. We want you to grow and mature with the rest of the organisation. If you like working with a fun and creative E-commerce team, with visibility of a dynamic organisation, and the opportunity to grow then we invite you to explore this role - we would love to hear from you.More About UsWith more than 290+ stores and 2500+ employees nationally and a brand-new state-of-the-art distribution centre, we are Australia's leading retailer and wholesaler of fashion and comfort footwear, owning and operating some of Australia's most iconic brands including Midas, Mollini, Cinori, Mathers, Williams, Diana Ferrari, and Australia's largest online footwear retailer, Styletread!As a family-owned company, at Munro Footwear Group (MFG) we value our team, our loyal customers, and our dedicated suppliers. We work hard to play hard, we celebrate each other, and we believe every Team Member is an essential part of our ongoing success.Why You Are Going to Love Working At Munro;There has never been a more exciting time to join Munro Footwear Group as we continue to grow! We offer a flexible, friendly, welcoming team environment where continued support, training and generous Team Member benefits are provided, including discounts across all our Brands.Generous employee discount for you and your immediate family!An extra 4 days a year of ‘Life Leave'Flexible Paid Parental LeaveA competitive Salary PackageCareer Growth and development opportunities with a fun & friendly teamThrough our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) you'll have access to professional and confidential counselling and support services

Job DescriptionAbout Pinsent MasonsPinsent Masons is a multinational global professional services firm with a purpose – to make business work better for people. We empower our people to question how things are done and to be bold in their ideas. To encourage this we provide an environment where you can drive your career development, work flexibly and learn fast.\While legal services are at the heart of what we do, we are at a firm with a diverse array of teams and skillsets. We are a firm that relies on the work of our talented business operations teams in information technology, finance, business development and human resources to continue to drive the growth we have experienced since arriving in Australia in 2015.With offices in Melbourne, Sydney and Perth, we work on major projects and matters that are driving the building of key infrastructure and the transition to renewable energy across Asia Pacific. You will collaborate with our teams across the United Kingdom, Europe, Middle East, Asia and Africa and you will be supporting the work of 2000 lawyers widely considered to be leading lights in our sectors of focus.The OpportunityWe are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Datacentre & Cloud Engineer to join our Technology Services Production team in a newly created role in one of our Australian offices.Playing a crucial role in ensuring the growth, stability, security, and scalability of our datacentre, cloud, and office infrastructure, you will be bring a broad skillset with knowledge of the design, deployment, management, and optimisation of datacentre and cloud infrastructure, with a primary focus on Microsoft platforms. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on complex projects, develop your skills, provide expert-level support, and contribute to the growth of our cloud-based services.Main Duties And ResponsibilitiesUtilise your in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Azure to deploy and manage resources, ensuring high availability, security, and cost optimisation is in place.Leverage infrastructure as code practices to automate the provisioning and management of datacentre, cloud, and office resources using tools such as Terraform, ARM templates, or equivalent.Act as a 3rd line support resource for complex infrastructure issues, diagnosing and resolving incidents efficiently to minimize downtime.Monitor and assess resource utilisation, recommend scaling strategies, and optimise infrastructure for performance and cost-effectiveness.Implement and enforce security best practices, including access controls, identity management, and compliance standards, to safeguard our infrastructure.Maintain detailed documentation of datacentre, cloud, and office technical architecture, configurations, and procedures for reference and knowledge sharing within the team.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers and network engineers, to support application deployment and integration with cloud services.Remain up-to-date with emerging cloud technologies, best practices, and industry trends to recommend and implement improvements in our cloud infrastructure.Assist in the transition of on-premises logging, systems management and monitoring tooling to cloud-based platforms.Key Skills & ExperienceThree or more years of experience in a similar enterprise role.Demonstrable experience deploying applications and infrastructure into public cloud (Microsoft Azure).Demonstrable experience in deployment and management of virtualised environments, including VMware and public cloud Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS).Direct experience with identity and access management technologies and services (e.g., Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, LDAP) including relevant protocols e.g., SAML.Knowledge of public and private cloud ecosystems; for example, but not limited to SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, FaaS, CaaS platforms.Knowledge and utilisation of Infrastructure as Code provisioning and management tooling: Terraform, ARM templates, PowerShell, Bicep or similar.Direct, hands-on experience of working with traditional enterprise compute infrastructure advantageous: for example, but not limited to VMware, Netapp, Pure Storage, Cisco UCS.Experience of working closely with other teams within a technical and non-technical environment, both to obtain knowledge and pass on the firm’s strategic roadmap in an all-inclusive manner.Excellent analytical and technical skills, written, verbal, communication, presentation skills, planning and organisational skills.Organised and methodical, with the ability to work to targets and goals.What makes Pinsent Masons a great place to work? We have a global reach and a local feel. With 28 offices and 2000 lawyers operating across Asia Pacific, Europe, Africa and the Middle East, you'll be exposed to domestic, international and multi-jurisdictional high-profile work, yet be in an office where everyone knows your name.We do things a bit differently. Legal services are at the core of our business, however we have diversified into other areas providing complimentary services to clients through offerings like Vario flexible services.We like to be flexible. Our firm is professional and allows you to bring our whole self to work. Dress for your day and in your own style and participate in practices that support your wellbeing, mental wellness and work/life balance so that everyone can thrive at work and at home.We're lots of fun and very inclusive. You'll also have plenty of opportunities to participate in, and even run, social activities, diversity and inclusion networks, and charitable initiatives.Diversity and Inclusion At Pinsent Masons we value diversity and inclusion. We are committed to creating a better workplace where all our talent can succeed and feel like they belong. We want to attract, retain and develop people at all levels and encourage applications from all suitably qualified candidates whatever your ethnicity, religion, age, physical or mental disability/long term condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or any other characteristics protected by local law in the jurisdictions in which we operate.Please note we only accept CVs that are logged on the Recruitment portal.For more information, please contact Recruitment Manager Ellie Rosenberg via ellie.rosenberg@pinsentmasons.com.

About This RoleICT Security Systems Engineer and Analytics Specialist - RFQ-ASD-164-2023 - SOW 1 - OriginalExperienced Security Systems Engineer and Analytics Specialist required to develop and enhance ASD ICT security systems. The service provider will be responsible for activities and tasks relating to integrating and maintaining security assurance and continuous monitoring capabilities across the organisation. This role will include responsibility for implementation of major analytic-driven activities to meet required business outcomes.The Specified Person will be expected to demonstrate attributes of SFIA Level of Responsibility 5.Current Top-Secret Positive Vetting (TSPV) security clearance is strongly preferred, however candidates who have held a TSPV in the previous 12-month period (which has since been downgraded) may be considered.About The CompanyAustralian Signals Directorate (ASD) is the federal agency responsible for foreign signals intelligence, cyber warfare and information security. ASD's purpose is to defend Australia from global threats and help advance our national interests.Situated in Canberra, ASD employs over 2000 TSPV cleared workers. ASD's workforce is growing rapidly. Areas of growth include PMO, cyber security, systems administration and engineering, software development and network engineering.A top-security, complex and highly technical environment, ASD plays a vital role in the defence of Australia. Long contracts (12 months+) available.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop complex analytics across large and varied datasets to achieve insights and answer security-based business requirements.Deliver technical visualisation of proposed applications for approval by customer and execution by system developers.Engage with stakeholders to confirm that services meet the service acceptance criteria and are to the required standard.Ensure service coverage of in-scope assets, and assess and communicates associated risks to appropriate stakeholders and system owners.Develop integrations for multiple systems and data sources into a singular platform to enhance continuous assurance services.Skills & Experience NeededProven knowledge of information security principles, practices and technologies.Experience configuring and using vulnerability discovery and management applications using both on premise and cloud platforms.Australian Citizenship and a TSPV security clearance is essential.DESIRABLE: Knowledge of assurance approaches for security control baselines and benchmarks.BenefitsWhy work for ASD?Work on interesting and prestigious projects vital to the ongoing defence of Australia.Flexible work environment; work the hours that suit you between 7am and 7pm.Low attrition rate: the great variety of projects and opportunities across different business areas ensure few workers leave ASD.12 or 24 month contracts available.Fantastic growth opportunities available at any stage of your career.Why Kinexus?Kinexus has been supplying TSPV contractors to ASD since 2004 and have a strong relationship with them. We are one of just 9 suppliers Australia-wide.Our experience in managing contractors in defence/national security industries means we understand the requirements from the Commonwealth, insurances and clearances.DISP accredited; we can hold clearances and manage renewals.Dedicated account manager (me!) who is your dedicated POC and offer continuous contractor care.Rate negotiation guidance in line with the SFIA framework.Dedicated payroll assistant who facilitates your taxes and super.We proactively chase timesheet approvers to ensure you get paid on-time and error free.Regular visits to Canberra for coffee, lunches and quarterly drinks events.We can facilitate novated car leases, LAFHA or salary sacrifice.We'll keep you up to date with the most appropriate, interesting opportunities in your field.Community matters. Kinexus supports women in Defence through our female mentoring program and rewards referrers through our Referral Rewards scheme.Support for your health and wellness through counselling support (EAP) available for all contractors and their families.Kinexus is the leading recruitment partner to the defence industry in Australia. We support our community in making intelligent connections and create opportunities to help grow careers.All applications should include your resume as a word document. For more information, visit our website, www.kinexus.com.au or contact Cindace Prasad at 0449 511 324.
