This team is responsible for managing the creation and submission of the Firm's proposals, pricing, market research / insights and client engagement. The team also drives best practice business development processes across the firm.Your RoleA permanent opportunity is currently available for an ambitious Senior Pricing Analyst who thrives in a collaborative, proactive, and client-focused team that plays a pivotal role in supporting the Firm's profitable growth. As a Senior Pricing Analyst, you will have the opportunity to develop valuable skills in pricing, business development, finance, and project management whilst leveraging your commercial acumen to support impactful business outcomes.In this role you will have the opportunity to collaborate with bid / sales teams, client service teams, finance, other pricing team members and stakeholders to: Provide valuable and actionable pricing insights and financial modelling to the business with a focus on proposals and price negotiations, and for input into pricing strategy decisions.  Maintain and enhance the Firm's existing pricing performance reporting processes, including internal and market analysis.  Evaluate the commerciality of client and matter engagements and make recommendations for optimising profitability and value delivery.  Maintain and enhance pricing-related support information, including precedents, guidelines, benchmarks, standard commercial terms.  Collaborate with Finance and Data teams to enhance the Firm's pricing analytics and tool suite to enhance effectiveness, frontline empowerment and useability, with guidance from other pricing team members.  Contribute the latest thinking to ad-hoc projects, including the ongoing promotion of pricing best practice via Firm training and process innovation. More About You Experience in a pricing and / or commercial role, preferably in professional services.  Tertirary degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or other Management Accounting qualification.  Passion for leveraging data and analytics to solve business challenges coupled with strong numeracy, analytical, and problem-solving skills.  Excellent communication and presentation skills.  Highly collaborative with a diverse array of individuals in different functions, demonstrating a commitment to delivering high-quality and responsive outcomes.  Confident to thrive in a high-stakes, fast-paced, and collaborative environment.  Advanced skills in MS Office suite, especially Excel, and capability to work with large data sets with strong attention to detail.  Excellent time management skills and the ability to remain composed and focused under pressure. Not essential however considered highly desirable: Experience with business intelligence and data visualisation tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or Qlik Sense.  SQL skills and relational database knowledge.  Prior experience with Elite 3E and / or Jedox. Why MinterEllisonWe offer flexible working options to encourage balance, wellbeing and support for sustainable ways of working and a range of social, financial and health benefits, including free gym membership - all with no minimum tenure.We encourage applications from people of all ages, abilities, cultural backgrounds, genders (including trans or gender diverse), LGBTQ+ people and those with carer responsibilities. We particularly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.How To ApplyWe prefer to connect with people directly, so please submit your CV by clicking on the 'Apply' button. We encourage all applications, including if you do not meet the criteria listed for the role. Advancing careers. Advancing everyday life.Job DescriptionOaky Creek Coal, a Glencore Managed Operation, produces high quality export coking coal. We are a large, dynamic mine with a proven track record. We’re professional, take personal ownership and we’re committed to providing exceptional outcomes all while delivering safe coal. At Oaky we know it’s our people that make it all possible. Our culture promotes teamwork and rewards dedicated people with a can-do spirit, who take responsibility, and who have the drive to be leaders in their field. We expect a lot, but we give a lot in return. We recognise and reward exceptional work.Reporting to the Maintenance Superintendent, an exciting opportunity exists for an experienced Reliability Engineer to join the Oaky Creek Coal Engineering Team.The Role:In this role, you will be responsible for providing expert advice and support to site engineering & maintenance personnel with respect to reliability such that equipment performance is improved. The reliability engineer is to work with team members and provide guidance and direction in regard to equipment reliability to meet the mine’s targets, as well as provide systems and procedures to continually improve equipment reliability.In accordance with the Glencore Coal Assets Australia Asset Management Framework, the role will be focused on the identification and management of asset reliability risks that could adversely affect plant, safety or business objectives.Working with the production and engineering departments you will:Establish improvement projects and trends,Lead and facilitate root cause analysis driving loss elimination,Review production delay data to ensure operational departments are focusing on the real issues,Manage asset maintenance strategies and software,Provide recommendations for the engineering design out of repeat failures.The successful candidate will also have two condition monitoring technicians as direct reports therefore, skills in coaching, mentoring and leading are essential. You will have a desire to build relationships not only amongst your team, but also with the broader Oaky Creek North team.About you:Industry experience in either Electrical or Mechanical engineering.Qualifications in Engineering and/or Asset Management is highly desirable.Advanced Analytical and problem-solving skills.Exposure to vibration and oil analysis and NDT techniques is also desirableJust as importantly, we’ve worked hard to make sure you feel valued. In return, here are just some of the benefits we offer:Highly competitive mining salary plus annual short-term performance bonus5 weeks annual leave per yearAccess to Coal Mining Industry Long Service Leave - one of the most generous long service leave schemes of any industry in the countryGenerously subsidised housing, or permanently allocated camp accommodationRelocation assistanceOpportunities to salary sacrifice flights and/or enter into a novated lease vehicle arrangementPrivate Health or Salary Continuance reimbursement up to $3,500Active Lifestyle reimbursement for local amenitiesYears of service awards and Christmas giftsTown events and yearly Christmas parties Reimbursement for prescription safety glasses up to $600Employee Assistance Program (EAP), available to the whole familyProvision for education assistance if you are wanting to further your studies down the trackThe local town of Tieri has an exceptional standard of living and a vast array of facilities for adults and children. Visit www.tieri.com.au to see what its really like to live and work in this top little town.This is a Monday to Friday Rostered position.Applications Close: 1 November 2023.As per company policy, internal applicants should discuss their interest in this position with their manager prior to applying.For further information please email oakycreekhr@glencore.com.au.Glencore provides unrivalled career and development prospects, great communities and the opportunity to work with leaders in your field.

MyDeal StoryDiscover an online shopping experience like no other with MyDeal – the premier Australian retail marketplace that has been bringing shoppers the best deals, discounts and sales on home and lifestyle products since 2011.We pride ourselves on offering a curated selection of quality products from trusted retailers, so our customers can shop with confidence knowing they are getting the best of the best. Department : System DesignDivision : Future Energy SystemsReference number : 10843Senior Engineer - Future Energy Systems. The transition to a renewable energy system is occuring at a world-leading pace. It is an exciting, momentous time to be part of AEMO's mission. With flexible hybrid working arrangements this role is open to location across Australia. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Australia's journey to a more sustainable energy future! We are AEMO As the Australian Energy Market Operator, AEMO’s role is to design and operate a sustainable energy system that provides safe, reliable, and affordable electricity and gas today, and to enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians. Be part of an independent organisation that spans all aspects of the Australian energy industry, and that attracts the brightest people who are ready to make a meaningful impact. These incredible roles play a critical part in enabling secure operation of the power system as Australia transitions away from traditional synchronous generation, and towards firmed renewables and net zero emissions by 2050.About The RoleThe Future Energy Systems team sits within AEMO’s System Design division and has accountability for evolving an engineering roadmap to 100% instantaneous renewables and implementing a number of strategic technical projects identified within it. This includes providing a holistic view of the engineering needs of the changing energy system, helping prioritise approaches that resolve the most pressing technical issues, and initiating action across industry to enable the NEM to realise its potential to manage 100% instantaneous penetration of renewables.The Senior Engineer plays a lead role in providing technical support in ensuring the long-term security and reliability of the National Electricity Market and the power system. This includes providing technical advice, overseeing power system studies and/or data analysis, and managing projects that improve the design of the power system and energy market. The Senior Engineer will provide technical leadership to other team members.What You Will Be DoingThe Senior Engineer will lead projects to identify, quantify, and resolve the challenges that are emerging in the power system as the generation mix and energy market evolves to greater proportions of non-synchronous generation and customer engagement. This includes identifying the need for organisational or regulatory change and delivering projects and outcomes to facilitate these changes. The incumbent will lead internal and external stakeholder engagement and consultations for the work being undertaken and includes the provision of strategic advice across AEMO, seeking to facilitate an integrated business approach.You will facilitate the development of agreed company positions on future technical needs and proposed regulatory changes, coordinating multi-disciplinary teams to leverage the full range of skillsets across AEMO in addition to the development and support of a range of communications including reports and recommendations suitable for the Executive, Board, and external publication, clearly articulating complex technical matters in an accessible way to a broad audience, and presentations to internal and external audiences as appropriate.What You Will Need Relevant tertiary qualifications (preferably in Electrical Engineering with a power system focus) or equivalent relevant discipline or work experience  Demonstrated ability to manage multidisciplinary projects over a wide range of power system planning issues.  Demonstrated ability to review and finalise high quality technical documentation and reports  Demonstrated ability to analyse, interpret and summarise complex data and reports  Proactive and self-driven, outcomes focussed in working towards strategic objectives and ability to build and maintain constructive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders Desirable Ideally a minimum of 4- 7 years’ experience in the energy industry with exposure to power system design and operation  Strong knowledge and understanding of Power System and Electricity Market Systems with the aptitude to apply this knowledge to representative problems and situations  Basic competency in the use of network analysis tools  Basic competency in the use market application software to perform after the event market analysis  Competency in the use of software packages including VBA , and SQL Some Of Our Employment Benefits Flexible working: work from home, part time, job share, hybrid options, and additional leave options  Professional development via projects, assignments, industry networks, job rotation, study assistance and formal learning  Free salary continuance insurance and annual performance bonuses (subject to eligibility)  Up to 4 days volunteering leave per year  A comprehensive and professional Employee Assistance Program (EAP)  Special performance awards At AEMO, our core values aren’t just ‘words on a wall’ – we are a purpose-based organisation at the centre of our energy future, and we stand for integrity, inclusiveness, empowerment, and excellence.We actively encourage you to bring your whole self to work, so that together we can do better, be better, and love our work. For this reason, inviting difference and leading inclusively is a core part of our culture. We challenge ourselves to take bold actions to improve the experience for all our people, with a current focus on gender, flexibility, (dis)ability and our First Nation peoples. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, please apply now! For more information on the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) please refer to www.aemo.com.au or visit one of our social media channels below.

The OpportunityCandidate Hourly Rate - $38.50 plus super per hour.Location - leading Biotech HQ at Parkville A Quality Control (QC) Analyst to join the QC team in Parkville, Melbourne for 12 months on contract but could go longer. You will be reporting to the QC Team Leader or Specialist to help test the Q-Fever Vaccine, Antivenoms and Other Non-Influenza Vaccine Products (Non-IVV), known as the Products of National Significance (PNS) and Non-IVV. We’re a leading network of independent Australian firms, working together to enable growth and ambition for our clients. And our people. When you join Pitcher Partners, you’re joining a team with heart. We support each other. We learn together. We’re deliberate about fostering relationships that nurture and empower every individual. And we’re excited by what’s possible. We know some of the best new ideas come in the form of curious, talented people we haven’t met yet. Perhaps you’re one of them. Meet your team The Risk and Procurement Advisory (‘RAPA’) team provide outsourced internal audit services, specialist Cyber Risk services that assist in undertaking specialised IT engagements, and procurement advisory services.   The internal audit team aims to assist organisations achieve their objectives, by assessing their activities and risks and making recommendations for their improvement. To do this, the team works closely with our clients to develop a program of internal audits based on the strategic needs of the organisation. Our internal audit clients are spread across a number of industries;  Public sector (Local councils, water corporations,     education providers, environment management, statutory     authorities) NFPs and charities Commercial (Automotive, Property Development, Retail)  About the role The experienced internal auditor will be responsible for the execution of internal audit and risk-based engagements for our clients. They will take on a team lead position during the execution of the internal audit engagement while working with a manager and partner as well as leading junior staff. The position requires strong internal audit technical skills as well as client management and communication as it is a client facing role.  The expected internal audits are expected to cover diverse topics ranging from back-office administration (e.g. Payroll, Procurement, Accounts Payable) to bespoke operational areas and core business (e.g. NDIS, Asset management, Funding management, Business Continuity Planning). Key responsibilities  Internal audit execution (85%) Training, coaching and mentoring junior members of the team     (10%) Assisting with the development and presentation of     proposals for new business development opportunities, and     contributing to the continued growth of our practice by     participating in continuous improvement, knowledge sharing and     delivering strategic initiatives (5%)  Who we’re after Here are the key qualifications, skills and personal attributes we’re looking for. If you tick most of the boxes, but not all, we’d still encourage you to apply. Other capabilities you have may make you the perfect fit for the role, and we can work on filling the gaps together.  Required skills/experience   2+ years of internal audit experience Related tertiary qualifications in accounting, Commerce,     Law Science, Engineering or I.T Demonstrated experience in internal audit execution and     professional standards.  Great communicator, and able to effectively influence and     develop strong relationships with key stakeholders.  Critical analytical thinker, with strong problem-solving     abilities.  Detail orientated but able to clearly summarise key issues     and express them simply.   What we offer At Pitcher Partners we believe success is better shared. That’s why we invest in the future of everyone who works with us, and a culture that supports us all. Our inhouse leadership and professional development programs are tailored to your staff level and each explore how to lead with impact. Join a team with heart We actively support your health and social connection with a vibrant culture, great flexible working policy, 14 weeks paid parental leave, Community leave, Purchased leave program, Employee Assistance program, inhouse Massages and Pilates, free barista made coffee and more. Do work with a purpose We put a lot of energy into developing meaningful relationships with our clients and each other. It results in a level of trust that creates surprising opportunities for our business. And your career. Bring your best ideas We’re inspired by potential. We know there’s always a better way to do something. So we foster an environment of openness. Great ideas can come from anywhere. It all starts with listening. How to apply If you can see yourself as part of a team that’s all about people doing meaningful work, and leading with the best ideas, we want to hear from you. Actively improving diversity in our workforce is central to our purpose, and we strongly encourage people from under-represented backgrounds to apply. We’re proud to be recognised as a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for All Women. This is earned through our continued commitment to the careers of women, which includes offering benefits and policies that support diversity, equity, and inclusion. Visit the Work180 Pitcher Partners Melbourne page a full breakdown of our benefits. While we appreciate the role recruitment agencies play in our recruitment strategy, unsolicited CV’s will not be considered. Applications will close on 16/11/2023. Once advertising commences, we continually review applications, so encourage you to apply today if you can see yourself in this role.

You are a forward thinking Cyber Security specialist with an interest in furthering your career in cyber security and design. We’re supportive of internal growth and development offering amazing career opportunities. Together we contribute to securing and enhancing the financial well-being of people, businesses and communities.Your business:The Technology division delivers the Group’s information technology and banking operation functions, ensuring the highest level of customer service through world-class process excellence and technology innovation. Cyber Security protects the bank and our customers from theft, loss, and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk.We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half your time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few.Talk to us about how these arrangements might work for you. We’re hiring from across all of our technology hubs in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We really love working here, and we think you will too.Your new team:The Security Engineering team support the Group in developing and engineering innovative and market-leading offerings for customers that are underpinned by security, privacy and trust.The team supports the design of security controls across areas including: Application and Data security capabilities, Identity and Access Management, Fraud Protection, Infrastructure and Hosting Services, Networks and End User technologies.Your impact and contribution:As a Senior Security Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting end-to-end cyber security design across various initiatives within a variety of business units.You will work across numerous technologies including: microservices, containerisation, event-driven architecture, mobile applications and integration platforms, on-premise and cloud solutions- particularly AWS and Azure.You will be able to work with new and exciting technologies, while making a significant impact through design, architecture and delivery across a large-scale security landscape.You will: Contribute to and review design and engineering artefacts to ensure the Group’s policies, standards, compliance obligations and industry best practices are met.Partner with the wider business offering consultative support over security matters, including the recommendation of appropriate security controls for a given solution.Recommend the consumption and on-boarding of internal cyber security capabilities and support the business in navigating the end-to-end process.Identify control weaknesses in design and articulate risks relating to these.Lead and support ongoing automation across our security controls or build directly into the service/product delivery pipeline. There is also the opportunity to lead the build and implementation yourself or design the solutions partnering with other teams.We are interested in people who:Will bring technical expertise, supporting project initiatives across engineering and/or design, and are interested in working throughout a large-scale cyber security environment. You are proficient in managing technological risk, providing a wide range of cyber domain experience while delivering complex and innovative project solutions and services.You are able to consult with business and technical specialists to influence and design cyber security controls within new and modern deployment initiatives.This includes:Broad technical security experience, ideally with deep subject matter expertise in at least one domain e.g. network engineering, infrastructure design/implementation, cyber threat monitoring and response etc.Knowledge and experience of the Mitre Attack framework.Experience in identifying technological risks and working with stakeholders to manage these risks.Familiarity with DevSecOps methodologies is desirable.Able to operate with ambiguity and drive clarity through partnership.Willingness and ability to respectfully challenge the status quo.If this sounds like you and you are looking to join the Commbank family, then we’d love to hear from you!If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. About HealthShare Victoria HealthShare Victoria (HSV) is a state-wide organisation that partners with Victoria’s public health services and suppliers to coordinate strategic procurement. Over the last 12 months, we have delivered over $120 million in benefits to health services, and have over $1.16 billion in value under contract. We also played an important role in the Victorian Government’s COVID-19 pandemic response, securing essential personal protective equipment and life-saving equipment to support our health system’s readiness for the crisis.We are now entering an exciting new phase in our organisational growth as we expand to deliver a full, end-to-end supply chain across the state, which includes the opening of a 22,500 square metre distribution centre that will serve as Victoria’s new medical consumables supply chain hub.The Opportunity The Integrated Business Planning Analyst (IBP) Analyst will support the Demand and Supply Planning, Purchasing and DC Operation team within the supply chain function to improve and implement business process management framework.The IBP Analyst is responsible with keeping track of and maintaining project timetables and provide administrative to the IBP Project Lead.Key Accountabilities Include, but not limited to:Collaborate with IBP Project Lead and various internal/external stakeholders on key deliverables of relevant projects.Maintain and monitor project plans and project schedules. Report information on project progress, including metrics and challenges.Prepare and review submissions and report project activities and milestones.Provide administrative and operational support to the project team as required.Collaborate with Performance and Insights Team to gather data requirements and insights for the IBP process.Support the Demand and Supply planning, Inventory, and DC operation teams with any operational and process requirements and incidents to ensure delivery optimum operation and planning outcome.What You Will Bring:Relevant tertiary or post-graduate qualifications, preferably encompassing one or more of Business, Finance, Supply Chain, Data Science, Commercial or related field highly regarded.Minimum 3 years’ experience in project coordinator role within the manufacturing of FMCG Industry.Strong attention to detail with excellent problem-solving skillsProcess improvement skills and a passion for data quality.A strong IT aptitude to manage system related enquiries.The ability to build strong and effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders.What HSV can offer you:A great salary packageFull time ongoing position4 weeks of annual leave plus monthly Accrued Day OffAnnual Leave loading of 17.5%Flexible work arrangementsEaster Tuesday public holidayHSV is an all-inclusive employer. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disabilities, LGBTI, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds are encouraged.Probity checks are also conducted in the latter stages of the recruitment process.Applicants requiring flexible working arrangements will be considered.

With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Strong understanding of Mining operations as well the technologies currently used in Mining sector (at least 3 to 5 years)Ability to facilitate a team to consensus on scope, design decisions and implementation decisions.Ability to create detailed user stories and acceptance criteria.Experience defining software requirements for complex products.Ability to understand complex technical concepts and present them in simple terms to technical and non-technical stakeholders.Excellent knowledge of Agile principlesExperience of working with product owners to handle backlogs and new requests.Strong communication skills and customer service ethicSkills /Competencies:Essential: Tertiary Qualification in IT / Computer Science / related discipline.At least 5 years of relevant experience as an industry practitioner in Mining domain.Strong domain knowledge of Mining/Resources IndustryExperience of providing business analysis services in mining operations.Knowledge of ServiceNow and ITIL processesExperience in tools used for business analysis and project management.Good team collaboration, proactive time management and high attention to detail Preferred: Ability to work in team in diverse/ multiple stakeholder environment.Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment.Knowledge of Agile software development and project managementAdditional Skills: Excellent customer interfacing skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong attention to detail and outstanding analytical and Problem-solving skills.All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. the company valuesWork from the comfort of your homeGlobal travel up to 25% of time for internal and external eventsWhat We Are Looking For In YouUniversity degree in Computer Science or related software engineering expertiseYou have sound knowledge of cloud computing concepts & technologies, such as Kubernetes, Openstack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc.You have practical knowledge of Linux and networkingYou have Intermediate to Advanced level of Python programming skillsYou are a dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with peopleYou have a demonstrated drive for continual learningExcellent communication and presentation skills (English)You have great organisational skills and follow-up reliably on commitments Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal eventsWhat You’ll LearnOpenStack and Kubernetes infrastructureLinux Ubuntu and networking knowledgeWide range of open source applications and skillsWork directly with customers in a range of different businesses Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools What We Offer YouYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. Job DescriptionAbout Team Global Express/TGE (formerly TOLL):Providing superior customer experiences and operational excellence, Team Global Express is Australia’s largest intermodal logistics provider.An Australian owned business (established in 1888), we employ over 10,000 employees across over 150 locations. We build unique, innovative and tailored solutions across road, rail, air and sea; providing transport, logistics, and business solutions to customers throughout Australia and New Zealand.It’s a really exciting time to be joining TGE, investment in our business is currently unprecedented as we continue to expand our portfolios.What You’ll Do As a Business AnalystAs a Business Analyst, you’ll be responsible for supporting international operations, improving operational excellence and customer satisfaction. You will analyse and assess the effectiveness of end-to-business EDI integration operations, transport management systems (TMS), and partner/ customer systems. This includes analysing and identifying trends and opportunities within the air freight network, you’ll also help to improve operating strategic objectives for our international air freight business.What are we looking for in a Business Analyst? What’s important? 3+ years experience working within a business analysis position Expertise in complex data mining requests, typically leveraging data from multiple disparate systems Understanding and experience with IT EDI business systems integration Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, business, finance, economics, or related field Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, multi-task, and manage multiple prioritiesExtra Points For The Following (not Essential Though) Knowledge and/or experience of air freight operations, including air transportation Knowledge of e-commerce operations industryWhy TGE? Recognised by LinkedIn as being one of the top 10 Australian companies to grow your career (2023) Competitive salaries, 82% of our employees considered salaries competitive/high (Seek) Up to 14 weeks paid primary carers parental leave Superannuation for unpaid parental leave up to 12 months (additional 6 months for extended care) Uncompromising dedication to the safety of all our employees Staff discounts via the likes of Coles Express, G’Day Rewards, Officeworks & Hertz etc. Onsite/End of Trip Amenities (Parking/bike racks, showers, breakout rooms, change rooms, lockers etc.) Excellent career development/advancement opportunities Learning & Development, currently implementing our very own training academy Employee Recognition & Rewards Programs We offer our staff an employee assistance program, encouraging well-being & mental health Nominated ‘Best Carrier’ (NORA Solution Partner Awards) Official logistics provider for FIFA’s Women’s World Cup Supported by Allegro Funds (Australia’s largest transformation private equity firm) Our sector is very secure, much sought after, growing, and worth over $115 billion AUD every year Awarded ‘Leader within Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG)’, by the Australian Logistics Council Strong Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) business modelSeeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be sometimes confronting, imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with your confidence. At TGE there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate’. Please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day!Diversity and InclusionWe celebrate difference.Why Team Global Express - Team Global ExpressWe believe nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace, which celebrates different points of view and gives everyone the chance to contribute, as we build to a bigger and brighter future.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.To be considered, you must be entitled to work in the specified country and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment.It’s never been a more exciting time to join our team.As we transform into a truly iconic Australian business, your opportunities for growth with us are limitless.To find out more about us, visit About - Team Global Express

Our StoryAs a start-up business inside one of Australia's largest retailers, WooliesX aims to bring the best of Woolworths to our customers, powered by our team, technology and data. To achieve our customer 1st strategy, we have combined the Digital, eCommerce, Customer Loyalty and Financial Services businesses to transform the customer experience under one banner - WooliesX.Having been awarded the Canstar Blue Award for No.1 in Customer Satisfaction for online groceries,and more recently being voted the most popular Loyalty Program in Australia, we’re proud of the work we do and are being recognised for delivering innovative and best in class service that is convenient,frictionless and personalised to our customers. With an industry leading technology team, backed by analytics, we’re resourceful and willing to experiment. Our agile teams are empowered to innovate and deliver an awesome experience for our customers - no matter whether they choose to shop in-store, or online.The PositionReporting to BA Chapter Lead you will play a key leadership role within a leading digital organisation to ensure business and customer outcomes are achieved. This particular role is for an experienced Senior Business Analyst with strong communication skills and an ability to build relationships with varied groups of stakeholders both internal and external. It requires the BA to understand the customer and user perspective and demonstrate collaboration to drive business outcomes. The role requires the BA to have a sound understanding of integration patterns like API, Web services etc and sufficient exposure to writing SQL queries to extract data. Experience in data analytics, AI, and reporting is an added advantage.Your Key Responsibilities Will IncludeAssisting the product team with building and maintaining the backlog, ensuring all requirements and user stories align to product strategy.Collaborating with key stakeholders and team to find the right solutions to solve the most valuable and interesting problemsTranslating requirements into high quality user stories, including personas and acceptance criteria, ensuring the stories can be tested both functionally and non-functionallyBeing able to formulate user stories for integration based features with sufficient technical detailsSupporting the squad members in project activities when necessary , demonstrating flexibility to jump roles to serve the teamProficient in writing SQL queries to extract data and derive insights from the gathered dataThis role is in a fast paced domain, the Senior BA must be able to prioritise workload and manage this accordinglyEnsuring that all collaborative decisions provide the targeted outcome for the customer, the business, the product and tribe’s missions and ensuring the team is always focusing on the right prioritiesAbout YouComing from a digital background, you will demonstrate business acumen, excellent communication and technical know-how that will help drive success. You’re as comfortable facilitating sessions with stakeholders as you are with breaking down bugs and getting into the technical nitty gritty with the team. You’re able to narrow in on the data and the detail, and widen to see the bigger picture. Most importantly, you should have a strategy and skills to take an idea from inception to delivery.Further To This You Will HaveDemonstrated experience in delivering agile initiatives in high performing teams as a Senior business analyst in a digital environmentDemonstrated analysis experience delivering innovative initiativesStrong analytical and problem solving skillsData driven but able to make judgement calls when necessaryExperience in Jira/Confluence for managing boards and project documentation.Driven by delivery, delivering on time and to high standardsExcellent written and verbal communication/presentation skills.Innovative thinking and demonstrated problem-solving skills.Experience in data analytics, AI, and reporting is an added advantageGrow with the GroupAs an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.We’d love to hear from YouIf you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can follow us on LinkedIn or see more opportunities via www.wowcareers.com.au.

Role: AEM / Front End Engineer Location: Melbourne, AustraliaWork Type: Permanent Job Description:Translate business requirements into Adobe AEM specific implementation specifications, document UX design, architecture and ensure project teams go through the architecture reviews successfully.The Adobe AEM Lead Developer will play a vital role in the development, design, testing and deployment of Adobe Experience Management Web and Mobile solutions.Develop end-to-end content for the web site using the CMS component library & digital asset manager.Facilitate all website content request through QA to the production environment.Define and developing new page and component layouts.Manage digital assets and site architecture within the CMS.Create, manage and govern workflows and approval process.Insure authoring and publishing standards are created and maintained.Work with business units to provide technical scope and help define requirements.Govern the component library.Performance tune / identify configuration issues / implement technical best practices.  Qualifications Relevant Experience in Adobe AEM/CQ (4-6 Yrs)Strong understanding of web services development in Java using REST and SOAP protocols, and JAX-RS / JAX-WS specifications, and in particular, a strong understanding of REST-full architecture patternsWorking experience in Adobe AnalyticsAdobe CertificationKnowledge of other Adobe Campaign Modules (Message Center, Integration, Adobe Analytics)Experience in developing applications, components, templates, dialogs, and workflows using the AEM architecture (Sling, CRX, OSGI, JCR, WCM, DAM, CQSE)Web Development experience in HTML/CSS/Javascript

About Woolworths GroupWoolworths Group is a food and everyday needs retailer united by the shared purpose of creating better experiences together for a better tomorrow. With more than 1,400 stores across its Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, and fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer. A top 10 company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), Woolworths Group employs more than 180,000 team members and serves more than 20 million customers a week.Exciting new opportunity in Finance for an SBA to join the team accelerating Woolworths Growth opportunitiesPermanent, full timeSydney based with WFH optionsThe Opportunity Supporting one of the most exciting areas in the Woolworths Group, you will be working on a day to day basis with people who are maximising value for the Group through accelerated growth as a result of both M&A activity and commercial partnerships.This role will primarily focus on tracking the value created from key growth initiatives and drivers of performance to deliver against the investment case for Partnerships including Endeavour Group, PFD, Quantium, Shopper, MyDeal, Pet and others as well as exploring new partnership opportunities.Key ResponsibilitiesPerform and communicate monthly/quarterly analysis and insights on value creation and operational performance for Woolworths major partnerships. Proactively liaise with relevant teams to drive the forecast and insights on value creation initiatives. Perform analysis on performance to investment case of new businesses across the Ecosystem in conjunction with the BU finance teamsLead the partnership budget process with relevant partners, working closely with internal finance teams and the Partner finance teams Contribute to key forums to identify and track performance and achievement of delivery milestonesInfluence business decisions and work with senior stakeholders within the BU and broader Group ecosystemSupport the onboarding and integration of new partners in conjunction with the wider GrowthCo teamImprove team ways of working by introducing innovative analysis, systems efficiencies, improving processes and providing constructive challenge to all areasSupport setting OKRs, and resource allocationDrive positive team & culture outcomes within GrowthCoAbout YouIn Finance we have an overarching capability framework that brings to life 5 key capabilities that shape who we are, what we do and how we work together, these are; value co-creator, inspiring leader, trusted advisor, agile learner and insights generator. We are looking forward to hearing how you may have demonstrated these capabilities while also bringing the following to the table:A minimum of 4 years of relevant commercial experienceCA / CPA or other Finance Qualification preferred but not essentialExposure to major transformation projects or mergers & acquisitions / divestments with a specific focus on performance tracking of key initiativesStrong presentation and storyboarding skillsStrong communication skills, stakeholder management and relationship building skillsAdvanced analytical and problem solving skillsAble to communicate complex financial information to a broad audience; able to make the complex simpleAbility to prioritise team efforts to support business requirementsAdvanced experience using financial systems in a commercial environment e.g. Excel, Powerpoint, Google Suite, SAP, and GCPWhat Is In It For YouYou will be joining corporate Australia’s largest onsite finance team of over 800 team members. This scale brings complexity, challenges and opportunities for an extremely rewarding career Having a career with us means you are joining Australia’s largest retail group which is also at the forefront of innovation and modern ways of working. We are recognised as a WGEA Employer of Choice for Gender Equality, Work180 Endorsed Employer for all women along with Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ workplace inclusionFlexibility is valued and supported across Woolworths Group and covers flexible work hours and locations (including working from overseas for up to 8 weeks per year), flexible career opportunities, and flexible leave optionsCareer development sessions, internal networking events and mentorship/leadership programs to grow your career Team member discounts across all Woolworths Group and partner businesses, access to discounts in novated leases, share purchase plans, lifestyle and other attraction discounts Access to a digital platform that offers personalised programs for working parents, carers and people leaders through our partner in Gender Equality and Parental Leave support 4 weeks paid parental leave for all secondary carer’s. Working at Transurban is different; it's a place where you can see the benefits of your work play out in real life, every day. We create city-sized solutions-building and operating safer, smarter, and more sustainable roads-to solve pressing transport challenges that are slowing cities down.  About the role  We're seeking a Cyber Performance and Reporting Manager to manage, develop and maintain a set of reporting and insights content that can be used to communicate a range of cyber security topics, including cyber metrics and information to operational, management and governance stakeholders.You'll join an innovative team, who enjoy working collaboratively, support cross skilling and who are highly respected within the business.As our Cyber Performance and Reporting Manager you'll contribute to lasting and positive changes that shape the future of our cities and communities. It's meaningful, challenging and exciting work. Day-to-day, you will: Development of the Cyber Performance and Reporting strategy and roadmapEstablish and maintain an accurate and up to date cyber security reporting schedule with identified stakeholders and clarity over various reporting requirementsDrive the development and improvement of cyber metrics, data collection and content over timeManage reporting against Cyber team KPI's and business KPI'sSupport the CISO Australian Markets in achieving team outcomesManage Cyber Performance and Reporting Analyst resourceProvide leadership and direction for cyber risk and cyber security across TransurbanCollaborate cross-functionally across business boundariesThis role will suit someone with a curious mind and transferrable skills and experiences, including: Experience in the design, build and operationalization of a technical metrics reporting database and technology reporting functionVery strong skills in delivering a "polished product" in the appropriate form such as reports or presentations on time and with a high degree of accuracy.Excellent analytical, research and development of reports skills with the ability to collect and analyse complex material and data, and present it in accessible formatsExperience with integrated management systems in large companies.The ability to interpret data and present findings in a clear, concise manner both orally and in written format and with a high degree of accuracyExcellent work communication and team work skills at employee, team leader and manager level. If you meet some of these requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.  You'll continue to receive great benefits, including:  A range of flexible working and leave options, including the option to purchase an additional six weeks of leave each year16 weeks paid parental leave (regardless of gender or carer status), with no waiting period, with Superannuation paid during unpaid leave as wellLearning and development opportunities to support your career interestsHealth and wellbeing support-access to Headspace and our EAP program, wellness facilities, and moreShare offers and insurance benefitsSocial activities, community give-back programs and paid volunteer daysWe offer a range of flexible working and leave options, so you can balance your work and life commitments and interests. Have a conversation with us about how this could work for you. We embrace diversity with a foundation of safety, wellbeing and inclusion; where everyone belongs. We treat everyone with fairness, consideration and respect, regardless of gender, gender identity, marital or family status, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, religious beliefs, cultural or socio-economic background, perspective, and experience - whether they work for us or not. We want to ensure everyone feels comfortable and safe to express ideas, questions and concerns.  We strongly encourage applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds and lived experiences, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people living with disability. If you require any adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please contact us on careers@transurban.com.  Ready to help us keep cities moving? Apply today.  Desired Skills and ExperienceWriting Board/Risk committee papersDeveloping Metrics and reportingData Analytics & InsightsStakeholder engagementCommunication and Presentation skills

Please download a copy before commencing your application.Your Application Must IncludeYour resume.A cover letter outlining your motivation to apply for this opportunity.A statement addressing the Essential Criteria listed below (these may differ slightly from the Position Description, please only respond to the below in your application).Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field preferably in a DevOps capacity with subsequent relevant experience; or extensive experience and specialist DevOps expertise or broad knowledge in a relevant technical field; or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training.Demonstrated ability and experience with automation, application performance and configuration, system management tools and current web technologies. Experience supporting enterprise networks, databases or systems integration and desktop technologies including but not limited to Research Solutions and Interactive technologies. Demonstrated experience in service management, information security, Cloud and/or agile practices and processes within a continuous delivery and integration environment and an understanding or commitment to understanding the practical application of DevOps Engineering principles.Ability to make sound decisions within your sphere of responsibility and take responsibility for delivering to plan and on time.Please upload your Cover Letter and response to the requested Criteria as one PDF document. This document should not exceed 4 pages (approximately 2,000 words).For the full list of the selection criteria and role responsibilities, please download the Position Description (available in the Related Documents section below).Applications for this position will only be accepted from those with Australian residency or a valid work permit.Contact UsFor specific position enquiries, please contact Robert McCloskey, Senior Manager, DevOps Engineering on (02) 4921 7489 or via email at rob.mccloskey@newcastle.edu.auHaving Difficulties? Please reach out to us: employment@newcastle.edu.au Please note, we do not accept email applications.Closing date: Thursday 2 November 2023 at 11.59pm AEDTWe are excited to be Looking Ahead with you

Hybrid Working ModelPermanent OpportunityFederal Government ExposureExciting opportunity for a permanent, ServiceNow Developer to join a Federal Government AgencyHays are working with a federal government agency who are looking to hire a senior ServiceNow Developer to join their team.  The organisation leverage the ServiceNow platform for a variety of their core applications and are looking for a developer who can manage and develop the platform, build new modules and solutions to support development and undertake administration tasks to ensure its high performance and reliability. What you'll need to succeed Commercial development experience with ServiceNowPrevious experience as a senior developer working in a business/client-facing role.Extensive experience working in ServiceNow administration as well as exposure to building custom applicationsServiceNow administrator and developer certifications are desirable.Strong technical documentation skills What you need to do now  If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to katie.moorcroft@hays.com.au If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion about your career.

You are a forward thinking Cyber Security specialist with an interest in furthering your career in cyber security and design. We’re supportive of internal growth and development offering amazing career opportunities. Together we contribute to securing and enhancing the financial well-being of people, businesses and communities.Your business:The Technology division delivers the Group’s information technology and banking operation functions, ensuring the highest level of customer service through world-class process excellence and technology innovation. Cyber Security protects the bank and our customers from theft, loss, and risk events, through effective and proactive management of cyber security, privacy and operational risk.We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half your time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few.Talk to us about how these arrangements might work for you. We’re hiring from across all of our technology hubs in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We really love working here, and we think you will too.Your new team:The Security Engineering team support the Group in developing and engineering innovative and market-leading offerings for customers that are underpinned by security, privacy and trust.The team supports the design of security controls across areas including: Application and Data security capabilities, Identity and Access Management, Fraud Protection, Infrastructure and Hosting Services, Networks and End User technologies.Your impact and contribution:As a Senior Security Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting end-to-end cyber security design across various initiatives within a variety of business units.You will work across numerous technologies including: microservices, containerisation, event-driven architecture, mobile applications and integration platforms, on-premise and cloud solutions- particularly AWS and Azure.You will be able to work with new and exciting technologies, while making a significant impact through design, architecture and delivery across a large-scale security landscape.You will: Contribute to and review design and engineering artefacts to ensure the Group’s policies, standards, compliance obligations and industry best practices are met.Partner with the wider business offering consultative support over security matters, including the recommendation of appropriate security controls for a given solution.Recommend the consumption and on-boarding of internal cyber security capabilities and support the business in navigating the end-to-end process.Identify control weaknesses in design and articulate risks relating to these.Lead and support ongoing automation across our security controls or build directly into the service/product delivery pipeline. There is also the opportunity to lead the build and implementation yourself or design the solutions partnering with other teams.We are interested in people who:Will bring technical expertise, supporting project initiatives across engineering and/or design, and are interested in working throughout a large-scale cyber security environment. You are proficient in managing technological risk, providing a wide range of cyber domain experience while delivering complex and innovative project solutions and services.You are able to consult with business and technical specialists to influence and design cyber security controls within new and modern deployment initiatives.This includes:Broad technical security experience, ideally with deep subject matter expertise in at least one domain e.g. network engineering, infrastructure design/implementation, cyber threat monitoring and response etc.Knowledge and experience of the Mitre Attack framework.Experience in identifying technological risks and working with stakeholders to manage these risks.Familiarity with DevSecOps methodologies is desirable.Able to operate with ambiguity and drive clarity through partnership.Willingness and ability to respectfully challenge the status quo.If this sounds like you and you are looking to join the Commbank family, then we’d love to hear from you!If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest, x15ventures), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site, particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible, so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.Advertising End Date: 17/10/2023

Secure coding practices Experience with Agile methodologies Automated testing frameworks and processes. Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?Calling AI enthusiasts! Do you dream of a world where AI not only supports but fully runs education services? Does the thought of using AI to replace human decision-making thrill you? Then listen up because we have an exciting opportunity just for you!At Trilogy, we're on a mission to harness the power of AI to transform education. But we need someone at the helm who's not just an expert in AI integration and prompt engineering but who's also laser-focused on understanding and incorporating the latest in learning science.Your primary task? Take the reins to transition our human-run education services to be fully automated through the power of generative AI. Sounds like the kind of challenge you're up for? Perfect!Ready to step into the forefront of education technology? Apply today and start a journey that promises to be exciting, challenging, and super rewarding! We can't wait to hear from you!What You Will Be DoingUsing your technical acumen and tools like OpenAI Code Interpreter, LangChain, and AWS Glue to revolutionize our educational services.Unleashing the power of AI to make our services smarter with your knack for breaking down complex cases into component steps and designing AI prompts accordingly.Keeping us on track, thoroughly checking and validating our IDSs to ensure our AI solutions are on point and delivering top-notch services.Rolling up your sleeves, evaluating outputs, building prototypes, and doing whatever it takes to push the quality bar higher.What You Won’t Be DoingSpending your day delegating tasks. You will get hands-on in the research and data, building prompts and prototypes to find the best solutions.Wasting time in pointless meetings. Our asynchronous culture prioritizes written communication and moves decision-making and feedback out of meetings and into the comment section.Managing in the traditional sense. We believe the best managers lead by example, actually doing the work and setting a high-quality standard for their team.Training LLMs. We're interested in your ability to utilize LLMs, not train them.Basic RequirementsSenior Machine Learning Engineer key responsibilitiesA grasp of AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), and prompt engineering, including Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting and Self-Consistency in CoTEnough coding experience to assemble a set of prompts into a working prototype service in a single dayA mastery of self-learning. If you're the type of person who applies learning science to your own learning journey – you're our kind of people!A process-focused mindset. It’s all about designing simple, repeatable processes that allow a system to scale.Nice-to-have RequirementsExperience working with CodeInterpreter, LangChain, AWS Glue, and AI Orchestration tools to create 100% AI-based workflowsPrior successful experience automating manual processesAbout TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.What to expect next:You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.Important! If you do not receive an email from us:First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.Crossover Job Code: LJ-5011-AU-Perth-SeniorMachineL.001

The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.  Responsibilities• Solid understanding of data pre-processing (using Databricks), feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques • Experience working with Azure services and platforms such as Azure data scientist, Azure Databricks, Azure fundamentals and Azure devops. • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and Recommendation systems • Experience with data science toolkits such as Python and Data Robot platform • Proficient in Statistics • Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau • Experience in querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SQL, etc. • Experience with kubernetes, MLflow, and Azure Machine learning • Well versed with end-to-end Machine learning Models (or Deep Learning Models) deployment in production environment.If Interested, please share your resume to sangeeta@tascoutsourcing.com

OverviewInception is seeking a highly proficient and accomplished Applied Scientist, with a proven track record, to develop efficient deep-learning and generative AI algorithms and conceive innovative AI-centric models. This role offers a unique opportunity to work closely with our product development teams, applying emerging technologies across a diverse range of applications.The opportunityJoin a fast-paced, future-driven company and become part of a dynamic, forward-thinking team with the most extensive AI service repository and a mission to establish itself as the premier AI Platform-as-a-Service for businesses and developers alike.Inception is an AI research and deployment team of scientists and engineers that are committed to solving AI intelligence to advance science and benefit humanity. Since being founded in 2018, Inception has established itself as the center point of AI Research in the UAE. In 2022 alone, Inception published 36 research papers and deployed their commercial AI models across G42 divisions.Inception is an Abu Dhabi based artificial intelligence and cloud computing company with a global footprint delivering holistic and scalable AI solutions to a variety of commercial and government clients. Our unique approach involves strategic collaborations with universities and industry frontrunners, ensuring cutting-edge innovation and excellence in our services. The Group’s business operations cover a wide range of industry verticals including Healthcare, Government, Smart City & Smart Mobility, Oil & Gas, Fintech, Geospatial, Aviation, Cloud Computing, Big Data Analytics and Sports.ResponsibilitiesKey responsibilitiesYou will report to the Senior Applied Scientist and play a crucial part in pioneering research and development across various facets of AI, including but not limited to computer vision, natural language processing, and audio signal processing. Your work will involve the creation and optimization of cutting-edge AI algorithms and deep learning models, contributing to advancements in areas such as semantic understanding, multidimensional data interpretation, and human-machine interactions. Furthermore, your innovative efforts will be applied to a spectrum of practical use cases, serving pivotal industries such as finance, oil and gas, environmental science, and healthcare, thereby driving forward the frontier of impactful AI solutions in real-world scenarios.Functional Engage in the design, analysis and optimization of foundational and applied research to power the state-of-the-art AI algorithms and model capabilities at [ or Inception?]. This will involve staying well-informed of emerging trends, understanding and manipulating complex datasets, and conceptualizing models that are both innovative and applicable to real-world scenarios. Work on comprehensive solutions that integrate various modalities, including text, audio, and visual data, enhancing the AI's ability to understand and interpret human interaction in a more nuanced manner. Collaborate with researchers and engineers across teams at Inception for the design, development, and continual improvement of AI algorithms, ensuring the implementations of such algorithms are optimized for efficiency, reliability, and scalability. Work alongside product development teams to integrate new algorithms and models into broader product offerings, and conduct proofs of concept (POC) as per client needs, ensuring that these innovations translate into tangible benefits for users and stakeholders. Propose scenarios where AI techniques could improve the efficiency of the customer’s business. Provide pre-sales and post-sales technical support to the business development team.QualificationsSkills and attributes for successThe criteria for your success would include cost savings achieved, number of use cases investigated & datasets mined, number of innovations/POCs deployed, number of existing processes optimized, and customer NPS.To qualify, you must have M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in computer science, engineering, or AI-related field. Specialization in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing or Speech and Audio are highly desirable. Minimum 6 years of experience in developing AI algorithms for various modalities Track record of conducting high-level research, preferably evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals or a history of product-driven research and development.Ideally, you’ll also need A highly curious and inquisitive approach to problem-solving In-depth knowledge of the latest developments in AI and machine learning Excellent communication skillsWhat we look for:If you are a performance-driven, inquisitive mind with the agility to adapt to ambiguity, you will fit right in. You should be eager to explore opportunities to build meaningful collaborations with stakeholders and aspire to create unique customer-centric solutions. Bias for action and a passion to conquer new frontiers in the AI space is at the heart of the G42 community.What working at G42 offers:Culture: An open, diverse and inclusive environment with a global vision that encourages personal growth and focuses on ground-breaking, industry-first innovations.Career: Outstanding learning, development & growth opportunities via structured training programs and innovative, high-tech projects.Work-Life: A hybrid work policy to strike the perfect balance between office and home.Rewards: A competitive remuneration package with a host of perks including healthcare, education support, leave benefits and more.About G42G42 is a global leader in creating visionary artificial intelligence for a better tomorrow. Born in Abu Dhabi and operating across the world, G42 champions AI as a powerful force for good. Its people are constantly reimagining what technology can do, applying advanced thinking and innovation to accelerate progress and tackle society’s most pressing problems.G42 is driving change in the region and beyond, joining forces with nations, corporations and individuals to create the infrastructure for tomorrow’s world. From molecular medicine to space travel and everything in between, G42 realizes exponential possibilities, today.To confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us.G42 is the force that gets you further. Join us.

acceptance testing, training, and stabilization phases.Post-implementation, serve as a primary administrator for EFS, partnering with IT and the vendor on configuration and enhancements.Other development/testing/production cycle, as applicable, ensuring efficiency and high quality.Transparently report progress against the prioritized enhancement list on a frequent basis, promptly addressing constraints and issues as needed.Provide administrator support for other financial business systems, including our cloud-based financial planning and analysis system.Complete any additional duties as assigned or requested.Execute all job functions in a safe and secure manner.Requirements:A minimum of five years of prior experience as a business analyst or in a similar role.Bachelor's degree in business or a related field, or an MBA.Proven experience in financial systems and data, particularly related to accounting, budgeting, and forecasting.Advanced proficiency in using Microsoft communicate clearly, concisely, and accurately, both verbally and in writing.Experience in managing small to medium-sized projects using agile methodologies.A proven capacity to excel in a collaborative team environment.

Job Title: Business Analyst Location: New Jersey Job Type: Contract Position Overview: As a Finance and Banking Business Analyst, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze, and translate business requirements into actionable insights and strategies. You will be responsible for enhancing our financial services and banking products, ensuring their competitiveness in the market, and ensuring they align with regulatory standards. Your expertise will be pivotal in driving data-driven decisions and process improvements across the organization. Key Responsibilities: Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements related to finance and banking products, processes, and systems. Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can drive informed decision-making. Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain financial models to evaluate the performance of existing products and recommend improvements. Regulatory Compliance: Stay updated on industry regulations and ensure that financial and banking operations are in compliance with all relevant laws and regulations. Process Optimization: Identify opportunities to streamline and optimize finance and banking processes to increase efficiency and reduce operational costs. Risk Assessment: Conduct risk assessments and contribute to the development of risk mitigation strategies in the finance and banking domain. Business Impact Analysis: Assess the potential impact of proposed changes and provide recommendations to senior management. Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with IT, risk management, marketing, and other teams to ensure alignment and successful implementation of projects. Reporting: Generate and present reports, dashboards, and key performance indicators to track the performance of finance and banking products and initiatives. Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify opportunities for continuous improvement and best practices in the finance and banking domain. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field; Master's degree preferred. Proven experience as a Business Analyst in the finance and banking industry. Strong understanding of financial products, services, and banking operations. Knowledge of regulatory frameworks and compliance requirements. Proficiency in data analysis, financial modeling, and business intelligence tools. Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities. Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Preferred Qualifications: Professional certifications such as Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA). Experience with Agile or Scrum methodologies. Familiarity with banking software and systems.

Role: Business Analyst / Scrum MasterJOB DESCRIPTION: A minimum of 3 to 5 years of solid business/systems analysis experience and software development projects is required. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, Word, PowerPoint, required.  Experience working with Microsoft DevOps is highly desired. Experience with Microsoft DevOps is highly desired. Knowledge of Rules 60GG-1 – 60GG-5, Florida Administrative Code, is highly desired. Certified Scrum Master (CSM) is highly desired. Experience with directing and managing project resources is highly desired. Experience with configuration and customization of Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) products, is highly desired. Experience with data migration is highly desired. Knowledge of change and release management is highly desired. Preference will be given to candidates with knowledge of customer systems and applications. Experience working with Microsoft Power BI is highly desired.Please share resume to lawrence@indusgroupinc.com
